Original: Barret: C'mon newcomer. Follow me.
Dialogue: C'mon newcomer. Follow me.

Original: Biggs: Wow! You used to be in SOLDIER all right! ...Not everyday ya find one in a group like AVALANCHE.
Dialogue: Wow! You used to be in SOLDIER all right! ...Not everyday ya find one in a group like AVALANCHE.

Original: Jessie: SOLDIER? Aren't they the enemy? What's he doing with us in AVALANCHE?
Dialogue: SOLDIER? Aren't they the enemy? What's he doing with us in AVALANCHE?

Original: Biggs: Hold it, Jessie. He WAS in SOLDIER. He quit them and now is one of us.
Dialogue: Hold it, Jessie. He WAS in SOLDIER. He quit them and now is one of us.

Original: Biggs: Didn't catch your name...
Dialogue: Didn't catch your name...

Original: On-screen: Please enter a name.
Dialogue: Please enter a name.

Original: Cloud: ...Cloud.
Dialogue: ...Cloud.

Original: Biggs: Cloud, eh? I'm...
Dialogue: Cloud, eh? I'm...

Original: Cloud: I don't care what your names are. Once this job's over...I'm outta here.
Dialogue: I don't care what your names are. Once this job's over...I'm outta here.

Original: Barret: The hell you all doin'!? I thought I told you never to move in a group! Our target's the North Mako Reactor. We'll meet on the bridge in front of it.
Dialogue: The hell you all doin'!? I thought I told you never to move in a group! Our target's the North Mako Reactor. We'll meet on the bridge in front of it.

Original: Barret: Ex-SOLDIER, huh? Don't trust ya!
Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER, huh? Don't trust ya!

Original: Barret: If you push the Directional button while pushing the [CANCEL] button to run. (earlier marked
Dialogue: If you push the Directional button while pushing the [CANCEL] button to run. (earlier marked

Original: Barret: Yo! This your first time in a reactor?
Dialogue: Yo! This your first time in a reactor?

Original: Cloud: No. After all, I did work for Shinra, y'know.
Dialogue: No. After all, I did work for Shinra, y'know.

Original: Barret: The planet's full of Mako energy. People here use it every day. It's the life blood of this planet. But Shinra keeps suckin' the blood out with these weird machines.
Dialogue: The planet's full of Mako energy. People here use it every day. It's the life blood of this planet. But Shinra keeps suckin' the blood out with these weird machines.

Original: Cloud: I'm not here for a lecture. Let's just hurry.
Dialogue: I'm not here for a lecture. Let's just hurry.

Original: Barret: That's it! You're comin' with me from now on.
Dialogue: That's it! You're comin' with me from now on.

Original: Biggs: Code deciphered
Dialogue: Code deciphered

Original: Biggs: Think how many of our people risked their lives, just for this code...
Dialogue: Think how many of our people risked their lives, just for this code...

Original: Jessie: Biggs and I got the code for this door.
Dialogue: Biggs and I got the code for this door.

Original: Jessie: Code deciphered
Dialogue: Code deciphered

Original: Jessie: Push that button over there!
Dialogue: Push that button over there!

Original: On-screen: Switch On.
Dialogue: Switch On.

Original: Barret: Little by little the reactors'll drain out all the life. And that'll be that.
Dialogue: Little by little the reactors'll drain out all the life. And that'll be that.

Original: Cloud: It's not my problem.
Dialogue: It's not my problem.

Original: Barret: The planet's dyin', Cloud!
Dialogue: The planet's dyin', Cloud!

Original: Cloud: The only thing I care about is finishin' this job before security and the Roboguards come.
Dialogue: The only thing I care about is finishin' this job before security and the Roboguards come.

Original: Jessie: Push the [OK] button in front of a ladder to grab on to it. After that, use the [Directional button] to move up and down.
Dialogue: Push the [OK] button in front of a ladder to grab on to it. After that, use the [Directional button] to move up and down.

Original: Barret: When we blow this place, this ain't gonna be nothin' more than a hunka junk. Cloud, you set the bomb.
Dialogue: When we blow this place, this ain't gonna be nothin' more than a hunka junk. Cloud, you set the bomb.

Original: Cloud: Shouldn't you do it?
Dialogue: Shouldn't you do it?

Original: Barret: Jus' do it! I gotta watch to make sure you don't pull nothin'.
Dialogue: Jus' do it! I gotta watch to make sure you don't pull nothin'.

Original: Cloud: Fine, be my guest.
Dialogue: Fine, be my guest.

Original: On-screen: Watch out! This isn't just a reactor!!
Dialogue: Watch out! This isn't just a reactor!!

Original: Barret: ......What's wrong?
Dialogue: ......What's wrong?

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Barret: What's wrong, Cloud? Hurry it up!
Dialogue: What's wrong, Cloud? Hurry it up!

Original: Cloud: ...Yeah, sorry.
Dialogue: ...Yeah, sorry.

Original: Barret: Heads up, here they come!
Dialogue: Heads up, here they come!

Original: Cloud: Barret, be careful!
Dialogue: Barret, be careful!

Original: Cloud: It's gonna fire that laser...
Dialogue: It's gonna fire that laser...

Original: Cloud: Attack while it's tail's up! It's gonna counterattack with its laser.
Dialogue: Attack while it's tail's up! It's gonna counterattack with its laser.

Original: Barret: I dunno what's goin' on, but... it looks pretty bad. Let's see what it does when it's tail's up...
Dialogue: I dunno what's goin' on, but... it looks pretty bad. Let's see what it does when it's tail's up...

Original: Cloud: Come on, let's get outta here!
Dialogue: Come on, let's get outta here!

Original: On-screen: Ten minutes to detonation!
Dialogue: Ten minutes to detonation!

Original: Cloud: The alarm!
Dialogue: The alarm!

Original: Cloud: You all right?
Dialogue: You all right?

Original: Jessie: My leg got stuck.
Dialogue: My leg got stuck.

Original: Jessie: Thanks!
Dialogue: Thanks!

Original: Jessie: Code deciphered
Dialogue: Code deciphered

Original: Jessie: Alright, be careful.
Dialogue: Alright, be careful.

Original: Biggs: Jessie still hasn't come up yet!
Dialogue: Jessie still hasn't come up yet!

Original: Biggs: Code deciphered
Dialogue: Code deciphered

Original: Biggs: Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: Biggs: That should keep the planet going... at least a little longer.
Dialogue: That should keep the planet going... at least a little longer.

Original: Wedge: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Jessie: OK! Now everyone get back.
Dialogue: OK! Now everyone get back.

Original: Barret: All right, now let's get out of here.
Dialogue: All right, now let's get out of here.

Original: Barret: Rendezvous at Sector 8 station! Split up and get on the train!
Dialogue: Rendezvous at Sector 8 station! Split up and get on the train!

Original: Cloud: H, hey!
Dialogue: H, hey!

Original: Barret: If it's about your money Save it 'til we're back at the hideout.
Dialogue: If it's about your money Save it 'til we're back at the hideout.

Original: Flower girl: Excuse me. What happened?
Dialogue: Excuse me. What happened?

Original: Flower girl: Really? I don't know what's going on, but all right.
Dialogue: Really? I don't know what's going on, but all right.

Original: Flower girl: Oh, these? Do you like them? They're only a gil...?
Dialogue: Oh, these? Do you like them? They're only a gil...?

Original: Flower girl: What! Tell me! Uh,excuse me,would you like to buy some flowers? They're only one gil.
Dialogue: What! Tell me! Uh,excuse me,would you like to buy some flowers? They're only one gil.

Original: Flower girl: Oh, thank you! Here you are!
Dialogue: Oh, thank you! Here you are!

Original: Flower girl: Ahh...not again.
Dialogue: Ahh...not again.

Original: NPC: Just what the hell's going on!?
Dialogue: Just what the hell's going on!?

Original: NPC: Wonder what that is on the wall over there. Let's see...Don't be fooled by Shinra! Mako energy doesn't last forever! Mako is the planet's lifesource! The end is in sight! Protectors of the planet: AVALANCHE
Dialogue: Wonder what that is on the wall over there. Let's see...Don't be fooled by Shinra! Mako energy doesn't last forever! Mako is the planet's lifesource! The end is in sight! Protectors of the planet AVALANCHE

Original: Soldier: Hey! You there!!
Dialogue: Hey! You there!!

Original: Cloud: Shinra Soldiers......
Dialogue: Shinra Soldiers......

Original: Soldier: What the?
Dialogue: What the?

Original: Cloud: hmph!
Dialogue: hmph!

Original: Soldier: Halt!!
Dialogue: Halt!!

Original: Soldier: That's him!!Cloud: hmph!
Dialogue: That's him!!Cloud hmph!

Original: Soldier: Over here!!
Dialogue: Over here!!

Original: Cloud: hmph!
Dialogue: hmph!

Original: Soldier: That's as far as you go.
Dialogue: That's as far as you go.

Original: Cloud: I don't have time to be messin' around with you guys.
Dialogue: I don't have time to be messin' around with you guys.

Original: Soldier: Enough babbling...... Grab him!!
Dialogue: Enough babbling...... Grab him!!

Original: Cloud: What a pain......
Dialogue: What a pain......

Original: Wedge: Cloud never came.
Dialogue: Cloud never came.

Original: Biggs: Cloud...... Wonder if he was killed?
Dialogue: Cloud...... Wonder if he was killed?

Original: Barret: No way!!
Dialogue: No way!!

Original: Jessie: Cloud......
Dialogue: Cloud......

Original: Biggs: Say, do you think Cloud's...... Going to fight to the end for AVALANCHE!?
Dialogue: Say, do you think Cloud's...... Going to fight to the end for AVALANCHE!?

Original: Barret: The hell would I know!? Do I look like a mind reader? Hmph!! If y'all weren't such screw-ups...
Dialogue: The hell would I know!? Do I look like a mind reader? Hmph!! If y'all weren't such screw-ups...

Original: Wedge: Hey, Barret! What about our money...? Uh, nothin'...sorry. Ahhh......
Dialogue: Hey, Barret! What about our money...? Uh, nothin'...sorry. Ahhh......

Original: Wedge: Cloud!!
Dialogue: Cloud!!

Original: Biggs: Cloud!!
Dialogue: Cloud!!

Original: Jessie: Cloud......
Dialogue: Cloud......

Original: Cloud: Looks like I'm a little late.
Dialogue: Looks like I'm a little late.

Original: Barret: You damn right, you're late!! Come waltzin' in here makin' a big scene!
Dialogue: You damn right, you're late!! Come waltzin' in here makin' a big scene!

Original: Cloud: It's no big deal. Just what I always do.
Dialogue: It's no big deal. Just what I always do.

Original: Barret: Shi't! Havin' everyone worried like that you don't give a damn 'bout no one but yourself!
Dialogue: Shi't! Havin' everyone worried like that you don't give a damn 'bout no one but yourself!

Original: Cloud: Hmm...... You were worried about me!
Dialogue: Hmm...... You were worried about me!

Original: Barret: Wha!? I'm takin' it outta your money, hot stuff!
Dialogue: Wha!? I'm takin' it outta your money, hot stuff!

Original: Barret: Wake up! We're movin' out! Follow me!
Dialogue: Wake up! We're movin' out! Follow me!

Original: Wedge: Hey, Cloud!! You were great back there!
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud!! You were great back there!

Original: Biggs: Heh heh......Cloud! We'll do even better next time.
Dialogue: Heh heh......Cloud! We'll do even better next time.

Original: Jessie: Be careful, I'll shut this.
Dialogue: Be careful, I'll shut this.

Original: Jessie: Oh, Cloud!! Your face is pitch-black......
Dialogue: Oh, Cloud!! Your face is pitch-black......

Original: Jessie: There you go!
Dialogue: There you go!

Original: Jessie: Say, thanks for helping me back there at the Reactor!
Dialogue: Say, thanks for helping me back there at the Reactor!

Original: On-screen: Last train out of Sector 8 Station. Last stop is Sector 7, Train Graveyard. Expected time of arrival is 12:23AM, Midgar Standard Time...
Dialogue: Last train out of Sector 8 Station. Last stop is Sector 7, Train Graveyard. Expected time of arrival is 1223AM, Midgar Standard Time...

Original: NPC: This is why I hate the last train. Hoo-boy...
Dialogue: This is why I hate the last train. Hoo-boy...

Original: NPC: Huh...? This is my house, so make yourselves at home.
Dialogue: Huh...? This is my house, so make yourselves at home.

Original: NPC: You see the headlines in the Shinra Times? The terrorists that bombed the No. 1 Reactor are based somewhere in the slums. ...blowing up a Reactor... they sure put some thought into this one. They must have a real calculating leader. I wonder what they'll do next?
Dialogue: You see the headlines in the Shinra Times? The terrorists that bombed the No. 1 Reactor are based somewhere in the slums. ...blowing up a Reactor... they sure put some thought into this one. They must have a real calculating leader. I wonder what they'll do next?

Original: Barret: Stop actin' like a damn kid. Si'down an' shu'up!
Dialogue: Stop actin' like a damn kid. Si'down an' shu'up!

Original: Biggs: It seems this train hasn't switched to security mode yet. I'm sure that will change by tomorrow.
Dialogue: It seems this train hasn't switched to security mode yet. I'm sure that will change by tomorrow.

Original: Biggs: ...YAWN...that sure took its toll on me. I'm gonna sleep till we get to the station.
Dialogue: ...YAWN...that sure took its toll on me. I'm gonna sleep till we get to the station.

Original: Wedge: Someday AVALANCHE's gonna be famous ...and me, too!
Dialogue: Someday AVALANCHE's gonna be famous ...and me, too!

Original: Wedge: Cloud!! Don't ya think I got a bright future ahead of me?
Dialogue: Cloud!! Don't ya think I got a bright future ahead of me?

Original: Wedge: All my life, I felt like nothin' but a sidekick. But, after joinin' AVALANCHE and tryin' to save the Planet, I feel like I can do lots of things.
Dialogue: All my life, I felt like nothin' but a sidekick. But, after joinin' AVALANCHE and tryin' to save the Planet, I feel like I can do lots of things.

Original: Wedge: Oh man, that's pretty harsh, Cloud. You really think I won't?
Dialogue: Oh man, that's pretty harsh, Cloud. You really think I won't?

Original: NPC: Please!! You're bothering the other passengers.
Dialogue: Please!! You're bothering the other passengers.

Original: Jessie: Hey, Cloud. You want to look at this with me? It's a map of the Midgar Rail System. Let's look at it together. I'll explain it to you.
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. You want to look at this with me? It's a map of the Midgar Rail System. Let's look at it together. I'll explain it to you.

Original: Jessie: I like this kinda stuff. Bombs and monitors...you know, flashy stuff.
Dialogue: I like this kinda stuff. Bombs and monitors...you know, flashy stuff.

Original: Jessie: Okay, it's about to start.
Dialogue: Okay, it's about to start.

Original: Jessie: This is a complete model of the city of Midgar. It's about a 1/10000 scale. The top plate is about 50 meters above ground. A main support structure holds the plate up in the center, and there are other support structures built in each section... psst...whisper...whisper... (The No. 1 Reactor we blew up was in the northern section.) Then there's No.2, No.3 all the way up to the No.8 Reactor. The 8 Reactors provide Midgar with electricity. Each town used to have a name, but no one in Midgar remembers them. Instead of names, we refer to them by numbered sectors. That's the kind of place this is.
Dialogue: This is a complete model of the city of Midgar. It's about a 1/10000 scale. The top plate is about 50 meters above ground. A main support structure holds the plate up in the center, and there are other support structures built in each section... psst...whisper...whisper... (The No. 1 Reactor we blew up was in the northern section.) Then there's No.2, No.3 all the way up to the No.8 Reactor. The 8 Reactors provide Midgar with electricity. Each town used to have a name, but no one in Midgar remembers them. Instead of names, we refer to them by numbered sectors. That's the kind of place this is.

Original: Jessie: Phew..., this is next! Look.
Dialogue: Phew..., this is next! Look.

Original: Jessie: This is the route this train is on. The route spirals around the main support structure. We should be coming around the center area, right now. At each checkpoint, an ID sensor device is set up. It can check the identities and background on each and every passenger on the train by linking it up to the central data bank at Shinra headquarters. whisper...whisper... (Anyone could tell that we look suspicious, so we're using fake ID's.)
Dialogue: This is the route this train is on. The route spirals around the main support structure. We should be coming around the center area, right now. At each checkpoint, an ID sensor device is set up. It can check the identities and background on each and every passenger on the train by linking it up to the central data bank at Shinra headquarters. whisper...whisper... (Anyone could tell that we look suspicious, so we're using fake ID's.)

Original: Jessie: Speak of the devil... That light means that we're in the ID Security Check area. ...whisper...whisper... (When the lights go off, you never know what kind of creeps'll come out.) ...anyhow, we're almost back now. That's a relief.
Dialogue: Speak of the devil... That light means that we're in the ID Security Check area. ...whisper...whisper... (When the lights go off, you never know what kind of creeps'll come out.) ...anyhow, we're almost back now. That's a relief.

Original: Biggs: ...snore...heebeebeeheebee...snore... (Don't act so damn big, Barret...snooze...)
Dialogue: ...snore...heebeebeeheebee...snore... (Don't act so damn big, Barret...snooze...)

Original: Wedge: I'm seein' stars. This sucks. I hate the dark.
Dialogue: I'm seein' stars. This sucks. I hate the dark.

Original: Jessie: I know! Next time, I'll give you one I made myself.
Dialogue: I know! Next time, I'll give you one I made myself.

Original: Jessie: Oh yeah, you might regret it. I'm the type who takes things personal.
Dialogue: Oh yeah, you might regret it. I'm the type who takes things personal.

Original: Jessie: Okay, then I'll put a little extra effort in and make it with a BANG.
Dialogue: Okay, then I'll put a little extra effort in and make it with a BANG.

Original: Jessie: We're almost there. After talking with you, I really want to do it! I think you've lit my fuse!
Dialogue: We're almost there. After talking with you, I really want to do it! I think you've lit my fuse!

Original: Barret: Look...you can see the surface now. This city don't have no day or night. If that plate weren't there... we could see the sky.
Dialogue: Look...you can see the surface now. This city don't have no day or night. If that plate weren't there... we could see the sky.

Original: Cloud: A floating city... Pretty unsettling scenery.
Dialogue: A floating city... Pretty unsettling scenery.

Original: Barret: Huh? Never expect ta hear that outta someone like you. ...you jes' full of surprises.
Dialogue: Huh? Never expect ta hear that outta someone like you. ...you jes' full of surprises.

Original: Barret: The upper world...a city on a plate... It's 'cuz of that &^#$# 'pizza', that people underneath are sufferin'! And the city below is full of polluted air. On topa that, the Reactor keeps drainin' up all the energy.
Dialogue: The upper world...a city on a plate... It's 'cuz of that &^#$# 'pizza', that people underneath are sufferin'! And the city below is full of polluted air. On topa that, the Reactor keeps drainin' up all the energy.

Original: Cloud: Then why doesn't everyone move onto the Plate?
Dialogue: Then why doesn't everyone move onto the Plate?

Original: Barret: Dunno. Probably 'cuz they ain't got no money. Or, maybe... 'Cuz they love their land, no matter how polluted it gets.
Dialogue: Dunno. Probably 'cuz they ain't got no money. Or, maybe... 'Cuz they love their land, no matter how polluted it gets.

Original: Cloud: I know... no one lives in the slums because they want to. It's like this train. It can't run anywhere except where its rails take it.
Dialogue: I know... no one lives in the slums because they want to. It's like this train. It can't run anywhere except where its rails take it.

Original: Barret: Yo!! Get over here, all'ya!!
Dialogue: Yo!! Get over here, all'ya!!

Original: Barret: Yo, Cloud! You lissen up!
Dialogue: Yo, Cloud! You lissen up!

Original: Barret: This mission was a success. But don't get lazy now. The hard part's still to come! Don't y'all be scared of that explosion! Cause the next one's gonna be bigger than that! Meet back at the hideout!! Move out!
Dialogue: This mission was a success. But don't get lazy now. The hard part's still to come! Don't y'all be scared of that explosion! Cause the next one's gonna be bigger than that! Meet back at the hideout!! Move out!

Original: Barret: Ok! Go on ahead.
Dialogue: Ok! Go on ahead.

Original: Barret: You! Cloud!! Get off your slow-movin' ass!!
Dialogue: You! Cloud!! Get off your slow-movin' ass!!

Original: Barret: Heh heh... You wanna meet your little baby?
Dialogue: Heh heh... You wanna meet your little baby?

Original: Barret: Hey! Don' act like you don't know what I mean! I'm tellin' you...
Dialogue: Hey! Don' act like you don't know what I mean! I'm tellin' you...

Original: Barret: Heh! Jes calm down. Can't have people suspectin' us.
Dialogue: Heh! Jes calm down. Can't have people suspectin' us.

Original: Marlene: Papa!!
Dialogue: Papa!!

Original: Tifa: Marlene! Aren't you going to say anything to Cloud? Welcome home, Cloud. Looks like everything went well. Did you fight with Barret?
Dialogue: Marlene! Aren't you going to say anything to Cloud? Welcome home, Cloud. Looks like everything went well. Did you fight with Barret?

Original: Tifa: I should have known. He's always pushing people around, and you've always been in fights ever since you were little. I was worried.
Dialogue: I should have known. He's always pushing people around, and you've always been in fights ever since you were little. I was worried.

Original: Tifa: Hmm. You've grown up. When you were little you used to get into fights at the drop of a hat.
Dialogue: Hmm. You've grown up. When you were little you used to get into fights at the drop of a hat.

Original: On-screen: Please enter a name.
Dialogue: Please enter a name.

Original: Tifa: Flowers? How nice... You almost never see them here in the slums. But... A flower for me? Oh Cloud, you shouldn't have...
Dialogue: Flowers? How nice... You almost never see them here in the slums. But... A flower for me? Oh Cloud, you shouldn't have...

Original: Cloud: No big.
Dialogue: No big.

Original: Tifa: Thank you, Cloud. It smells wonderful. Maybe I should fill the store with flowers. Cloud, this one still has roots. I can probably start others from it.
Dialogue: Thank you, Cloud. It smells wonderful. Maybe I should fill the store with flowers. Cloud, this one still has roots. I can probably start others from it.

Original: Tifa: I'm so glad everyone's safe.
Dialogue: I'm so glad everyone's safe.

Original: Biggs: Aaah!! Nothin' like that first drink after a job. Hic!! Why don't you have one too?
Dialogue: Aaah!! Nothin' like that first drink after a job. Hic!! Why don't you have one too?

Original: Biggs: What!? You tellin' me you're too good to drink with me? Don't act big-headed jus' because you were in SOLDIER!
Dialogue: What!? You tellin' me you're too good to drink with me? Don't act big-headed jus' because you were in SOLDIER!

Original: Biggs: Oh!! That's more like it!! Even if you were with SOLDIER, you're still a rookie here. So you'd better listen to whatever I tell ya!
Dialogue: Oh!! That's more like it!! Even if you were with SOLDIER, you're still a rookie here. So you'd better listen to whatever I tell ya!

Original: Biggs: Hic...!! Oh...... Don't tell Barret what I jus said.
Dialogue: Hic...!! Oh...... Don't tell Barret what I jus said.

Original: Wedge: Oh, Cloud! Tifa really knows how to cook. Mmm, mmm...... Anyway, let me tell you somethin'
Dialogue: Oh, Cloud! Tifa really knows how to cook. Mmm, mmm...... Anyway, let me tell you somethin'

Original: Wedge: Tifa always lets me taste her cooking. And look at me now, I'm rolly-polly. Don't know whether I should be happy or sad. But it's the good food and drinks that make this shop famous.
Dialogue: Tifa always lets me taste her cooking. And look at me now, I'm rolly-polly. Don't know whether I should be happy or sad. But it's the good food and drinks that make this shop famous.

Original: Wedge: Cloud...... ......forget it.
Dialogue: Cloud...... ......forget it.

Original: Jessie: Careless...... You're getting all excited. Wonder what for......?
Dialogue: Careless...... You're getting all excited. Wonder what for......?

Original: Tifa: Sorry, Cloud. Marlene seems a little shy.
Dialogue: Sorry, Cloud. Marlene seems a little shy.

Original: Marlene: Papa, welcome home!
Dialogue: Papa, welcome home!

Original: Barret: Yeah. Huh? Where'd you get that flower?
Dialogue: Yeah. Huh? Where'd you get that flower?

Original: Marlene: Cloud gave it to me.
Dialogue: Cloud gave it to me.

Original: Barret: Oh...... Did you thank him? ............
Dialogue: Oh...... Did you thank him? ............

Original: Marlene: Thank you, Cloud. We'll take care of you.
Dialogue: Thank you, Cloud. We'll take care of you.

Original: Tifa: You all right, Barret?
Dialogue: You all right, Barret?

Original: Barret: Great!!
Dialogue: Great!!

Original: Barret: Get in here, fools!! We're startin' the meetin'!!
Dialogue: Get in here, fools!! We're startin' the meetin'!!

Original: Tifa: Cloud... come over here.
Dialogue: Cloud... come over here.

Original: Tifa: Sit down. How about... ...something to drink?
Dialogue: Sit down. How about... ...something to drink?

Original: Tifa: OHH!! I can make a drink just as good as anyone else. Everyone says, my drinks taste the best!
Dialogue: OHH!! I can make a drink just as good as anyone else. Everyone says, my drinks taste the best!

Original: Tifa: Just a minute. I'll make one for you.
Dialogue: Just a minute. I'll make one for you.

Original: Tifa: You know, I'm relieved you made it back safely.
Dialogue: You know, I'm relieved you made it back safely.

Original: Cloud: What's with you all of a sudden? That wasn't even a tough job.
Dialogue: What's with you all of a sudden? That wasn't even a tough job.

Original: Tifa: I guess not... You were in SOLDIER. Make sure you get your pay from Barret.
Dialogue: I guess not... You were in SOLDIER. Make sure you get your pay from Barret.

Original: Cloud: Don't worry. Once I get that money, I'm outta here.
Dialogue: Don't worry. Once I get that money, I'm outta here.

Original: Tifa: Cloud. Are you feeling all right?
Dialogue: Cloud. Are you feeling all right?

Original: Cloud: ...yeah... Why?
Dialogue: ...yeah... Why?

Original: Tifa: No reason. You just look a little tired I guess.
Dialogue: No reason. You just look a little tired I guess.

Original: Tifa: You'd better go down below.
Dialogue: You'd better go down below.

Original: President Shinra: .........today the No.1 Reactor was bombed. The terrorist group AVALANCHE has claimed responsibility for the bombing. It is expected that AVALANCHE will continue its reign of terror. But citizens of Midgar, there is no need to fear. I have immediately mobilized SOLDIER to protect our citizenry against this senseless violence. Thank you and good night.
Dialogue: .........today the No.1 Reactor was bombed. The terrorist group AVALANCHE has claimed responsibility for the bombing. It is expected that AVALANCHE will continue its reign of terror. But citizens of Midgar, there is no need to fear. I have immediately mobilized SOLDIER to protect our citizenry against this senseless violence. Thank you and good night.

Original: Wedge: You think I'm a little too uptight?
Dialogue: You think I'm a little too uptight?

Original: Wedge: The next mission will be to blow up the Sector 5 Reactor. Cloud, you're great! Don't you ever get nervous? Or are you like, impervious to feelings? Naw, that couldn't be it.
Dialogue: The next mission will be to blow up the Sector 5 Reactor. Cloud, you're great! Don't you ever get nervous? Or are you like, impervious to feelings? Naw, that couldn't be it.

Original: Wedge: Well, that's ok. Don't worry about me. I don't look like it, but I'm a coward at heart.
Dialogue: Well, that's ok. Don't worry about me. I don't look like it, but I'm a coward at heart.

Original: Jessie: Oops... Hey, look at the news... What a blast. Think it was all because of my bomb? But all I really did was just make it like the computer told me. Oh no! I must've made a miscalculation somewhere.
Dialogue: Oops... Hey, look at the news... What a blast. Think it was all because of my bomb? But all I really did was just make it like the computer told me. Oh no! I must've made a miscalculation somewhere.

Original: Jessie: Hey, that was my bomb's debut. Makes me kinda proud.
Dialogue: Hey, that was my bomb's debut. Makes me kinda proud.

Original: Barret: Yo, Cloud! There's somethin' I wanna ask ya. Was there anyone from SOLDIER fighting us today?
Dialogue: Yo, Cloud! There's somethin' I wanna ask ya. Was there anyone from SOLDIER fighting us today?

Original: Cloud: None. I'm positive.
Dialogue: None. I'm positive.

Original: Barret: You sound pretty sure.
Dialogue: You sound pretty sure.

Original: Cloud: If there was anyone from SOLDIER you wouldn't be standing here now.
Dialogue: If there was anyone from SOLDIER you wouldn't be standing here now.

Original: Barret: Don't go thinkin' you so bad jes cuz you was in SOLDIER.
Dialogue: Don't go thinkin' you so bad jes cuz you was in SOLDIER.

Original: Barret: Yeah, you're strong. Probably all them guys in SOLDIER are. But don't forget that your skinny ass's workin' for AVALANCHE now! Don't get no ideas 'bout hangin' on to Shinra.
Dialogue: Yeah, you're strong. Probably all them guys in SOLDIER are. But don't forget that your skinny ass's workin' for AVALANCHE now! Don't get no ideas 'bout hangin' on to Shinra.

Original: Cloud: Stayin' with Shinra? You asked me a question and I answered it...that's all.
Dialogue: Stayin' with Shinra? You asked me a question and I answered it...that's all.

Original: Cloud: I'm going upstairs. I want to talk about my money.
Dialogue: I'm going upstairs. I want to talk about my money.

Original: Barret: Shucks!! ............money...
Marlene: Papa, you're so great!
Dialogue: Papa, you're so great!

Original: Tifa: Wait, Cloud!
Dialogue: Wait, Cloud!

Original: Barret: Tifa! Let him go! Looks like he still misses the Shinra!
Dialogue: Tifa! Let him go! Looks like he still misses the Shinra!

Original: Cloud: Shut up! I don't care about either Shinra or SOLDIER! But don't get me wrong! I don't care about AVALANCHE or the Planet for that matter!
Dialogue: Shut up! I don't care about either Shinra or SOLDIER! But don't get me wrong! I don't care about AVALANCHE or the Planet for that matter!

Original: Wedge: .......Cloud. You say you don't care, but you came to talk to me. Cloud... You just want friends. Isn't that right?
Dialogue: .......Cloud. You say you don't care, but you came to talk to me. Cloud... You just want friends. Isn't that right?

Original: Wedge: Yeah, well. You look kind of lonely to me. If you ever got anything you want to get off your chest, you can always talk to me.
Dialogue: Yeah, well. You look kind of lonely to me. If you ever got anything you want to get off your chest, you can always talk to me.

Original: Wedge: You're terrible. Real cold blooded.
Dialogue: You're terrible. Real cold blooded.

Original: Jessie: Money... Oh my. It must have been for a lot of it. Sure! Well, what the hell? It's a verbal agreement. Now let me figure this out. Oh stop it, Cloud! Did you hear me?
Dialogue: Money... Oh my. It must have been for a lot of it. Sure! Well, what the hell? It's a verbal agreement. Now let me figure this out. Oh stop it, Cloud! Did you hear me?

Original: Tifa: Straighten things up with everyone for me.
Dialogue: Straighten things up with everyone for me.

Original: Tifa: Listen, Cloud. I'm asking you. Please join us.
Dialogue: Listen, Cloud. I'm asking you. Please join us.

Original: Cloud: Sorry Tifa...
Dialogue: Sorry Tifa...

Original: Tifa: The Planet is dying. Slowly but surely it's dying. Someone has to do something.
Dialogue: The Planet is dying. Slowly but surely it's dying. Someone has to do something.

Original: Cloud: So let Barret and his buddies do something about it. It's got nothin' to do with me.
Dialogue: So let Barret and his buddies do something about it. It's got nothin' to do with me.

Original: Barret: You damn right we'll do something about it. N' you stay outta this Tifa!
Dialogue: You damn right we'll do something about it. N' you stay outta this Tifa!

Original: Tifa: So! You're really leaving!? You're just going to walk right out ignoring your childhood friend!?
Dialogue: So! You're really leaving !? You're just going to walk right out ignoring your childhood friend !?

Original: Cloud: What......?
Tifa: ......You forgot the promise, too.
Dialogue: ......You forgot the promise, too.

Original: Cloud: Promise?
Dialogue: Promise?

Original: Tifa: So you DID forget.
Dialogue: So you DID forget.

Original: Tifa: Remember......Cloud. It was seven years ago...
Dialogue: Remember......Cloud. It was seven years ago...

Original: Tifa: Look, the well. Do you remember?
Dialogue: Look, the well. Do you remember?

Original: Cloud: Yeah...back then. I thought you would never come, and I was getting a little cold.
Dialogue: Yeah...back then. I thought you would never come, and I was getting a little cold.

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Sorry I'm late. You said you wanted to talk to me about something?
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late. You said you wanted to talk to me about something?

Original: Cloud (in flashback): Come this spring...I'm leaving this town for Midgar.
Dialogue: Come this spring...I'm leaving this town for Midgar.

Original: Tifa (in flashback): ...All boys are leaving our town.
Dialogue: ...All boys are leaving our town.

Original: Cloud (in flashback): But I'm different from all of them. I'm not just going to find a job. I want to join SOLDIER. I'm going to be the best there is, just like Sephiroth!
Dialogue: But I'm different from all of them. I'm not just going to find a job. I want to join SOLDIER. I'm going to be the best there is, just like Sephiroth!

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Sephiroth... The Great Sephiroth. Isn't it hard to join SOLDIER?
Dialogue: Sephiroth... The Great Sephiroth. Isn't it hard to join SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud (in flashback): ...I probably won't be able to come back to this town for a while.
Dialogue: ...I probably won't be able to come back to this town for a while.

Original: Cloud (in flashback): ...huh?
Dialogue: ...huh?

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Will you be in the newspapers if you do well?
Dialogue: Will you be in the newspapers if you do well?

Original: Cloud (in flashback): I'll try.
Dialogue: I'll try.

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Hey, why don't we make a promise? Umm, if you get really famous and I'm ever in a bind...... You come save me, all right?
Dialogue: Hey, why don't we make a promise? Umm, if you get really famous and I'm ever in a bind...... You come save me, all right?

Original: Cloud (in flashback): What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Whenever I'm in trouble, my hero will come and rescue me. I want to at least experience that once.
Dialogue: Whenever I'm in trouble, my hero will come and rescue me. I want to at least experience that once.

Original: Cloud (in flashback): What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Cloud (in flashback): Ha, ha, ha! What's that!
Dialogue: Ha, ha, ha! What's that!

Original: Tifa (in flashback): You're laughing at me!
Dialogue: You're laughing at me!

Original: Tifa (in flashback): Come on--! Promise me----!
Dialogue: Come on--! Promise me----!

Original: Cloud (in flashback): All right......I promise.
Dialogue: All right......I promise.

Original: Tifa: You remember now, don't you... our promise?
Dialogue: You remember now, don't you... our promise?

Original: Cloud: I'm not a hero and I'm not famous. I can't keep......the promise.
Dialogue: I'm not a hero and I'm not famous. I can't keep......the promise.

Original: Tifa: But you got your childhood dream, didn't you? You joined SOLDIER. So come on! You've got to keep your promise......
Dialogue: But you got your childhood dream, didn't you? You joined SOLDIER. So come on! You've got to keep your promise......

Original: Barret: Wait a sec big-time SOLDIER! A promise is a promise! Here!!
Dialogue: Wait a sec big-time SOLDIER! A promise is a promise! Here!!

Original: On-screen: Received Barret's stash, 1500 gil!
Dialogue: Received Barret's stash, 1500 gil!

Original: Cloud: This is my pay? Don't make me laugh.
Dialogue: This is my pay? Don't make me laugh.

Original: Tifa: What? Then you'll...!!
Dialogue: What? Then you'll...!!

Original: Cloud: You got the next mission lined up? I'll do it for 3000.
Dialogue: You got the next mission lined up? I'll do it for 3000.

Original: Barret: What......!?
Tifa: It's ok, it's ok.
Dialogue: It's ok, it's ok.

Original: Tifa: psst, psst...... (We're really hurting for help, right?)
Dialogue: psst, psst...... (We're really hurting for help, right?)

Original: Barret: Uh......ugh...... (That money's for Marlene's schoolin'......)
Dialogue: Uh......ugh...... (That money's for Marlene's schoolin'......)

Original: Barret: 2000!
Tifa: Thanks, Cloud.
Dialogue: Thanks, Cloud.

Original: Tifa: Good Morning! Cloud! Did you sleep well?
Dialogue: Good Morning! Cloud! Did you sleep well?

Original: Tifa: psstpsst... (keep it down, they'll hear you. Barret's always edgy before an operation.)
Dialogue: psstpsst... (keep it down, they'll hear you. Barret's always edgy before an operation.)

Original: Tifa: I don't know what you mean.
Dialogue: I don't know what you mean.

Original: Tifa: I'm going this time.
Dialogue: I'm going this time.

Original: Barret: Our target's the Sector 5 Reactor. Head for the station first. I'll fill you in on the train.
Dialogue: Our target's the Sector 5 Reactor. Head for the station first. I'll fill you in on the train.

Original: Barret: Yo! Cloud! Before the next mission, I got somethin' I wanna ask you! I, uh,...... I don't really know how to use Materia! I'll give you that Materia you found. Just teach me how to use it!
Dialogue: Yo! Cloud! Before the next mission, I got somethin' I wanna ask you! I, uh,...... I don't really know how to use Materia! I'll give you that Materia you found. Just teach me how to use it!

Original: Cloud: ...sigh...
Dialogue: ...sigh...

Original: Cloud: Sure, I'll explain how Materia works. First, access the menu. You know the basic functions. The triangle button brings up the menu. Directional buttons move the cursor, like this. Select each menu by using the OK button. If you want to leave the menu, just push the CANCEL button. See? Let's go ahead. Now you're in this menu. Select [Materia] sub menu. Select who you want to use it. Now look at my weapon here. Each weapon and armor has slots in it. Choose which slot you want to put Materia in. Now select the Materia you want to use. This is curative Materia. If you want to know what its effect is, line the cursor up with [Check], and push the OK button. It's just like selecting battle commands. Just line the cursor up to [Magic], you can see that the available magic has increased. Now you can use new magic [Cure]. And that's all there is to equipping Materia. See? It wasn't that tough! When you want to remove any Materia, it's as easy as pointing to the materia slot, and pushing the triangle button. There's just one thing you have to be careful of. Whenever you equip Materia, your situation changes. Parts of you may become stronger... while others get weaker. Normally, when you equip [Magic] Materia, your magic power will get stronger. But your physical strength weakens. So, Materia's kind of a double-edged sword. On the left side of the screen, you can see the Materia's effect on you. It's wise not to overuse Magic Materia. But try out various things. Push the CANCEL button to exit the sub menu. Ok, that's about it. I'll give you some advanced tips later.
Dialogue: Sure, I'll explain how Materia works. First, access the menu. You know the basic functions. The triangle button brings up the menu. Directional buttons move the cursor, like this. Select each menu by using the OK button. If you want to leave the menu, just push the CANCEL button. See? Let's go ahead. Now you're in this menu. Select [Materia] sub menu. Select who you want to use it. Now look at my weapon here. Each weapon and armor has slots in it. Choose which slot you want to put Materia in. Now select the Materia you want to use. This is curative Materia. If you want to know what its effect is, line the cursor up with [Check], and push the OK button. It's just like selecting battle commands. Just line the cursor up to [Magic], you can see that the available magic has increased. Now you can use new magic [Cure]. And that's all there is to equipping Materia. See? It wasn't that tough! When you want to remove any Materia, it's as easy as pointing to the materia slot, and pushing the triangle button. There's just one thing you have to be careful of. Whenever you equip Materia, your situation changes. Parts of you may become stronger... while others get weaker. Normally, when you equip [Magic] Materia, your magic power will get stronger. But your physical strength weakens. So, Materia's kind of a double-edged sword. On the left side of the screen, you can see the Materia's effect on you. It's wise not to overuse Magic Materia. But try out various things. Push the CANCEL button to exit the sub menu. Ok, that's about it. I'll give you some advanced tips later.

Original: Barret: Shi......! What's this 'It wasn't that tough!' crap! I'm clueless...... Well, you handle the Materia then!
Dialogue: Shi......! What's this 'It wasn't that tough!' crap! I'm clueless...... Well, you handle the Materia then!

Original: Barret: So this is what makes them guys in SOLDIER so great, huh!? Ok. I'll ask Jessie again later. But you're in charge of the Materia!
Dialogue: So this is what makes them guys in SOLDIER so great, huh!? Ok. I'll ask Jessie again later. But you're in charge of the Materia!

Original: On-screen: [Materia System] Access the menu and select [Materia] to equip Materia.
Dialogue: [Materia System] Access the menu and select [Materia] to equip Materia.

Original: Tifa: I'm going this time.
Dialogue: I'm going this time.

Original: Tifa: Cloud! I got a message from the Weapon Shop man upstairs. He has something he wants to give you. Don't forget!
Dialogue: Cloud! I got a message from the Weapon Shop man upstairs. He has something he wants to give you. Don't forget!

Original: Tifa: Marlene, you watch the store while we're gone!
Dialogue: Marlene, you watch the store while we're gone!

Original: Marlene: All right!! Good Luck.
Dialogue: All right!! Good Luck.

Original: Marlene: Take care!
Dialogue: Take care!

Original: Barret: YO! Looks like this ain't no private car!! So split up!!
Dialogue: YO! Looks like this ain't no private car!! So split up!!

Original: Shinra Manager: ...hoodlums again. God, don't I just have all the luck...
Dialogue: ...hoodlums again. God, don't I just have all the luck...

Original: Barret: You say sumthin'?
Dialogue: You say sumthin' ?

Original: Barret: I said, 'you say sumthin'!?
Dialogue: I said, 'you say sumthin'!?

Original: Barret: Yo, look at that!! It got empty alluva sudden. What's goin' on?
Dialogue: Yo, look at that!! It got empty alluva sudden. What's goin' on?

Original: Shinra Manager: DAMN!! I...it's empty because of... g, guys like you... Y, Y, YIPES!! You...you've seen the news, right? AVALANCHE says there'll be more bombings. Only devoted employees like me would go to Midgar on a day like today.
Dialogue: DAMN!! I...it's empty because of... g, guys like you... Y, Y, YIPES!! You...you've seen the news, right? AVALANCHE says there'll be more bombings. Only devoted employees like me would go to Midgar on a day like today.

Original: Barret: You workin' for Shinra?
Dialogue: You workin' for Shinra?

Original: Shinra Manager: I won't give in to violence... and I'm not giving you my seat either!
Dialogue: I won't give in to violence... and I'm not giving you my seat either!

Original: Tifa: Barret!!
Dialogue: Barret!!

Original: Barret: &$#%!! You lucky ^$#^$.!
Cloud: So, what are we gonna do now?
Dialogue: So, what are we gonna do now?

Original: Barret: Shit! The hell you so calm about? You bustin' up my rhythm...
Dialogue: Shit! The hell you so calm about? You bustin' up my rhythm...

Original: Tifa: Seems like they just finished connecting the cars. We're finally leaving.
Dialogue: Seems like they just finished connecting the cars. We're finally leaving.

Original: Cloud: So what's our next target?
Dialogue: So what's our next target?

Original: Barret: Hah! Listen to Mr. Serious-about-his-work!
Dialogue: Hah! Listen to Mr. Serious-about-his-work!

Original: Barret: Awright...I'll tell ya! Jessie's probably already told you, but there's a security check point at the top plate. It's an ID scan system checkin' all the trains.
Dialogue: Awright...I'll tell ya! Jessie's probably already told you, but there's a security check point at the top plate. It's an ID scan system checkin' all the trains.

Original: Tifa: Which Shinra is very proud of.
Dialogue: Which Shinra is very proud of.

Original: Barret: We can't use our fake ID's anymore...
Dialogue: We can't use our fake ID's anymore...

Original: On-screen: Good Morning, and welcome to Midgar lines. Arrival time at Sector 4 Station will 11:45.
Dialogue: Good Morning, and welcome to Midgar lines. Arrival time at Sector 4 Station will 1145.

Original: Tifa: That means we've got only three more minutes to the ID Check point.
Dialogue: That means we've got only three more minutes to the ID Check point.

Original: Barret: Alright, in three minutes, we're jumpin' off this train. Got it!?
Dialogue: Alright, in three minutes, we're jumpin' off this train. Got it!?

Original: Tifa: Cloud, come over here! Let's look at the Railway Map Monitor.
Dialogue: Cloud, come over here! Let's look at the Railway Map Monitor.

Original: Barret: Yo, Mr. know-it-all, big time SOLDIER! You oughta know the area 'round the No. 5 Reactor, right! So let's hear YOUR explanation!
Dialogue: Yo, Mr. know-it-all, big time SOLDIER! You oughta know the area 'round the No. 5 Reactor, right! So let's hear YOUR explanation!

Original: NPC: Hmmm......? You're the only ones that'll talk to me or come to my house. I'm impressed.
Dialogue: Hmmm......? You're the only ones that'll talk to me or come to my house. I'm impressed.

Original: Shinra Manager: Waaaaah!! Don...don't worry about me. (oh man, oh man, oh man...!! I'm gonna brag to everyone at work about this...)
Dialogue: Waaaaah!! Don...don't worry about me. (oh man, oh man, oh man...!! I'm gonna brag to everyone at work about this...)

Original: Tifa: Hmm, it looks like you've seen this already... It's all right. Come a little closer.
Dialogue: Hmm, it looks like you've seen this already... It's all right. Come a little closer.

Original: Tifa: That's odd. The ID Check Point was supposed to be further down.
Dialogue: That's odd. The ID Check Point was supposed to be further down.

Dialogue: Type A Security Alert!! Unidentified passengers confirmed... A search of all cars will be conducted! Repeat!! Type A Security Alert!! Unidentified passengers confirmed... A search of all cars will be conducted!

Original: Tifa: What's happening?
Dialogue: What's happening?

Dialogue: What's goin' on!!

Dialogue: We're in trouble. I'll explain later. Hurry! Get to the next car!

Original: Barret: ^%#@%! Someone blew it...
Dialogue: ^%#@%! Someone blew it...

Dialogue: Unidentified passengers located in Car #1 Preparing for Lock Down

Dialogue: Let's go! Keep it up!

Original: On-screen: You have 15 seconds to reach next car. Reach car 5 if you want to date Tifa/Barret, or get off earlier if you want to date Aeris/Yuffie.
Dialogue: You have 15 seconds to reach next car. Reach car 5 if you want to date Tifa/Barret, or get off earlier if you want to date Aeris/Yuffie.

Original: NPC: Hm? ... You'd talk to me even now? I'm really impressed. Let me give you a little something as a reward.
Dialogue: Hm? ... You'd talk to me even now? I'm really impressed. Let me give you a little something as a reward.

Original: NPC: If I die in the gutter, use that to revive me, okay?
Dialogue: If I die in the gutter, use that to revive me, okay?

Dialogue: Car #1 Locked Down Car being sent to the Station

Dialogue: C'mon!! Hurry your slow ass up! That's it, huh?

Original: Tifa: Oh well...
Dialogue: Oh well...

Original: Barret: We're gonna jump outta here!! Follow me!!
Dialogue: We're gonna jump outta here!! Follow me!!

Dialogue: We got a lot of battles ahead of us. This's going to be tough.

Dialogue: Car #1 Locked Down Upgrading to Level 2 Warning

Dialogue: Hurry!

Dialogue: They're gonna lock the door, sir!

Dialogue: Unidentified passengers located in Car #2 Preparing for Lock Down

Original: Jessie: Just run! Changing to Plan 2!
Dialogue: Just run! Changing to Plan 2!

Original: NPC: Hey... You guys are rowdy...
Dialogue: Hey... You guys are rowdy...

Original: NPC: Well, just calm down.
Dialogue: Well, just calm down.

Original: NPC: Gosh!! You're adults, but you're making such noise. Please behave while you're in the train.
Dialogue: Gosh!! You're adults, but you're making such noise. Please behave while you're in the train.

Original: NPC: Hyu---n!! Hyu---n!!
Dialogue: Hyu---n!! Hyu---n!!

Original: NPC: Does this mean that we're in a major bind?
Dialogue: Does this mean that we're in a major bind?

Original: NPC: Huh? The hell?! Do you want this?
Dialogue: Huh? The hell?! Do you want this?

Original: NPC: Wow! I won't even charge you... Wha-t? Don't get used to it though.
Dialogue: Wow! I won't even charge you... Wha-t? Don't get used to it though.

Original: NPC: Wha-t? Let me know when you need me.
Dialogue: Wha-t? Let me know when you need me.

Original: NPC: Wha-t? You sure are greedy.
Dialogue: Wha-t? You sure are greedy.

Original: (Upon failing to reach the next car.)On-screen: Car #2: Locked Down Car being sent to the Station
Dialogue: Car #2 Locked Down Car being sent to the Station

Dialogue: What!? That's it!?

Original: Tifa: That didn't do anything!
Dialogue: That didn't do anything!

Dialogue: We'll jump from here!! Follow me, you 'spensive leech!!

Dialogue: Phew-----! Be strong!

Dialogue: Car #2 Locked down Upgrading to Warning Level 3

Dialogue: Awright! We clear!?

Dialogue: Not yet. They're starting another check. If we're caught, we're done for! But, don't worry. If we move up the train, car by car, we should get past it!

Dialogue: Hee hee!!

Dialogue: Later...Goodbye...Adios, Midgar!!

Dialogue: Car #3 Locked Down Illegal ID will be taken to the station

Dialogue: The hell!? So this is as far as we go...?

Dialogue: We're gonna jump off here!! Follow me!!

Dialogue: Car #3 Locked Down Upgrading to Warning Level 4

Dialogue: Brrrrrr...... It's terrible. Who'd expect underwear bandits in this day and age? They wiped me out!

Dialogue: Any idea what happened? All I know is, when I woke up the 3 of us were butt-naked! But I guess you couldn't relate...

Dialogue: That scary broad made me take the bomb. Of course I couldn't very well refuse her!

Dialogue: Car #4 Locked Down Upgrading to maximum security alert!!
