Dialogue: What's going on!? Something's missing, and it's my materia-it's all gone!!

Original: Vincent: I thought something was wrong, So that's it. Look, my materia's been stolen...
Dialogue: I thought something was wrong, So that's it. Look, my materia's been stolen...

Original: Cid: What the hell's goin' on! I knew I was missing something... My materia's gone!!
Dialogue: What the hell's goin' on! I knew I was missing something... My materia's gone!!

Original: Red XIII: O...OH NO! All of our materia...gone!?
Dialogue: O...OH NO! All of our materia...gone!?

Original: Barret: Hey, we gotta problem! Our materia's all gone!!
Dialogue: Hey, we gotta problem! Our materia's all gone!!

Original: Cloud: Hey...where's Yuffie...?
Dialogue: Hey...where's Yuffie...?

Original: Tifa: Hey...where's Yuffie...?
Dialogue: Hey...where's Yuffie...?

Original: Cid: Ey...where the hell's that damn kid...?
Dialogue: Ey...where the hell's that damn kid...?

Original: Barret: That &*&$ kid!!! Grrrrrgh!! Arrrrrgh Uhhhhhhhhhhhh!!
Dialogue: That &*&$ kid!!! Grrrrrgh!! Arrrrrgh Uhhhhhhhhhhhh!!

Original: Barret: She was after our materia from the start!! She went North! When I get my hand on her, I'll get our materia back! C'mon! We're goin' after her!
Dialogue: She was after our materia from the start!! She went North! When I get my hand on her, I'll get our materia back! C'mon! We're goin' after her!

Original: Tifa: She's done it to us again!! I'm never gonna forgive her!
Dialogue: She's done it to us again!! I'm never gonna forgive her!

Original: Tifa: She was after our materia from the beginning. I won't let her get away with it! I'm pretty sure she ran off North. Let's go after her!!
Dialogue: She was after our materia from the beginning. I won't let her get away with it! I'm pretty sure she ran off North. Let's go after her!!

Original: Aeris: I'm so------ mad!!
Dialogue: I'm so------ mad!!

Original: Aeris: She was probably eyeing our materia from the beginning. Seems like she headed North. Let's hurry after her and get our materia back!
Dialogue: She was probably eyeing our materia from the beginning. Seems like she headed North. Let's hurry after her and get our materia back!

Original: Red XIII: ZOUNDS!! Grrrrrrrgh...... Grrrgh! Grrrrrgh!!
Dialogue: ZOUNDS!! Grrrrrrrgh...... Grrrgh! Grrrrrgh!!

Original: Red XIII: Her objective was stealing our materia from the beginning. ...sniff... North! She ran off to the North! I'm not going to let her get away with this! Hurry, hurry! We have to get our materia back!
Dialogue: Her objective was stealing our materia from the beginning. ...sniff... North! She ran off to the North! I'm not going to let her get away with this! Hurry, hurry! We have to get our materia back!

Original: Cait Sith: She's done it again! She sure took us for fools!
Dialogue: She's done it again! She sure took us for fools!

Original: Cait Sith: She must've been after our materia from the beginning. We can't just let her get away, right? Then, let's hurry after her! Which way? It's North, the North! It's a message from the stars!
Dialogue: She must've been after our materia from the beginning. We can't just let her get away, right? Then, let's hurry after her! Which way? It's North, the North! It's a message from the stars!

Original: Vincent: Inexcusable...
Dialogue: Inexcusable...

Original: Vincent: Seems as though all that she was after was our materia. We can't just let her get away. She ran off......to the North... We must go after her and retrieve our materia back.
Dialogue: Seems as though all that she was after was our materia. We can't just let her get away. She ran off......to the North... We must go after her and retrieve our materia back.

Original: Cid: That little ^%#^$@!! Takin' me for a fool!!
Dialogue: That little ^%#^$@!! Takin' me for a fool!!

Original: Cid: No doubt about it! That kid was after my materia from the start!! Hmm... Seems like she went North. Don't be draggin' your asses! We're going right NOW! That $#@^ is history!!
Dialogue: No doubt about it! That kid was after my materia from the start!! Hmm... Seems like she went North. Don't be draggin' your asses! We're going right NOW! That $#@^ is history!!

Original: Cloud: ...First, I gotta do something about her.
Dialogue: ...First, I gotta do something about her.

Original: Tifa: I can't just leave it there...
Dialogue: I can't just leave it there...

Original: Cid: Damn kid! I'll get her no matter what!
Dialogue: Damn kid! I'll get her no matter what!

Original: Yuffie: Hey!!
Dialogue: Hey!!

Original: NPC: This is MY house! Nobody gets in!
Dialogue: This is MY house! Nobody gets in!

Original: Barret: Wait, that damn Yuffie's still gotta be somewhere in this cheap town! Or you all jes' gonna go on?
Dialogue: Wait, that damn Yuffie's still gotta be somewhere in this cheap town! Or you all jes' gonna go on?

Original: Tifa: Knowing Yuffie, she's still hidden somewhere in town. You sure?
Dialogue: Knowing Yuffie, she's still hidden somewhere in town. You sure?

Original: Aeris: I don't think she came out from here... Is that ok?
Dialogue: I don't think she came out from here... Is that ok?

Original: Red XIII: I know she hasn't left town! You still want to leave?
Dialogue: I know she hasn't left town! You still want to leave?

Original: Vincent: She couldn't have left town... I think she is must still be here... Or do you want to go on?
Dialogue: She couldn't have left town... I think she is must still be here... Or do you want to go on?

Original: Cid: You lettin' that damn kid off the hook? I know she's gotta be in this town somewhere!
Dialogue: You lettin' that damn kid off the hook? I know she's gotta be in this town somewhere!

Original: NPC: A girl with materia? No, there hasn't been anyone climbing Da-chao for some time now.
Dialogue: A girl with materia? No, there hasn't been anyone climbing Da-chao for some time now.

Original: NPC: What, Yuffie... It's best to ask Lord Godo about that. But today he's not in the best of... Well, I should say... But really he's not so......
Dialogue: What, Yuffie... It's best to ask Lord Godo about that. But today he's not in the best of... Well, I should say... But really he's not so......

Original: NPC: Sorry, listen I... No, nothing...never mind.
Dialogue: Sorry, listen I... No, nothing...never mind.

Original: NPC: Sorry, but we're entirely sold out now. What's this here? Ah, no...that's uh... ...a sample! Yeah, that's it...a sample. Sorry, but why don't you all come back later?
Dialogue: Sorry, but we're entirely sold out now. What's this here? Ah, no...that's uh... ...a sample! Yeah, that's it...a sample. Sorry, but why don't you all come back later?

Original: Elena: Yy, you!? How did you get here...? Never mind that. I guess it's fate that brought us together. Get ready to die!!
Dialogue: Yy, you!? How did you get here...? Never mind that. I guess it's fate that brought us together. Get ready to die!!

Original: Reno: ...Elena, you talk too much.
Dialogue: ...Elena, you talk too much.

Original: Elena: Ww, what?
Dialogue: Ww, what?

Original: Reno: What are we doing way out here in the middle of nowhere?
Dialogue: What are we doing way out here in the middle of nowhere?

Original: Elena: We're taking our vacation and resting up from our work.
Dialogue: We're taking our vacation and resting up from our work.

Original: Reno: Now our vacation is ruined.
Dialogue: Now our vacation is ruined.

Original: Elena: B, but...
Dialogue: B, but...

Original: Rude: ...even the booze tastes bad now.
Dialogue: ...even the booze tastes bad now.

Original: Elena: ...sorry...
Dialogue: ...sorry...

Original: Elena: Hmm, you're lucky all right. Now get out of my sight! The next time we meet I won't be so nice.
Dialogue: Hmm, you're lucky all right. Now get out of my sight! The next time we meet I won't be so nice.

Original: Rude: To the Turks... To Reno...cheers!
Dialogue: To the Turks... To Reno...cheers!

Original: Reno: Drink, Rude! How long have we been a team...? There have been hard times being a Turk, but all in all, I'm glad I did it. I even got to meet a bunch of wing nuts like you.
Dialogue: Drink, Rude! How long have we been a team...? There have been hard times being a Turk, but all in all, I'm glad I did it. I even got to meet a bunch of wing nuts like you.

Original: NPC: You know I've noticed that there's a pounding noise from time to time in this store.
Dialogue: You know I've noticed that there's a pounding noise from time to time in this store.

Original: NPC: Anyhow, for some reason Yuffie's had a fondness for materia ever since I can remember. She's always hung around places she thought might have it.
Dialogue: Anyhow, for some reason Yuffie's had a fondness for materia ever since I can remember. She's always hung around places she thought might have it.

Original: On-screen: Received "MP Absorb" Materia!
Dialogue: Received "MP Absorb" Materia!

Original: On-screen: Stole "MP Absorb" Materia!
Dialogue: Stole "MP Absorb" Materia!

Original: NPC: Huh? What? You DID?
Dialogue: Huh? What? You DID?

Original: NPC: Yuffie? I saw her a while ago. She must be in one of the houses around here.
Dialogue: Yuffie? I saw her a while ago. She must be in one of the houses around here.

Original: NPC: Yuffie's like that, you know. Sometimes she'll just bust into people's houses. Then she hides in the shadows... Just like a little kid.
Dialogue: Yuffie's like that, you know. Sometimes she'll just bust into people's houses. Then she hides in the shadows... Just like a little kid.

Original: Godo: GOOGAH...what do you want? Don't have...GAH...anything much but, you should be able to...GOO...rest yourselves here. GOGAH...make yourselves at home.
Dialogue: GOOGAH...what do you want? Don't have...GAH...anything much but, you should be able to...GOO...rest yourselves here. GOGAH...make yourselves at home.

Original: Godo: ......Yuffie? ......nope, never heard of her. ...GOOGO...
Dialogue: ......Yuffie? ......nope, never heard of her. ...GOOGO...

Original: Godo: ...you again? I told you once, and I'm telling you again, I don't know her.
Dialogue: ...you again? I told you once, and I'm telling you again, I don't know her.

Original: Godo: Listen, I said I didn't know her! There isn't anyone named Yuffie here in Wutai!
Dialogue: Listen, I said I didn't know her! There isn't anyone named Yuffie here in Wutai!

Original: Godo: ...never seen you around here before... Lately I've been seeing a lot of Shinra soldiers around here... You wouldn't have anything to do with that would you?
Dialogue: ...never seen you around here before... Lately I've been seeing a lot of Shinra soldiers around here... You wouldn't have anything to do with that would you?

Original: Godo: I don't care about who you are. But if you're in trouble with the Shinra, I'm going to have to ask you to leave. I don't want the Shinra hanging around here looking over my shoulder.
Dialogue: I don't care about who you are. But if you're in trouble with the Shinra, I'm going to have to ask you to leave. I don't want the Shinra hanging around here looking over my shoulder.

Original: Yuffie: What's with you, you coward!
Dialogue: What's with you, you coward!

Original: Godo: Yuffie......!
Dialogue: Yuffie......!

Original: Yuffie: You scared of the Shinra? Then why don't you fall into line and obey them, just like all of the other towns! Those guys are the ones who are really fighting the Shinra!
Dialogue: You scared of the Shinra? Then why don't you fall into line and obey them, just like all of the other towns! Those guys are the ones who are really fighting the Shinra!

Original: Godo: Shut up! What would you know about this?
Dialogue: Shut up! What would you know about this?

Original: Yuffie: You get beaten once, and then that's it? What happened to the mighty Wutai I used to know?
Dialogue: You get beaten once, and then that's it? What happened to the mighty Wutai I used to know?

Original: Godo: No kid like you's going to talk to me like that! You keep acting like that! You ought to be ashamed of yourself!
Dialogue: No kid like you's going to talk to me like that! You keep acting like that! You ought to be ashamed of yourself!

Original: Yuffie: That's my style! And it's my own business, not yours! Don't you try and dictate what I should do!
Dialogue: That's my style! And it's my own business, not yours! Don't you try and dictate what I should do!

Original: Godo: Style...? Dictate...? Throwin' around all those fancy words... You're a miserable daughter!
Dialogue: Style...? Dictate...? Throwin' around all those fancy words... You're a miserable daughter!

Original: Yuffie: Hmph! You're a sad excuse for a father!!
Dialogue: Hmph! You're a sad excuse for a father!!

Original: Godo: ......take your things and get out of here now. To protect Wutai, we cannot afford to stand up to Shinra.
Dialogue: ......take your things and get out of here now. To protect Wutai, we cannot afford to stand up to Shinra.

Original: NPC 1: Oh no! More weirdos
Dialogue: Oh no! More weirdos

Original: NPC 2: No, these aren't like the one from a while ago, but these ones look weird too!
Dialogue: No, these aren't like the one from a while ago, but these ones look weird too!

Original: NPC: What are we going to do, Gramps? Some strange-looking girl came in here a minute ago and I...
Dialogue: What are we going to do, Gramps? Some strange-looking girl came in here a minute ago and I...

Original: Yuffie: .......
NPC: That reminds me, Lately I've been seeing a kid around here that reminds me of Yuffie. Always sneakin' around corners And into somethin' she shouldn't be.
Dialogue: That reminds me, Lately I've been seeing a kid around here that reminds me of Yuffie. Always sneakin' around corners And into somethin' she shouldn't be.

Original: NPC: It's been really loud and busy outside. Someone outside must be up to something bad...
Dialogue: It's been really loud and busy outside. Someone outside must be up to something bad...

Original: Cloud: You can't get away, Yuffie.
Dialogue: You can't get away, Yuffie.

Original: Tifa: Give it up, Yuffie!
Dialogue: Give it up, Yuffie!

Original: Cid: You lost, Yuffie.
Dialogue: You lost, Yuffie.

Original: Yuffie: O...ok, I know... I was wrong...... You win. I'll give you back your materia...
Dialogue: O...ok, I know... I was wrong...... You win. I'll give you back your materia...

Original: (After this, perspective shifts to Turtle's Paradise.)Shinra soldier: So our reports were right! He IS here on vacation! We've finally found him! Get the Turks here for back-up!
Dialogue: So our reports were right! He IS here on vacation! We've finally found him! Get the Turks here for back-up!

Original: Reno: ...what a drag.
Dialogue: ...what a drag.

Original: Shinra soldier: Ww, what was that...?
Dialogue: Ww, what was that...?

Original: Reno: Right now we're off duty and can't run off to save your butts.
Dialogue: Right now we're off duty and can't run off to save your butts.

Original: Shinra soldier: We know you're off duty, but...
Dialogue: We know you're off duty, but...

Original: Reno: If you knew that, then don't bother us! Lookin' at you is makin' me sober.
Dialogue: If you knew that, then don't bother us! Lookin' at you is makin' me sober.

Original: Shinra soldier: But you all have orders from headquarters to look for him too!
Dialogue: But you all have orders from headquarters to look for him too!

Original: Shinra soldier: All right, that's it! We'll get him without any help from the Turks, just you see! And don't think that headquarters isn't going to hear about this!!
Dialogue: All right, that's it! We'll get him without any help from the Turks, just you see! And don't think that headquarters isn't going to hear about this!!

Original: Elena: Reno, do you think that was really such a good idea!? I mean is that the way a professional, a Turk would act!?
Dialogue: Reno, do you think that was really such a good idea!? I mean is that the way a professional, a Turk would act!?

Original: Reno: Elena. Don't misunderstand. A pro isn't someone who sacrifices himself for his job. That's just a fool.
Dialogue: Elena. Don't misunderstand. A pro isn't someone who sacrifices himself for his job. That's just a fool.

Original: Elena: Rude...?
Dialogue: Rude...?

Original: Elena: Well, I don't buy that! Goodbye!!
Dialogue: Well, I don't buy that! Goodbye!!

Original: Reno: Relax. She's not a child. Let her have her way now...
Dialogue: Relax. She's not a child. Let her have her way now...

Original: (After perspective shifts back to the party, in Yuffie's house.)Yuffie: I know, the materia, right? I have it stored in a safe place. ...Follow me.
Dialogue: I know, the materia, right? I have it stored in a safe place. ...Follow me.

Original: Yuffie: ...I've been hearing that ever since I was little. Before I was born, Wutai was a lot more crowded and more important...
Dialogue: ...I've been hearing that ever since I was little. Before I was born, Wutai was a lot more crowded and more important...

Original: Yuffie: You saw what it looks like now, right? ...JUST a resort town... After we lost the war, we got peace, but with that, we lost something else. Now look at Wutai...
Dialogue: You saw what it looks like now, right? ...JUST a resort town... After we lost the war, we got peace, but with that, we lost something else. Now look at Wutai...

Original: Yuffie: That's why... if I had lots of materia I could...
Dialogue: That's why... if I had lots of materia I could...

Original: Cloud: Listen, Yuffie. I don't care about the history of Wutai or your feelings. You've got our materia and I want it back ...now. If you give it back now, we'll drop the whole thing.
Dialogue: Listen, Yuffie. I don't care about the history of Wutai or your feelings. You've got our materia and I want it back ...now. If you give it back now, we'll drop the whole thing.

Original: Tifa: I'm sorry, Yuffie. I know how you feel, but we need materia too. ...We just can't let you have it. Please understand.
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Yuffie. I know how you feel, but we need materia too. ...We just can't let you have it. Please understand.

Original: Cid: ......Dammit, Yuffie. We ain't got time to be listening to your life story. If you want materia, get it yourself. That's how you should do it.
Dialogue: ......Dammit, Yuffie. We ain't got time to be listening to your life story. If you want materia, get it yourself. That's how you should do it.

Original: Yuffie: I know. I know that...
Dialogue: I know. I know that...

Original: Yuffie: That...sniff...switch... the lever on the left...... materia's...sniff, hic...in there.
Dialogue: That...sniff...switch... the lever on the left...... materia's...sniff, hic...in there.

Original: Barret: Ain't nuthin' we can do about it...
Dialogue: Ain't nuthin' we can do about it...

Original: Tifa: Now, the Materia...
Dialogue: Now, the Materia...

Original: Aeris: I feel bad, but......
Dialogue: I feel bad, but......

Original: Red XIII: Were we a little too harsh on her?
Dialogue: Were we a little too harsh on her?

Original: Cait Sith: Well, let's get our materia back.
Dialogue: Well, let's get our materia back.

Original: Vincent: There was nothing else to do.
Dialogue: There was nothing else to do.

Original: Cid: Hmmph... I dunno......
Dialogue: Hmmph... I dunno......

Original: Barret: Wh...what the hell is this!?
Dialogue: Wh...what the hell is this!?

Original: Tifa: Eyaaaaah
Dialogue: Eyaaaaah

Original: Aeris: Eyaaaaah
Dialogue: Eyaaaaah

Original: Red XIII: Wh, what are you doing!?
Dialogue: Wh, what are you doing!?

Original: Cait Sith: Wh, what is this!?
Dialogue: Wh, what is this!?

Original: Cid: Whoa!?
Dialogue: Whoa!?

Original: Yuffie: Ha ha ha------! Never trust anyone that easily!!
Dialogue: Ha ha ha------! Never trust anyone that easily!!

Original: Yuffie: Ha ha------! You should've listened!!
Dialogue: Ha ha------! You should've listened!!

Original: Yuffie: The Materia's mine! Tough!
Dialogue: The Materia's mine! Tough!

Original: Yuffie: You want your materia? Then go find it yourself! Yeah that's right. And when you're looking for the materia, remember you gotta steel it. Heh heh... steel...steel! Get it?
Dialogue: You want your materia? Then go find it yourself! Yeah that's right. And when you're looking for the materia, remember you gotta steel it. Heh heh... steel...steel! Get it?

Original: Yuffie: C ya!!
Dialogue: C ya!!

Original: Barret: Y, yo, wait up!!
Dialogue: Y, yo, wait up!!

Original: Tifa: W...wait don't leave us here!
Dialogue: W...wait don't leave us here!

Original: Aeris: Wait, don't leave us!
Dialogue: Wait, don't leave us!

Original: Red XIII: Help us first!
Dialogue: Help us first!

Original: Cait Sith: Hey help us...please!
Dialogue: Hey help us...please!

Original: Vincent: Wait, don't go by yourself!
Dialogue: Wait, don't go by yourself!

Original: Cid: Hey! Help me first!
Dialogue: Hey! Help me first!

Original: Reno: ....... It's just that we're off duty! I don't feel like drinking with you. And don't talk to me
Dialogue: ....... It's just that we're off duty! I don't feel like drinking with you. And don't talk to me

Original: Yuffie: Let go! I SAID let GO! Hey! Who do you think I...... OW! What're you doin'...? Jerk!
Dialogue: Let go! I SAID let GO! Hey! Who do you think I...... OW! What're you doin'...? Jerk!

Original: Cloud: You.......!
Tifa: Oh! You're......!
Dialogue: Oh! You're......!

Original: Cid: Ww, who are you!?
Dialogue: Ww, who are you!?

Original: Cloud: Corneo!?
Dialogue: Corneo!?

Original: Tifa: Don Corneo!?
Dialogue: Don Corneo!?

Original: Cid: The hell are you doing!
Dialogue: The hell are you doing!

Original: Corneo: Hohi! I've finally got a new chicky! Two for one, in fact! Hohi, hohi!
Dialogue: Hohi! I've finally got a new chicky! Two for one, in fact! Hohi, hohi!

Original: Party leader: Two!?
Dialogue: Two!?

Original: Elena: H......hey! Let go of me! You're gonna regret this!!
Dialogue: H......hey! Let go of me! You're gonna regret this!!

Original: Corneo: Hohi, hohi! Hohihi!
Dialogue: Hohi, hohi! Hohihi!

Original: Shinra soldier: There he is! It's Corneo! Don't let him get away!
Dialogue: There he is! It's Corneo! Don't let him get away!

Original: Shinra soldier: Attaaaack!
Dialogue: Attaaaack!

Original: Rude: .......Elena.
Reno: Hmm... that Corneo is good at escaping...
Dialogue: Hmm... that Corneo is good at escaping...

Original: Rude: .......Elena.
Reno: Let's go, Rude. We'll give them a taste of what the Turks can do.
Dialogue: Let's go, Rude. We'll give them a taste of what the Turks can do.

Original: Reno: ......Sounded pretty good.
Dialogue: ......Sounded pretty good.

Original: Reno: If Elena is in his hands, that's going to make things a little difficult. And uh...
Dialogue: If Elena is in his hands, that's going to make things a little difficult. And uh...

Original: Cloud: ......Ok. Corneo took Yuffie from us. And without Yuffie, there's no way we'll get our materia back.
Dialogue: ......Ok. Corneo took Yuffie from us. And without Yuffie, there's no way we'll get our materia back.

Original: Tifa: ......all right. Corneo stole Yuffie from us, as well. And without her, there's no way we'll get our materia back.
Dialogue: ......all right. Corneo stole Yuffie from us, as well. And without her, there's no way we'll get our materia back.

Original: Cid: ......that's just beautiful! And now that *#$^@'s walked off with Yuffie, too! And without that brat, we can't get our hands on our materia!
Dialogue: ......that's just beautiful! And now that *#$^@'s walked off with Yuffie, too! And without that brat, we can't get our hands on our materia!

Original: Reno: Don't misunderstand. We have no intention of joining you. But for now, we'll agree not to bother each other. That's all.
Dialogue: Don't misunderstand. We have no intention of joining you. But for now, we'll agree not to bother each other. That's all.

Original: Cloud: That's fine. We have absolutely no intention of cooperating with the Turks either. Now, uh, just what direction did Corneo run off to?
Dialogue: That's fine. We have absolutely no intention of cooperating with the Turks either. Now, uh, just what direction did Corneo run off to?

Original: Tifa: The same goes for us. We don't want to be friendly with the Turks. Now which direction did Corneo run off in?
Dialogue: The same goes for us. We don't want to be friendly with the Turks. Now which direction did Corneo run off in?

Original: Cid: Of course! There ain't no way we'd wanna join up with the Turks anyway! Anyhow, which direction did that%^$*& run off in?
Dialogue: Of course! There ain't no way we'd wanna join up with the Turks anyway! Anyhow, which direction did that %^$*& run off in?

Original: Reno: Hmm, nice attitude. Here's a clue, it's the place that stands out the most.
Dialogue: Hmm, nice attitude. Here's a clue, it's the place that stands out the most.

Original: NPC: Two girls just went off towards Da-chao. I wonder if that place is starting to become popular with the kids? One had herself all tangled up in a rope. And the other one kind of looked like Yuffie.
Dialogue: Two girls just went off towards Da-chao. I wonder if that place is starting to become popular with the kids? One had herself all tangled up in a rope. And the other one kind of looked like Yuffie.

Original: NPC: Alright, alright, alright! I saw an old man in flashy clothes running towards Da-chao! He was babblin' somethin' and looked like he could float! It almost bowled me over!
Dialogue: Alright, alright, alright! I saw an old man in flashy clothes running towards Da-chao! He was babblin' somethin' and looked like he could float! It almost bowled me over!

Original: Reno: You're finally here. We're gonna split into two. You do whatever you want. But don't endanger Elena. Don't worry. We won't do anything to that girl, Yuffie. For now...
Dialogue: You're finally here. We're gonna split into two. You do whatever you want. But don't endanger Elena. Don't worry. We won't do anything to that girl, Yuffie. For now...

Original: Reno: You all thought they might be here too, huh? We were way off. There's no way they could get that far.
Dialogue: You all thought they might be here too, huh? We were way off. There's no way they could get that far.

Original: Reno: Don't fool around. You know the enemy's not gonna wait for us, right?
Dialogue: Don't fool around. You know the enemy's not gonna wait for us, right?

Original: Yuffie: LET...ME......GO!!!!
Corneo: Hmm! Delicious...scrumptious! I think I've just found a new HOBBY!
Dialogue: Hmm! Delicious...scrumptious! I think I've just found a new HOBBY!

Original: Corneo: Which shall it be? Hmm...Hmm...
Dialogue: Which shall it be? Hmm...Hmm...

Original: Corneo: Should I go...with HER?
Dialogue: Should I go...with HER?

Original: Elena: He...hey, I'm one of the 'Turks'! Don't think you can get away with this!?
Dialogue: He...hey, I'm one of the 'Turks'! Don't think you can get away with this!?

Original: Corneo: Or...maybe...HER?
Dialogue: Or...maybe...HER?

Original: Godo: Yuffie...... I am the same now as I was before when I wanted the war. But, after I lost the war, I began to think... Is strength, only for defeating the enemy? ...or just something to show-off to others...? Might begets might. That's the same way as the Shinra...
Dialogue: Yuffie...... I am the same now as I was before when I wanted the war. But, after I lost the war, I began to think... Is strength, only for defeating the enemy? ...or just something to show-off to others...? Might begets might. That's the same way as the Shinra...

Godo: I knew you were looking for Materia for the good of Wutai. But, the reason I hide my strength now, is also for the good of Wutai... And now, I realize both are necessary... Strength without determination means nothing. And determination without strength is equally useless...!

Dialogue: When you've been a train man as long as I have, you see a lot of people and a lot of lives. People meeting, parting, joy, sadness... After a while, it doesn't even get to you anymore.

Original: NPC: Hey now!! Oops!! What on earth are you doing? Just butt out......geez! Huh? You come to see it, too? There was a bombing on top. If this pillar should come down, everyone in the slums is dust... Well, there's no point in worryin' about that. Hey!! Look! It's huge, ain't it? Hey... This is a strange and wonderful place. This is my place, but you can come here when you want. Bye, bro!

Original: NPC: Unn......!! Who the hell are you!? No unauthorized access. Since today's special, I'm gonna let you in on a juicy bit of news. But you gotta keep it to yourself. Do you know about what's been going on......?
Dialogue: Unn...... !! Who the hell are you!? No unauthorized access. Since today's special, I'm gonna let you in on a juicy bit of news. But you gotta keep it to yourself. Do you know about what's been going on......?

Original: NPC: I guess you must be sick of hearing it... But it's been so long since there was any real news here. You're worried where it's all heading, right?
Dialogue: I guess you must be sick of hearing it... But it's been so long since there was any real news here. You're worried where it's all heading, right?

Original: NPC: Everything's in a buzz 'bout that terrorist group AVALANCHE blowin' up the Sector 1 Mako Reactor. On the surface they say they're an anti-Shinra group, but in reality... They say they're just out to kill as many people as they can. Gyaaaa, Haaa haaa!! That's a good one, ain't it!? While they're bustin' things up on top, the only ones makin' out good are us weapon stores! Now, if we can just get rid of this back stock, we'll be doin' ok.
Dialogue: Everything's in a buzz 'bout that terrorist group AVALANCHE blowin' up the Sector 1 Mako Reactor. On the surface they say they're an anti-Shinra group, but in reality... They say they're just out to kill as many people as they can. Gyaaaa, Haaa haaa!! That's a good one, ain't it!? While they're bustin' things up on top, the only ones makin' out good are us weapon stores! Now, if we can just get rid of this back stock, we'll be doin' ok.

Original: NPC: You know what I do? I'll bet you don't. You come here tomorrow and I'll tell you. Ahh, there just ain't no good jobs here in the slums. I wanna go to the upper world.
Dialogue: You know what I do? I'll bet you don't. You come here tomorrow and I'll tell you. Ahh, there just ain't no good jobs here in the slums. I wanna go to the upper world.

Dialogue: Isn't there somewhere we could go to be alone? Wow! There's only the train graveyard around here. And they say there's ghosts around too! .......damn. What?

Dialogue: Don't be taken in by the Shinra. Mako energy will not last forever. Mako is the life of the Planet and that life is finite. The end is coming. Saviors of the Planet AVALANCHE

Original: NPC: Oh Jesus!! What the hell's wrong tonight!! I thought that long blackout was strange. They say a Mako Reactor was destroyed above. I was jes sittin' here drinkin', watchin' the news by myself. 'n' all of a sudden I get kicked outta the &*%$ store. What's up with that!?
Dialogue: Oh Jesus!! What the hell's wrong tonight!! I thought that long blackout was strange. They say a Mako Reactor was destroyed above. I was jes sittin' here drinkin', watchin' the news by myself. 'n' all of a sudden I get kicked outta the &*%$ store. What's up with that!?

Original: NPC: I wasn't even done with my drink. I didn't even pay my bill...
Dialogue: I wasn't even done with my drink. I didn't even pay my bill...

Original: NPC: Explosions! Explosions! Oh Man! AVALANCHE is so cool!
Dialogue: Explosions! Explosions! Oh Man! AVALANCHE is so cool!

Original: NPC: Did you hear?
Dialogue: Did you hear?

Original: NPC: There's a news update. They say that there was a terrorist explosion up above, and that this time it was a Mako Reactor!! You know what this means?
Dialogue: There's a news update. They say that there was a terrorist explosion up above, and that this time it was a Mako Reactor!! You know what this means?

Original: NPC: Ya see, I keep on top of these things, an' if ya ask me...... If you knock out Midgar's power, then all of its computers and signals are going to be knocked out too. Financially there must've been about a billion gil worth of damage. An' that ain't all!! A lotta innocent people got killed too! If the explosion had been in the middle of the night, that woulda been one thing. At least the people coulda gone in their sleep.
Dialogue: Ya see, I keep on top of these things, an' if ya ask me...... If you knock out Midgar's power, then all of its computers and signals are going to be knocked out too. If the explosion had been in the middle of the night, that woulda been one thing. At least the people coulda gone in their sleep.

Dialogue: Oh, well excuse ME!

Original: NPC: Oh, well excuse ME!
Dialogue: Oh, well excuse ME!

Dialogue: This Mako explosion has really sent Midgar into a fit.

Original: NPC: Hey, come over here. But people will... Who cares? But... There's a weirdo over there. Huh? Say, you're pretty gutsy. Why don't you go snoop somewhere else, Romeo?
Dialogue: Hey, come over here. But people will... Who cares? But... There's a weirdo over there. Huh? Say, you're pretty gutsy. Why don't you go snoop somewhere else, Romeo?

Dialogue: Hey!! Open up! C'mon baby!! It's me! Johnny! Mom!!

Dialogue: There's a TV in there, but my cheap aunt won't let me in the house. Look for yourself.

Original: NPC: Now that you mention it, there used to be an outside TV monitor here in the slums. But that Barret, busted it up. Shot it up with that weird machine gun hand of his. Blam, blam, blam. I think it was when President Shinra was on. He was on again this morning, too, you know. Tifa better watch out for her TV.
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, there used to be an outside TV monitor here in the slums. But that Barret, busted it up. Shot it up with that weird machine gun hand of his. Blam, blam, blam. I think it was when President Shinra was on. He was on again this morning, too, you know. Tifa better watch out for her TV.

Dialogue: All's quiet!! Shh, I'm spying now! OH!! There's something!! DANGER!! ALERT!!

Dialogue: Did you hear?

Original: NPC: About that little girl named Tifa and that bar called '7th Heaven'. I'm not only informed, I'm kinda nosey too. Anyhow, I got the scoop. You wanna hear?
Dialogue: About that little girl named Tifa and that bar called '7th Heaven'. I'm not only informed, I'm kinda nosey too. Anyhow, I got the scoop. You wanna hear?

Original: NPC: That Barret and three of his henchmen are like this sometimes. Suddenly, they threw out a customer and start talking trash to him. It's strange, if you ask me. And that place always smells like gun powder. It's dangerous, I tell you. They must be doing terrible things in there.
Dialogue: That Barret and three of his henchmen are like this sometimes. Suddenly, they threw out a customer and start talking trash to him. It's strange, if you ask me. And that place always smells like gun powder. It's dangerous, I tell you. They must be doing terrible things in there.

Original: NPC: Oh really? Well, aren't you a cool one!
Dialogue: Oh really? Well, aren't you a cool one!

Original: NPC: Oh really? Well, aren't you a cool one!
Dialogue: Oh really? Well, aren't you a cool one!

Original: NPC: Heh heh...He'll forget about it. OH, you!! Get my friend on the second floor to teach ya.
Dialogue: Heh heh...He'll forget about it. OH, you!! Get my friend on the second floor to teach ya.

Original: On-screen: How to use the buttons.
Dialogue: How to use the buttons.

Original: Cloud: Huh? Finger!? What the hell?
Dialogue: Huh? Finger!? What the hell?

Original: On-screen: I'm the position cursor!! Call me whenever you're walking around confused! Push the [SELECT] button and I'll appear over your shiny little head.
Dialogue: I'm the position cursor!! Call me whenever you're walking around confused! Push the [SELECT] button and I'll appear over your shiny little head.

Original: Cloud: Geez, you stand out even more than I do...
Dialogue: Geez, you stand out even more than I do...

Original: On-screen: Am I in the way? If so, just push the [SELECT] button one more time. I'm pretty busy myself, and can't always come when you need me. If I don't show up sometimes, don't get mad. Later! [Position Cursor] Push the [SELECT] button when you're lost in the field. Usually, the [Position Cursor] will appear on the screen. But wait!! [Red triangles] mark the exits and [Green triangles] mark ladders. These will help you safely make it through even the darkest streets or dangerous mountains! But, there are times when it won't appear, so be careful.
Dialogue: Am I in the way? If so, just push the [SELECT] button one more time. I'm pretty busy myself, and can't always come when you need me. If I don't show up sometimes, don't get mad. Later! [Position Cursor] Push the [SELECT] button when you're lost in the field. Usually, the [Position Cursor] will appear on the screen. But wait!! [Red triangles] mark the exits and [Green triangles] mark ladders. These will help you safely make it through even the darkest streets or dangerous mountains! But, there are times when it won't appear, so be careful.

Original: NPC: This is the Beginner's Hall. You say you're a beginner? But your eyes say you're not.
Dialogue: This is the Beginner's Hall. You say you're a beginner? But your eyes say you're not.

Original: Cloud: Don't mess with me. I used to be in SOLDIER. I'll tell you how much I know... an' for free too!
Dialogue: Don't mess with me. I used to be in SOLDIER. I'll tell you how much I know... an' for free too!

Original: Cloud: What do you want to know?
Dialogue: What do you want to know?

Original: Cloud: Now I'll tell you about saving. You know what'll happen if you don't save? That's right. Everything you worked so hard to do will be lost! You never know when there might be a power outage. And you've got a long battle ahead of you. It pays to save often and take breaks when you need them. Anyway you'll need a Memory card to save your games. But, uh, none of the stores around here sell any. You'll have to get some at a (real) store. I guess you already have a Memory card. Put the Card firmly into the slot. Put it in either the right or left side. Then when you're ready, access the menu. Select [Save]. Remember you can't just save wherever you want. You can only save at places marked [Save Point]. When you find one, a message will appear. Whenever you reach a [Save Point], you'll want to save your game. Slot 1 is on the left, slot 2 on the right. Choose either one. Next, choose your file and save it. Each Memory card can hold up to 15 files. If you have files from other games on it, there will be less room to save. The screen only shows 3 files at a time so, press the directional buttons to scroll down the list, and you can see the rest. Remember, the more files you have, the longer it will take to load. One last thing. The Memory card is a delicate device. Be careful when handling it. Never remove it while saving or loading. Don't get mad even if you lose. If that happens, just chill out, and let your head, and your console, cool down. That's all. Remember to save often so you don't lose your games.
Dialogue: Now I'll tell you about saving. You know what'll happen if you don't save? That's right. Everything you worked so hard to do will be lost! You never know when there might be a power outage. And you've got a long battle ahead of you. It pays to save often and take breaks when you need them. Anyway you'll need a Memory card to save your games. But, uh, none of the stores around here sell any. You'll have to get some at a (real) store. I guess you already have a Memory card. Put the Card firmly into the slot. Put it in either the right or left side. Then when you're ready, access the menu. Select [Save]. Remember you can't just save wherever you want. You can only save at places marked [Save Point]. When you find one, a message will appear. Whenever you reach a [Save Point], you'll want to save your game. Slot 1 is on the left, slot 2 on the right. Choose either one. Next, choose your file and save it. Each Memory card can hold up to 15 files. If you have files from other games on it, there will be less room to save. The screen only shows 3 files at a time so, press the directional buttons to scroll down the list, and you can see the rest. Remember, the more files you have, the longer it will take to load. One last thing. The Memory card is a delicate device. Be careful when handling it. Never remove it while saving or loading. Don't get mad even if you lose. If that happens, just chill out, and let your head, and your console, cool down. That's all. Remember to save often so you don't lose your games.

Original: Cloud: First, you need Potions.
Dialogue: First, you need Potions.

Original: NPC: You're a stingy one. Here, I'll give you ONE Potion.
Dialogue: You're a stingy one. Here, I'll give you ONE Potion.

Original: NPC: I don't have any extra Potions on me. Why don't you go buy some?
Dialogue: I don't have any extra Potions on me. Why don't you go buy some?

Original: Cloud: You probably already know this but... HP is your life force. If HP is lost in battle, you're out of commission. MP is the source of your magic power. If your MP's lost, you'll be unable to cast spells. So, what should we do to cure a damaged ally? There are three ways. First, you can rest at an inn at a nearby town. Second, you can use items to help them recover. Third, you can use curative magic. I'll explain about Magic later, but here we'll talk about items. Select [Item] from the menu. Potion restores HP. If you can't find where Potion is, access the menu and select [Arrange] to change the order of items. You can arrange them however you like. Order items you'll use in the field. Order items you'll use in battle. Prioritize items you can throw in battle. Order weapons and armor separately. Order by name Order by most items held Order by least items held By the way, [Key Item]'s are just that, items that unlock problems just like a key. They're very important items to have. Keep that in mind. Ok, now select [Use], Then select [Potion]. Select the person you want to use it on. If they're already maxed out, you won't be able to use it on them. We can restore MP with [Ether]. You use this the same way you did for [Potion]. Just pick a member and use it! The number appearing next to the item name tells you how many are available. Of course, the more you use, the less you'll have. Some enemies will drop Potions or Ethers, but you'll want to stock up whenever you're at a store. One last thing, if someone in your party gets wiped out, either rest at an inn or use [Phoenix Down]. That's all!
Dialogue: You probably already know this but... HP is your life force. If HP is lost in battle, you're out of commission. MP is the source of your magic power. If your MP's lost, you'll be unable to cast spells. So, what should we do to cure a damaged ally? There are three ways. First, you can rest at an inn at a nearby town. Second, you can use items to help them recover. Third, you can use curative magic. I'll explain about Magic later, but here we'll talk about items. Select [Item] from the menu. Potion restores HP. If you can't find where Potion is, access the menu and select [Arrange] to change the order of items. You can arrange them however you like. Order items you'll use in the field. Order items you'll use in battle. Prioritize items you can throw in battle. Order weapons and armor separately. Order by name Order by most items held Order by least items held By the way, [Key Item]'s are just that, items that unlock problems just like a key. They're very important items to have. Keep that in mind. Ok, now select [Use], Then select [Potion]. Select the person you want to use it on. If they're already maxed out, you won't be able to use it on them. We can restore MP with [Ether]. You use this the same way you did for [Potion]. Just pick a member and use it! The number appearing next to the item name tells you how many are available. Of course, the more you use, the less you'll have. Some enemies will drop Potions or Ethers, but you'll want to stock up whenever you're at a store. One last thing, if someone in your party gets wiped out, either rest at an inn or use [Phoenix Down]. That's all!

Original: Cloud: Now I'll tell you how to use curative magic. First, access the menu and select [Magic]. Next, select who'll cast the spell. Pick an ally equipped with [Restore] Materia. You can select another party member by using the L1 and R1 buttons. The function also work in other sub menus. Better remember that. This is magic you can use, monsters you can summon, and enemy techniques you've learned. Whenever [Magic] is selected... the available magic appears on the screen... So, if you wanted to use [Cure]... you would select it from the menu... then select who you want to use it on. I think Potion is pretty expensive, so... when you're near an inn and you can restore MP, it's better to use curative magic rather than Potion. That's all.
Dialogue: Now I'll tell you how to use curative magic. First, access the menu and select [Magic]. Next, select who'll cast the spell. Pick an ally equipped with [Restore] Materia. You can select another party member by using the L1 and R1 buttons. The function also work in other sub menus. Better remember that. This is magic you can use, monsters you can summon, and enemy techniques you've learned. Whenever [Magic] is selected... the available magic appears on the screen... So, if you wanted to use [Cure]... you would select it from the menu... then select who you want to use it on. I think Potion is pretty expensive, so... when you're near an inn and you can restore MP, it's better to use curative magic rather than Potion. That's all.

Original: Cloud: Equipping weapons & armor is basic to battle. Let me show you how it's done. Just finding or buying new weapons or armor, isn't enough. You have to access the menu and select [Equip]. Then, select who you want to equip. You can change weapons, armor and accessories. Accessories have special effects. Just select what you want to change. On the right side of the screen, here's a list of what can be equipped. You can see the item's effect here. Change your weapon with the OK button. Make sure it'll increase attack/defense levels. Pay special attention to Materia slots. The slots that are linked are effective. Also check the growth rates of Materia. Now when you want to remove an accessory... press the triangle button here. You should never remove weapons or armor. Because you never know when you'll be attacked. After you're finished equipping, you should re-equip your Materia. That's it!
Dialogue: Equipping weapons & armor is basic to battle. Let me show you how it's done. Just finding or buying new weapons or armor, isn't enough. You have to access the menu and select [Equip]. Then, select who you want to equip. You can change weapons, armor and accessories. Accessories have special effects. Just select what you want to change. On the right side of the screen, here's a list of what can be equipped. You can see the item's effect here. Change your weapon with the OK button. Make sure it'll increase attack/defense levels. Pay special attention to Materia slots. The slots that are linked are effective. Also check the growth rates of Materia. Now when you want to remove an accessory... press the triangle button here. You should never remove weapons or armor. Because you never know when you'll be attacked. After you're finished equipping, you should re-equip your Materia. That's it!

Original: Cloud: Materia can unleash hidden power in humans. So let's see how Materia is used. First, access the menu. Then select [Materia]. Select who you want to use it. Pay close attention to my weapon here. Each weapon and armor has slots in them. Choose which slot you want to put Materia in. Now select the Materia you want to use. This is curative Materia. If you want to know what its effect is, line the cursor up with [Check], and push the OK button. It's just like selecting battle commands. Just line the cursor up to [magic], you can see that the available magic has increased. Now you can use new magic [Cure]. And that's all there is to equipping Materia. See? It wasn't that tough! When you want to remove Materia, it's as easy as pointing to the materia slot, and pushing the triangle button. There's only one thing you have to watch out for. When you equip Materia, your condition changes. Parts of you will become stronger... while others get weaker. Normally, when you equip [Magic] Materia, your magic power will get stronger. But your physical strength weakens. So, Materia's kind of a double-edged sword. The left side of the screen, shows the effect of the Materia. Try out everything. And that's all. I'll tell you about some of the finer points next.
Dialogue: Materia can unleash hidden power in humans. So let's see how Materia is used. First, access the menu. Then select [Materia]. Select who you want to use it. Pay close attention to my weapon here. Each weapon and armor has slots in them. Choose which slot you want to put Materia in. Now select the Materia you want to use. This is curative Materia. If you want to know what its effect is, line the cursor up with [Check], and push the OK button. It's just like selecting battle commands. Just line the cursor up to [magic], you can see that the available magic has increased. Now you can use new magic [Cure]. And that's all there is to equipping Materia. See? It wasn't that tough! When you want to remove Materia, it's as easy as pointing to the materia slot, and pushing the triangle button. There's only one thing you have to watch out for. When you equip Materia, your condition changes. Parts of you will become stronger... while others get weaker. Normally, when you equip [Magic] Materia, your magic power will get stronger. But your physical strength weakens. So, Materia's kind of a double-edged sword. The left side of the screen, shows the effect of the Materia. Try out everything. And that's all. I'll tell you about some of the finer points next.

Original: Cloud: Access the menu if you find Materia. There's a lot of different Materia around. This is one of them. It's [All] Materia. If you equip this alone, nothing will happen. It's a little tricky, but I'll tell you anyway. Now look at my weapon. Look closely at those two slots. They're joined together as linked slots. You've got to remember to put it into linked slots. Different Materia will affect each other. But only if the slots are linked. Just to show you, let's put some [All] into one of the slots, and [Lightning] in the other. Now we can use [Bolt] on [All] the enemies. But it's limited to once per battle. Combine different things and you'll come up with different results. Combining [Restore] and [All], will let you use [Cure] for your entire party. There are also many useless combinations. For example, [Restore] and [Lightning] [Bolt] and [Cure] can be used normally, but there won't be any compound effect. Specialized Materia like [All] is called [Support Materia]. You can tell the difference just by looking at the Materia's color. This may sound weird, but did you know Materia grows on its own? Even if one of your allies uses it, it will continue to grow with each battle. As its level increases, so will the effects of the magic you can use. I told you [All] works once per battle. But it can work twice or more as it grows. When you get it to the master level, Materia will divide itself, looking like it's giving birth. But that master Materia won't grow anymore. When you can't take Materia on anymore, you'd better sell it or dump it somewhere. You can see the useful functions here. You can [Arrange] Materia, [Remove all] Materia from your weapon. You can throw Materia into the [Trash]. Oops, relax! I wasn't gonna dump it. Let's see. This is a special menu for you. You can exchange all Materia you have between allies, even if they're not in your party. Now about Materia's growth. The growth rate depends on what weapon or armor it's put into. Some will double in growth, while others won't grow at all. In most cases, the Materia's effect won't change whether you put it into a weapon or armor. But [Elemental] and [Added Effect] are completely different depending on whether they're put into weapons or armor. You've got to think about what weapon or armor to use, or what Materia combinations will be the strongest. I remember hearing once... about extraordinary Materia somewhere in the world. I think I've told you just about everything I can.

Original: Cloud: I'll explain your party's order in battle. First, access the menu and select [Order]. Next, select who you want to switch. Now, select the position you want. This will change their position in battle. In this case there isn't any advantage/disadvantage. But when you select the same person twice, it will place them in either the front/back row in a battle. When they're on the left side of the screen, that'll be the front row... When they're on the right, that'll be the back row. When you're in the front row and you select [Attack] you inflict major damage on your enemy. But you will also receive greater damage. While in the back row, although you do less damage to the enemy, you also receive less damage. For magic attacks, there's no difference in damage between the front & back rows. There is also no difference when you use long range weapons. It's better to keep weaker members... in the back row. And that's it. Of course, I'm better off in the front row!
Dialogue: I'll explain your party's order in battle. First, access the menu and select [Order]. Next, select who you want to switch. Now, select the position you want. This will change their position in battle. In this case there isn't any advantage/disadvantage. But when you select the same person twice, it will place them in either the front/back row in a battle. When they're on the left side of the screen, that'll be the front row... When they're on the right, that'll be the back row. When you're in the front row and you select [Attack] you inflict major damage on your enemy. But you will also receive greater damage. While in the back row, although you do less damage to the enemy, you also receive less damage. For magic attacks, there's no difference in damage between the front & back rows. There is also no difference when you use long range weapons. It's better to keep weaker members... in the back row. And that's it. Of course, I'm better off in the front row!

Original: Cloud: You must know your current status. That's one of the basics of battle. Access the menu and select [Status]. Next, select the member you want to check. Were you surprised at the amount of information? I'll explain the order. First, these are your experience points and your level. The more experience you get in battle, the stronger you become. This gauge tells you how many points you need to get to the next level. If you can't beat stronger enemies, raise your level by fighting weaker ones. You'll improve your physical and magical skills. Next is HP and MP. HP is your life force. When it reaches zero, you won't be able to fight. MP is the source of your magic power. Every time you cast magic, you use MP. and when you run out of MP, you won't be able to cast spells. This is called the Limit gauge. It shows your anger level. When the gauge is full, you can use a "Limit Technique". I'll tell you about "Limit Techniques" later. You know the battle commands are classified roughly into two groups. [Attack] is for regular physical attacks. [Magic] and [Summon] cast magic attacks. Each has attacking power, defense power, and escape probabilities. The value depends on your equipment, and experience level. The total effect is on the chart below. These are commands you can use in battle. And your presently equipped weapons, armor, and accessories. Press the OK button here one more time. There are all types of attacks... Some monsters are weak against fire, others are weak against ice or lightning. The Materia or items you have can add these [Elemental]s to your attacks or protect yourself from them in an enemy attack. This chart shows your current attributes. Press the OK button here one more time. The chart below means [Added Effect]s. Some enemies will use sneaky attacks on you. These attacks change your condition, such as... sleep, confuse, poison, darkness, petrify, silence, small, frog, and so on. These conditions disappear after each battle, except fury and sadness which will remain. To cure these conditions quickly, use items or magic. There are specific medicines for each condition. I know I'm repeating myself but,... when you're taken out in battle, I mean, when you're almost dead, use [Life] magic or the item [Phoenix down]. When you change Materia or equipment it's best to look here to check on them. Mastering Elementals and Added Effects... will make your battles safer. That's all.
