Original: Cloud: Here are a few hints on limit techniques. When an enemy has pushed your anger to the limits, you can unleash unimaginable power. You know what I mean, right? The trick is how to use it. Access the menu and select [Limit]. Now select a member. Now decide what your limit will be. Lower limits have less power, but you can use them more often. If you set your limit higher, you can inflict great damage, but you'll have to wait longer. After using this technique for awhile, you'll improve your technique. Your development will change depending on how you fight. I can't tell you how it will change. That's something you'll have to find out by yourself. I've heard a rumor about secret items that inspire ultimate techniques. I don't know whether or not those items really exist. That's it! Try everything out and use what's best for you!
Dialogue: Here are a few hints on limit techniques. When an enemy has pushed your anger to the limits, you can unleash unimaginable power. You know what I mean, right? The trick is how to use it. Access the menu and select [Limit]. Now select a member. Now decide what your limit will be. Lower limits have less power, but you can use them more often. If you set your limit higher, you can inflict great damage, but you'll have to wait longer. After using this technique for awhile, you'll improve your technique. Your development will change depending on how you fight. I can't tell you how it will change. That's something you'll have to find out by yourself. I've heard a rumor about secret items that inspire ultimate techniques. I don't know whether or not those items really exist. That's it! Try everything out and use what's best for you!

Original: Cloud: You probably know all this. But just in case, I'll go over it. Until you get instructions, don't open or take discs out of the PlayStation. After you open up the Disc Cover I can't guarantee what'll happen. That's all.
Dialogue: You probably know all this. But just in case, I'll go over it. Until you get instructions, don't open or take discs out of the PlayStation. After you open up the Disc Cover I can't guarantee what'll happen. That's all.

Original: NPC: Hey!! You got one right off! That was Materia. Next, take this [treasure chest]!
Dialogue: Hey!! You got one right off! That was Materia. Next, take this [treasure chest]!

Original: NPC: Now listen, Hidden in these treasure chests, are a lot of items There are box types and bag types, so make sure you don't overlook any.
Dialogue: Now listen, Hidden in these treasure chests, are a lot of items There are box types and bag types, so make sure you don't overlook any.

Original: NPC: This is the fabled [Save Point]!! At a [Save Point] you can use a [tent] and/or select "SAVE". There's more, too. Look for something called secret. Even if you are wiped out, if you save you can restart from that same point. That way you don't have to worry when you've been wiped out. This is jumping ahead a little but, when you leave Midgar... Once you get the world map, you can save anywhere you like. Remember that. That should be all you need to know about the Save Point. I'll probably see you again somewhere on the road. Take care! I'm a [treasure chest]!! Beginners make sure and keep an eye out for me!!
Dialogue: This is the fabled [Save Point]!! At a [Save Point] you can use a [tent] and/or select "SAVE". There's more, too. Look for something called secret. Even if you are wiped out, if you save you can restart from that same point. That way you don't have to worry when you've been wiped out. This is jumping ahead a little but, when you leave Midgar... Once you get the world map, you can save anywhere you like. Remember that. That should be all you need to know about the Save Point. I'll probably see you again somewhere on the road. Take care! I'm a [treasure chest]!! Beginners make sure and keep an eye out for me!!

Original: NPCs: ......smack......knock......!! Help!
Dialogue: ......smack......knock......!! Help!

Original: Cloud: You've got to hang in there. You're limit gauge is just starting to build.
Dialogue: You've got to hang in there. You're limit gauge is just starting to build.

Original: NPCs: Waaaah!!
Dialogue: Waaaah!!

Original: Cloud: Ok! Now your limit gauge is full, go ahead and use it! Fight with your limit technique.
Dialogue: Ok! Now your limit gauge is full, go ahead and use it! Fight with your limit technique.

Original: Cloud: Great!
Dialogue: Great!

Original: NPCs: Magic!! Magic!! Help!
Dialogue: Magic!! Magic!! Help!

Original: Cloud: Calm down! When your enemy uses magic counter with [Magic Barrier] or [reflect]. [Magic Barrier] reduces the damage received from magic by half. [reflect] bounces the attacks off you. But the number of times you can use it is limited so be careful.
Dialogue: Calm down! When your enemy uses magic counter with [Magic Barrier] or [reflect]. [Magic Barrier] reduces the damage received from magic by half. [reflect] bounces the attacks off you. But the number of times you can use it is limited so be careful.

Original: Cloud: Great!
Dialogue: Great!

Original: Cloud: If you want to get as strong as me you need to use Materia. And you have to find the best combinations of them. The type of Materia you put in your weapons and armor will determine how quickly your Materia grows. Put Materia into the open slots in your weapons and armor. The possible combinations are limitless. That's about all I can tell you. If you want to be like me, you have to have some natural talent.
Dialogue: If you want to get as strong as me you need to use Materia. And you have to find the best combinations of them. The type of Materia you put in your weapons and armor will determine how quickly your Materia grows. Put Materia into the open slots in your weapons and armor. The possible combinations are limitless. That's about all I can tell you. If you want to be like me, you have to have some natural talent.

Original: Cloud: Listen kid, don't piss me off! That's all right. Just give it a try. Little by little, you'll get used to it.
Dialogue: Listen kid, don't piss me off! That's all right. Just give it a try. Little by little, you'll get used to it.

Original: NPC: Hey SOLDIER!! Tell us about battles! We'll even pay you!
Dialogue: Hey SOLDIER!! Tell us about battles! We'll even pay you!

Original: Cloud: I'm not hard up enough to take money from guys like you. But I'll rap with you for a while.
Dialogue: I'm not hard up enough to take money from guys like you. But I'll rap with you for a while.

Original: Cloud: What do you want to know?
Dialogue: What do you want to know?

Original: Cloud: ATB or Active Time Battle is a system that is always in operation during battle. Select [Wait] from ATB on the Config Menu and time will stop when you select magic or items during battle. This gives you time to pick out your commands. This is especially helpful to beginners. Selecting [Recommended] ATB in the config menu can stop time while the effects of spells and items are taking place during battle. This lets you take your time looking over the progression of the battle. When you don't want to rush in battle, this is for you! Personally, I always use [Active], but you can use whichever you like.
Dialogue: ATB or Active Time Battle is a system that is always in operation during battle. Select [Wait] from ATB on the Config Menu and time will stop when you select magic or items during battle. This gives you time to pick out your commands. This is especially helpful to beginners. Selecting [Recommended] ATB in the config menu can stop time while the effects of spells and items are taking place during battle. This lets you take your time looking over the progression of the battle. When you don't want to rush in battle, this is for you! Personally, I always use [Active], but you can use whichever you like.

Original: Cloud: White numbers appearing on the screen in battle are damage points. Green numbers show restorative points. You better watch these if you don't want to get wiped out.
Dialogue: White numbers appearing on the screen in battle are damage points. Green numbers show restorative points. You better watch these if you don't want to get wiped out.

Original: Cloud: The [change] command can move characters to and from the front and back rows. In the back row, the damage received is less, but the attacking power is less. You can make a [change] by pressing the Directional button in battle. Pushing the Directional button the other direction during battle accesses [defend]. Selecting [defend] reduces the damage you receive by half until the next command. If you're up against a strong enemy, Don't hesitate to use this one. Of course, I never need it.
Dialogue: The [change] command can move characters to and from the front and back rows. In the back row, the damage received is less, but the attacking power is less. You can make a [change] by pressing the Directional button in battle. Pushing the Directional button the other direction during battle accesses [defend]. Selecting [defend] reduces the damage you receive by half until the next command. If you're up against a strong enemy, Don't hesitate to use this one. Of course, I never need it.

Original: Cloud: I don't really remember ever having to use the [escape] command... but you'll probably need it. Push the L1 and R1 buttons at the same time, holding them down, and you can escape.
Dialogue: I don't really remember ever having to use the [escape] command... but you'll probably need it. Push the L1 and R1 buttons at the same time, holding them down, and you can escape.

Original: Cloud: During battle, there are several [gauges] displayed. You can't check them now, so just remember what I tell you. [time gauge] displays the time remaining until your next turn while in battle. When the gauge is full, you can make your command. If you don't want to make one, push the
Dialogue: During battle, there are several [gauges] displayed. You can't check them now, so just remember what I tell you. [time gauge] displays the time remaining until your next turn while in battle. When the gauge is full, you can make your command. If you don't want to make one, push the

Original: Cloud: [status] means just that. The status of each character. I'll probably wind up repeating myself, but let me go over a few basic points. Sleep You cannot put in a command until you get up. Poison Steals your HP in battle. Fury Damage is increased, attack accuracy decreased. Tranquilizers will remedy it. Sadness Damage is decreased. Hyper will remedy it. Petrify Will petrify and become immobilized. Every member will be wiped out. Confuse Will attack enemy and ally alike. Silence Will be unable to cast magic. Paralyze Stops time gauges, commands. Darkness Accuracy of hitting attacks decreases. Frog Become a frog. I hate this one!
Dialogue: [status] means just that. The status of each character. I'll probably wind up repeating myself, but let me go over a few basic points. Sleep You cannot put in a command until you get up. Poison Steals your HP in battle. Fury Damage is increased, attack accuracy decreased. Tranquilizers will remedy it. Sadness Damage is decreased. Hyper will remedy it. Petrify Will petrify and become immobilized. Every member will be wiped out. Confuse Will attack enemy and ally alike. Silence Will be unable to cast magic. Paralyze Stops time gauges, commands. Darkness Accuracy of hitting attacks decreases. Frog Become a frog. I hate this one!

Original: Cloud: Hoo...I'm beat. [status change], since this can be changed with magic and items, you should check it whenever you buy things.
Dialogue: Hoo...I'm beat. [status change], since this can be changed with magic and items, you should check it whenever you buy things.

Original: Cloud: [elemental] is the special effect that comes with certain weapons and magic. It's necessary to move ahead effectively. If you pay attention to the types of elementals you use you'll become intermediate in no time. I put together this list, but remember, it's just a partial list don't take it too literally. Fire Fire effect. Works best on animals and water monsters. Ice Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters and things that hate the cold. Lightning Lightning effect. Works best on mechanical things. Earth Attacks using the earth's power. Doesn't work on flying enemies. Poison Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on any poison based enemies. Gravity Gravity based attack. These hurt if they hit. Water Calls on the earth's water. Works well on fire monsters. Wind Calls up the winds. Works well on flying enemies. Holy Calls up the Planet's power. Works well on dark monsters.
Dialogue: [elemental] is the special effect that comes with certain weapons and magic. It's necessary to move ahead effectively. If you pay attention to the types of elementals you use you'll become intermediate in no time. I put together this list, but remember, it's just a partial list don't take it too literally. Fire Fire effect. Works best on animals and water monsters. Ice Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters and things that hate the cold. Lightning Lightning effect. Works best on mechanical things. Earth Attacks using the earth's power. Doesn't work on flying enemies. Poison Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on any poison based enemies. Gravity Gravity based attack. These hurt if they hit. Water Calls on the earth's water. Works well on fire monsters. Wind Calls up the winds. Works well on flying enemies. Holy Calls up the Planet's power. Works well on dark monsters.

Original: Cloud: If you use reciprocal elementals in your attacks, the effect is huge! Also, if you use the same elemental, your defenses are raised. But, you have to be careful because the opposite is also true. To see what elementals an enemy has, you need [Sense] Materia. If you get that Materia, you should try using it.
Dialogue: If you use reciprocal elementals in your attacks, the effect is huge! Also, if you use the same elemental, your defenses are raised. But, you have to be careful because the opposite is also true. To see what elementals an enemy has, you need [Sense] Materia. If you get that Materia, you should try using it.

Original: Cloud: Looks like you didn't get it the last time I told you. What's wrong with you? You touched in the head? Well, don't worry. You just need to push the [SELECT] button in battle. Do that, and the [help message] will walk you through the commands. It also shows you the name of your enemy, so even I use it once in a while. Make good use of it.
Dialogue: Looks like you didn't get it the last time I told you. What's wrong with you? You touched in the head? Well, don't worry. You just need to push the [SELECT] button in battle. Do that, and the [help message] will walk you through the commands. It also shows you the name of your enemy, so even I use it once in a while. Make good use of it.

Original: NPC: He used to give us nothing but headaches when he was here, but now that he's gone...I kind of miss him. ......strange, isn't it?
Dialogue: He used to give us nothing but headaches when he was here, but now that he's gone...I kind of miss him. ......strange, isn't it?

Original: NPC: Ha! Ha!...... I wonder if my son's already left? When it's just my wife and I here, you have no idea how lonesome it gets.
Dialogue: Ha! Ha!...... I wonder if my son's already left? When it's just my wife and I here, you have no idea how lonesome it gets.

Original: NPC: You want them to be happy and do what they want while they're young, but being a parent, you can't help but worry... I guess I'm not cut out to be a parent yet.
Dialogue: You want them to be happy and do what they want while they're young, but being a parent, you can't help but worry... I guess I'm not cut out to be a parent yet.

Original: NPC: By the way...... Where are you from?
Dialogue: By the way...... Where are you from?

Original: NPC: Hm......you said Nibelheim? Wasn't it in the news a while back? Something to do with a Reactor accident... That was the first major Mako accident, so I remember it really being a hot topic.
Dialogue: Hm......you said Nibelheim? Wasn't it in the news a while back? Something to do with a Reactor accident... That was the first major Mako accident, so I remember it really being a hot topic.

Original: NPC: Ha, Ha!...... Well, there's nothin' wrong with that, I'd say. But if you still have a family, You outta at least write them. Even though you may turn your back on your hometown, It'll always be there for you. Least that's how I see it.
Dialogue: Ha, Ha!...... Well, there's nothin' wrong with that, I'd say. But if you still have a family, You outta at least write them. Even though you may turn your back on your hometown, It'll always be there for you. Least that's how I see it.

Original: NPC: Well, you mind leaving the two of us alone? I want to enjoy some quiet time together with my wife.
Dialogue: Well, you mind leaving the two of us alone? I want to enjoy some quiet time together with my wife.

Original: Clerk: Ahh... Another slow day...... If this keeps up, this store's goin' under... Can't sell any really good medicine in a slum like this.
Dialogue: Ahh... Another slow day...... If this keeps up, this store's goin' under... Can't sell any really good medicine in a slum like this.

Original: Clerk: Oh!! Look at this! This doesn't happen everyday. You a......customer? Yes!! Welcome!! We sell! We buy!
Dialogue: Oh!! Look at this! This doesn't happen everyday. You a......customer? Yes!! Welcome!! We sell ! We buy!

Original: Guard 1: You know, I got some tickets to "Loveless", do you want to go?
Dialogue: You know, I got some tickets to "Loveless", do you want to go?

Original: Guard 2: What're you, retarded? Midgar's under martial law now!
Dialogue: What're you, retarded? Midgar's under martial law now!

Original: Guard 1: You mean, you really are concerned for me?
Dialogue: You mean, you really are concerned for me?

Original: Guard 2: Hell no!! But in case you forgot, we're in the middle of a slum. They could be anywhere around, so stay on your guard.
Dialogue: Hell no!! But in case you forgot, we're in the middle of a slum. They could be anywhere around, so stay on your guard.

Original: Guard 1: Right. You mean the AVALANCHERS?
Dialogue: Right. You mean the AVALANCHERS?

Original: Guard 2: Don't you worry. SOLDIER has been added to the police force.
Dialogue: Don't you worry. SOLDIER has been added to the police force.

Original: Guard 1: Boy, it's been a while since SOLDIER's been mobilized, hasn't it? I ever tell you that I flunked the SOLDIER entrance exam? Damn right!! blahblahblah.......
Dialogue: Boy, it's been a while since SOLDIER's been mobilized, hasn't it? I ever tell you that I flunked the SOLDIER entrance exam? Damn right!! blahblahblah.......

Original: Guard 2: Hey shut up for a minute and let me get back to work!
Dialogue: Hey shut up for a minute and let me get back to work!

Original: Guard 1: What are you more scared of... AVALANCHE or me?
Dialogue: What are you more scared of... AVALANCHE or me?

Original: Guard 2: Oh, you, of course.
Dialogue: Oh, you, of course.

Original: Guard 2: HALT!! No one is allowed to pass!!
Dialogue: HALT!! No one is allowed to pass!!

Original: NPCs: I've had it! Me too. You know this is the first time, we've ever agreed on something. Yes...... Well then, shall we......? Yes......
Dialogue: I've had it! Me too. You know this is the first time, we've ever agreed on something. Yes...... Well then, shall we......? Yes......

Original: NPCs: urggh............ huff......wheez
Dialogue: urggh............ huff......wheez

Original: Conductor: Morning. Dawn comes and things never change. You be careful not to get hurt. Come on back again, hear?
Dialogue: Morning. Dawn comes and things never change. You be careful not to get hurt. Come on back again, hear?

Original: Conductor: ALL ABOARD! The train is about to depart.
Dialogue: ALL ABOARD! The train is about to depart.

Original: Johnny: I'm leaving. Goin' faraway. But when I come back I'll be a better man! This is goodbye! Hey! Childhood friend! You better take good care of Tifa!
Dialogue: I'm leaving. Goin' faraway. But when I come back I'll be a better man! This is goodbye! Hey! Childhood friend! You better take good care of Tifa!

Original: NPC: I hope he doesn't get hurt. That worries me the most.
Dialogue: I hope he doesn't get hurt. That worries me the most.

Original: NPC: Ahh! Now I ain't got no one to pick on!
Dialogue: Ahh! Now I ain't got no one to pick on!

Original: NPC: Yesterday, everyone in town was peeking at the two of you from outside the bar. Tifa's childhood friend. That's a good one!
Dialogue: Yesterday, everyone in town was peeking at the two of you from outside the bar. Tifa's childhood friend. That's a good one!

Original: NPC: Ah...Johnny's gone. You look a little disappointed. I don't like to say it myself but, I'm just a lonely guy when I'm not drinking.
Dialogue: Ah...Johnny's gone. You look a little disappointed. I don't like to say it myself but, I'm just a lonely guy when I'm not drinking.

Original: NPC: When it comes down to it...I'm gutless. I'm still just a no good kid.
Dialogue: When it comes down to it...I'm gutless. I'm still just a no good kid.

Original: NPC: Listen! If there isn't anyone to listen, what's the use of getting gossip on everyone!? Yeah, and you Mr. I-don't-care! I'll get a little more information that would poque even your interest. You wait and see!
Dialogue: Listen! If there isn't anyone to listen, what's the use of getting gossip on everyone!? Yeah, and you Mr. I-don't-care! I'll get a little more information that would poque even your interest. You wait and see!

Original: Clerk: Uh oh...... There goes the pillar. I'm scared, but it's for your own good. If things get too hairy, we'll escape. It's not something you'll see happen too often.
Dialogue: Uh oh...... There goes the pillar. I'm scared, but it's for your own good. If things get too hairy, we'll escape. It's not something you'll see happen too often.

Original: NPC: Uhh......Help! My strange and wonderful little place.
Dialogue: Uhh......Help! My strange and wonderful little place.

Original: Guard 2: Doh! And this was supposed to be my last job! Do something!! I never thought this would ever happen to me! Great... I'm quitting tomorrow!
Dialogue: Doh! And this was supposed to be my last job! Do something!! I never thought this would ever happen to me! Great... I'm quitting tomorrow!

Original: Guard 1: L, look... This is my job, so I have to be here until the absolute last minute.
Dialogue: L, look... This is my job, so I have to be here until the absolute last minute.

Original: NPC: Umm... I just LOVE men with a sense of duty. Let me stay here with you.
Dialogue: Umm... I just LOVE men with a sense of duty. Let me stay here with you.

Original: Guard 1: B, but... What happens if AVALANCHE shows up?
Dialogue: B, but... What happens if AVALANCHE shows up?

Original: NPC: Umm...you're shaking. You're so gentle...I think I'm in love.
Dialogue: Umm...you're shaking. You're so gentle...I think I'm in love.

Original: Clerk: Hey! Don't come barging into my house and be opening up my freezer! Didn't your mother ever teach you that?
Dialogue: Hey! Don't come barging into my house and be opening up my freezer! Didn't your mother ever teach you that?

Original: On-screen: Turtles Paradise News No.1
Dialogue: Turtles Paradise News No.1

Original: NPC: Um, we're, um taking care of the um, flowers for the um, lady here. ......is that ok?
Dialogue: Um, we're, um taking care of the um, flowers for the um, lady here. ......is that ok?

Original: Cloud: Take good care of them.
Dialogue: Take good care of them.

Original: NPC 1: Yeah!
Dialogue: Yeah!

Original: NPC 2: Sure!
Dialogue: Sure!

Original: Cloud: That's too much to ask of kids.
Dialogue: That's too much to ask of kids.

Original: NPC: Too much to ask? What's that? I don't get it.
Dialogue: Too much to ask? What's that? I don't get it.

Original: NPC: They're purty!
Dialogue: They're purty!

Original: NPC: I'm gonna water them later......
Dialogue: I'm gonna water them later......

Original: NPC: Aaaaah......what a drag. You wanna go to that store in Sector 6 again?
Dialogue: Aaaaah......what a drag. You wanna go to that store in Sector 6 again?

Original: NPC: Huh? The hell are you? The hell do ya think you're talkin' to!!
Dialogue: Huh? The hell are you? The hell do ya think you're talkin' to!!

Original: NPC: That guy in the pipe's a weird one. No matter what you ask him, he only answers 'uuh' or 'aahh'.
Dialogue: That guy in the pipe's a weird one. No matter what you ask him, he only answers 'uuh' or 'aahh'.

Original: Aeris: This guy are sick. He passed out nearby and someone must have helped him here.
Dialogue: This guy are sick. He passed out nearby and someone must have helped him here.

Original: NPC: What am I doing? I'm walking around looking at the ground. You find a lot of things people dropped when you look down. You never find them when you're looking up. Right?
Dialogue: What am I doing? I'm walking around looking at the ground. You find a lot of things people dropped when you look down. You never find them when you're looking up. Right?

Original: NPC: You ever hear of Wall Market?
Dialogue: You ever hear of Wall Market?

Original: NPC: Oh yeah? Then maybe I should have you pick something up for me next time you're there...
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Then maybe I should have you pick something up for me next time you're there...

Original: NPC: It's a market in the slums of Sector 6. They've got everything you could ever want there. If you can get there, that is. The road's something else.
Dialogue: It's a market in the slums of Sector 6. They've got everything you could ever want there. If you can get there, that is. The road's something else.

Original: NPC: Outta the way! Move! You want something... move into the store!
Dialogue: Outta the way! Move! You want something... move into the store!

Original: NPC: ooh......aaah.........aghhhh......
Aeris: This is the one...... Won't you help him?
Dialogue: This is the one...... Won't you help him?

Original: NPC: ooh......aaah.........aghhhh......
Cloud: Listen, I'm no doctor.
Dialogue: Listen, I'm no doctor.

Original: Aeris: No...I guess not...
Dialogue: No...I guess not...

Original: Aeris: Hey...that man has a tattoo. I think it was the number 2.
Dialogue: Hey...that man has a tattoo. I think it was the number 2.

Original: Clerk: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here.
Dialogue: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here.

Original: Clerk: I don't care if it's scrap metal or materia. We can get anything here in the slums. Got a lot of good materia here. Why don't you look it over?
Dialogue: I don't care if it's scrap metal or materia. We can get anything here in the slums. Got a lot of good materia here. Why don't you look it over?

Original: Clerk: Take care of yourself. It's the law of the slums. But to do that, first you need weapons, right?
Dialogue: Take care of yourself. It's the law of the slums. But to do that, first you need weapons, right?

Original: NPC: Huh? You want weapons? That's too damn bad...... I ain't got no weapons to sell ya! And the reason why is... ...the weapon store's over that way.
Dialogue: Huh? You want weapons? That's too damn bad...... I ain't got no weapons to sell ya! And the reason why is... ...the weapon store's over that way.

Original: NPC: Toot toot! Next stop...Midgar Midgar. Any passengers getting off on Midgar should please ring. You know, Midgar's supposed to be sparkly 'n' springy 'n' sleeky. Oh yeah. Someday, I'm goin' there.
Dialogue: Toot toot! Next stop...Midgar Midgar. Any passengers getting off on Midgar should please ring. You know, Midgar's supposed to be sparkly 'n' springy 'n' sleeky. Oh yeah. Someday, I'm goin' there.

Original: TV: And now for the news. Due to a terrorist attack by the group named AVALANCHE, parts of Midgar that were temporarily out of power will be restored momentarily. Following President Shinra's lead, Mayor Domino also spoke out public against AVALANCHE.
Dialogue: And now for the news. Due to a terrorist attack by the group named AVALANCHE, parts of Midgar that were temporarily out of power will be restored momentarily. Following President Shinra's lead, Mayor Domino also spoke out public against AVALANCHE.

Original: TV: Now for the weather. Tomorrow's weather will be overcast and gloomy the entire day. With a slight chance of sprinkles over parts of the city.
Dialogue: Now for the weather. Tomorrow's weather will be overcast and gloomy the entire day. With a slight chance of sprinkles over parts of the city.

Original: NPC: Hmph......! Everything President Shinra says is a lie. But then again, you can't trust that AVALANCHE, or whatever you call them. You can bat it around all you like. But in the end it comes down to wanting to be like those who live up above. So who do you believe in? Oneself! Me! I never lie to myself, that's for sure!
Dialogue: Hmph......! Everything President Shinra says is a lie. But then again, you can't trust that AVALANCHE, or whatever you call them. You can bat it around all you like. But in the end it comes down to wanting to be like those who live up above. So who do you believe in? Oneself! Me! I never lie to myself, that's for sure!

Original: NPC: I only believe what I say. That's because I never lie to myself.
Dialogue: I only believe what I say. That's because I never lie to myself.

Original: NPC: glug...glug... Now...no one... will find it...num... The top one... and the bottom one...
Dialogue: glug...glug... Now...no one... will find it...num... The top one... and the bottom one...

Original: (Upon inspecting the drawers in the house on the second floor if the player did not talk to the boy.)Cloud: ............
Cloud: Empty.......
Dialogue: Empty.......

Original: Cloud: .......? 5 gil.
On-screen: Received "5 gil"!
Dialogue: Received "5 gil"!

Original: NPC: Even with all that commotion, you went on like nothing happened. You must really been through the mill to get that.
Dialogue: Even with all that commotion, you went on like nothing happened. You must really been through the mill to get that.

Original: NPC: Never thought that would come tumbling down. Maybe I better walk around looking up from now on.
Dialogue: Never thought that would come tumbling down. Maybe I better walk around looking up from now on.

Original: NPC: ...sniff...sniff... First there was a rumbling...... ...then cracking... and then ker-blaMM!!... ...I was so scared...sniff...
Dialogue: ...sniff...sniff... First there was a rumbling...... ...then cracking... and then ker-blaMM!!... ...I was so scared...sniff...

Original: Clerk: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here. No matter what.
Dialogue: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here. No matter what.

Original: NPC: Living in a place like this, you could live out several lives, and it still wouldn't be enough! Well, how about some materia? Make some money and then scramble out of here!
Dialogue: Living in a place like this, you could live out several lives, and it still wouldn't be enough! Well, how about some materia? Make some money and then scramble out of here!

Original: Clerk: You never know what's going to happen! It's a crazy world, so you'd better at least have a weapon you can depend on! Am I right or what?
Dialogue: You never know what's going to happen! It's a crazy world, so you'd better at least have a weapon you can depend on! Am I right or what?

Original: NPC: ...sure is loud outside. Wonder what's happening?
Dialogue: ...sure is loud outside. Wonder what's happening?

Original: NPC: The hell's up with that!? I don't care if they're AVALANCHE or Avant-garde or whatever you call them. Anyone who brings the plates down on us is nuts!!
Dialogue: The hell's up with that!? I don't care if they're AVALANCHE or Avant-garde or whatever you call them. Anyone who brings the plates down on us is nuts!!

Original: TV: This just in. An accident today... ...the worst in the history of the metropolis. But thanks to the quick response by those in charge, there were no civilian casualties. The cause of the accident is unclear at this time, however, according to some sources it is believed to have something to do with the terrorist activities of the group, AVALANCHE.
Dialogue: This just in. An accident today... ...the worst in the history of the metropolis. But thanks to the quick response by those in charge, there were no civilian casualties. The cause of the accident is unclear at this time, however, according to some sources it is believed to have something to do with the terrorist activities of the group, AVALANCHE.

Original: TV: Citizens, unite! Come to the light, Mako energy. Power is Truth Shinra is the future. Your real happiness can be found in obeying the company!
Dialogue: Citizens, unite! Come to the light, Mako energy. Power is Truth Shinra is the future. Your real happiness can be found in obeying the company!

Original: TV: What your car is missing is... ...a set of PTZ2000 tires!! That's right PTZ2000, good for your car and they look good too. Shinra, Inc...... Providing piece of mind in your hectic life in everything from can openers to Mako energy.
Dialogue: What your car is missing is... ...a set of PTZ2000 tires!! That's right PTZ2000, good for your car and they look good too. Shinra, Inc...... Providing piece of mind in your hectic life in everything from can openers to Mako energy.

Original: NPC: sniff.........sniff......... ......'n' I hid it......so nuthin' like this...... would ever happen.........sniff......
Dialogue: sniff.........sniff......... ......'n' I hid it......so nuthin' like this...... would ever happen.........sniff......

Original: NPC: He heh! I bought an item with the money I'd been saving up for some time now. My dream is to grow up and become a big time dealer on Wall Market. Since I'm feeling so good today, I'll let you have this!
Dialogue: He heh! I bought an item with the money I'd been saving up for some time now. My dream is to grow up and become a big time dealer on Wall Market. Since I'm feeling so good today, I'll let you have this!

Original: NPC: My dream is to grow up and become a big time dealer on wall market.
Dialogue: My dream is to grow up and become a big time dealer on wall market.

Original: NPC: That's funny...did I drop the key to this gate...somewhere? Was it when I was on that excavation tour?
Dialogue: That's funny...did I drop the key to this gate...somewhere? Was it when I was on that excavation tour?

Original: NPC: Hey! Where's the flower lady?
Dialogue: Hey! Where's the flower lady?

Original: NPC: These folks went wobbling off somewhere... They said something about the 'Reunion starting'... sounded almost like a chant. Wonder what the heck that meant.
Dialogue: These folks went wobbling off somewhere... They said something about the 'Reunion starting'... sounded almost like a chant. Wonder what the heck that meant.

Original: NPC: I'm not going to look up or down! From now on I'm just going to look straight ahead. Maybe not. I'm just flapping my gums. I really wonder how things will turn out.
Dialogue: I'm not going to look up or down! From now on I'm just going to look straight ahead. Maybe not. I'm just flapping my gums. I really wonder how things will turn out.

Original: Clerk: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here. No matter what.
Dialogue: ...stare... ......hmph...we only trade items for gil here. No matter what.

Original: Clerk: And I just got together enough money to get out of this place... Now it doesn't matter where I go! Ho, ho, ho...
Dialogue: And I just got together enough money to get out of this place... Now it doesn't matter where I go! Ho, ho, ho...

Original: Clerk: I don't know crap about crap! But I do know one thing. The one thing that you'll always need is a good strong weapon!
Dialogue: I don't know crap about crap! But I do know one thing. The one thing that you'll always need is a good strong weapon!

Original: NPC: The planet's getting closer. You can hear it rumbling. We don't do something about it and pretty soon it'll be...ker-blam!
Dialogue: The planet's getting closer. You can hear it rumbling. We don't do something about it and pretty soon it'll be...ker-blam!

Original: NPC: SOLDIER? What about them!? Damn! If they were really from SOLDIER, they would be doing something about all this!!
Dialogue: SOLDIER? What about them!? Damn! If they were really from SOLDIER, they would be doing something about all this!!

Original: NPC: The trick to bein' a real man, is not to fart around, but to let everyone know where you stand, right off!
Dialogue: The trick to bein' a real man, is not to fart around, but to let everyone know where you stand, right off!

Original: NPC: Hey, you two. Why don't you get some rest? We have a beautiful room, how 'bout it?
Dialogue: Hey, you two. Why don't you get some rest? We have a beautiful room, how 'bout it?

Original: NPC: Hey, ya'll. Please stay here!
Dialogue: Hey, ya'll. Please stay here!

Original: NPC: Don't push! Hooligan!
Dialogue: Don't push! Hooligan!

Original: NPC: Please keep out of kitchen!
Dialogue: Please keep out of kitchen!

Original: On-screen: ......Beeeeeep...... blipppp......
Dialogue: ......Beeeeeep...... blipppp......

Original: Cloud: Whoa!
Dialogue: Whoa!

Original: Cloud: ...Broken.
Dialogue: ...Broken.

Original: NPC 1: All right...1, 2, 3. Squats are all in the rhythm.
Dialogue: All right...1, 2, 3. Squats are all in the rhythm.

Original: NPC 2: I'm doing my best, bro'!
Dialogue: I'm doing my best, bro'!

Original: NPC 1: How's... this!?
Dialogue: How's... this!?

Original: NPC: Yes? If you want to order, do it at the counter.
Dialogue: Yes? If you want to order, do it at the counter.

Original: NPC: Aren't cats great? This one's a little big, huh?
Dialogue: Aren't cats great? This one's a little big, huh?

Original: NPC: Oh... what should I do... Should I just buy it......?
Dialogue: Oh... what should I do... Should I just buy it......?

Original: NPC: Please come in. Here's a free 'Pharmacy Coupon' if you enter now.
Dialogue: Please come in. Here's a free 'Pharmacy Coupon' if you enter now.

Original: NPC: Please, stop by.
Dialogue: Please, stop by.

Original: NPC: I just can't make up my mind... Mmm. Huh? About what? Hmmm, don't make me say it... It's the shop down on the right.
Dialogue: I just can't make up my mind... Mmm. Huh? About what? Hmmm, don't make me say it... It's the shop down on the right.

Original: NPC: Hey boy! You shore got a good lookin' heifer there! Take her to the Don's place, and you'll make a mint.
Dialogue: Hey boy! You shore got a good lookin' heifer there! Take her to the Don's place, and you'll make a mint.

Original: NPC: It's a little early to start eating. Come back in a bit.
Dialogue: It's a little early to start eating. Come back in a bit.

Original: NPC: Join the club. Try it with us.
Dialogue: Join the club. Try it with us.

Original: NPC: You want somethin'? I don't wanna hear any complaints 'bout how things look.
Dialogue: You want somethin'? I don't wanna hear any complaints 'bout how things look.

Original: Clerk: Welcome. Please take your time.
Dialogue: Welcome. Please take your time.

Original: NPC: ...We're closed now.
Dialogue: ...We're closed now.

Original: Owner: Whew, times are bad.
Dialogue: Whew, times are bad.

Original: NPC: Oh dear. I've gained weight again.
Dialogue: Oh dear. I've gained weight again.

Original: Johnny: Man... Should I go......or not? ...I get so mental at times like this. I'm hopeless!!
Dialogue: Man... Should I go......or not? ...I get so mental at times like this. I'm hopeless!!

Original: Johnny: Hey!! Aren't you...? What!! You mean you're...too?
Dialogue: Hey!! Aren't you...? What!! You mean you're...too?

Original: Johnny: You're Tifa's childhood friend, and you brought a new girlfriend to a place like this!? What kind of guy are you!!
Dialogue: You're Tifa's childhood friend, and you brought a new girlfriend to a place like this!? What kind of guy are you!!

Original: Johnny: What...Me too. I decided this after a lot of deep thought. My last memories of Midgar...you know. But... That guy over there kinda scares me.
Dialogue: What...Me too. I decided this after a lot of deep thought. My last memories of Midgar...you know. But... That guy over there kinda scares me.

Original: NPC: What the hell!! You *%^&!! This ain't no #$*&^% show!! I'm busy right now!! I'm feelin' like there's gonna be a fight!!
Dialogue: What the hell!! You *%^&!! This ain't no #$*&^% show!! I'm busy right now!! I'm feelin' like there's gonna be a fight!!

Original: NPC: Urrrrgh...no way...... I can't go on. Things aren't working out. Between our differences and my pay, it just isn't cutting it.
Dialogue: Urrrrgh...no way...... I can't go on. Things aren't working out. Between our differences and my pay, it just isn't cutting it.

Original: Johnny: Aeris...... Thanks for the flower and 1 gil. I'll treasure this! I'm going to dry it and keep it for good luck.
Dialogue: Aeris...... Thanks for the flower and 1 gil. I'll treasure this! I'm going to dry it and keep it for good luck.

Original: NPC: I asked Aeris for a date... And she said not even if I paid her 1,000,000 gil. Her flowers cost 300 gil, too... She's a good business woman.
Dialogue: I asked Aeris for a date... And she said not even if I paid her 1,000,000 gil. Her flowers cost 300 gil, too... She's a good business woman.

Original: NPC: Uurrgh! So, this is it for today, huh?
Dialogue: Uurrgh! So, this is it for today, huh?

Original: NPC: It's closing time. yawn......I'm so sleepy......
Dialogue: It's closing time. yawn......I'm so sleepy......

Original: Bouncer: Sir, is everything all right? Look, Aeris looks so lonely.
Dialogue: Sir, is everything all right? Look, Aeris looks so lonely.

Original: NPC: What? Are you ladies going to eat too?
Dialogue: What? Are you ladies going to eat too?

Original: NPC: Hey! Pretty lady. Let me tell you about a good job! Go to the Don's place. You'll make a small fortune!
Dialogue: Hey! Pretty lady. Let me tell you about a good job! Go to the Don's place. You'll make a small fortune!

Original: NPC: You're... Weird.
Dialogue: You're... Weird.

Original: NPC: Sorry! But we're completely full! Please come again!
Dialogue: Sorry! But we're completely full! Please come again!

Original: Johnny: Uh...ummm I, I...... Uh...ummm... I'm...Jo......Johnny... Nice to meet you.
Dialogue: Uh...ummm I, I...... Uh...ummm... I'm...Jo......Johnny... Nice to meet you.

Original: NPC: That's funny. A hard, spiky hairstyle! Looks kinda familiar...
Dialogue: That's funny. A hard, spiky hairstyle! Looks kinda familiar...

Original: NPC: Ummm, young girls...soft skin. Ummm, OK, I'm refreshed now! ...Mmmm? Pretty hard. You work out?
Dialogue: Ummm, young girls...soft skin. Ummm, OK, I'm refreshed now! ...Mmmm? Pretty hard. You work out?

Original: Bouncer: Yeah, I only talk to the pretty ones. Mmmm, you're the one. You're just great.
Dialogue: Yeah, I only talk to the pretty ones. Mmmm, you're the one. You're just great.

Original: NPC: It came down from the sky. But the old guy who likes tanks took all of it away. I wanted some too.
Dialogue: It came down from the sky. But the old guy who likes tanks took all of it away. I wanted some too.

Original: NPC: According to that guy with the tank, if you're strong enough, anyone can make it to the top plate. So, build your strength by having a plate of our food.
Dialogue: According to that guy with the tank, if you're strong enough, anyone can make it to the top plate. So, build your strength by having a plate of our food.

Original: NPC: I never believed that Sector 7 would ever come down.
Dialogue: I never believed that Sector 7 would ever come down.

Original: NPC: Phew, it's all dusty ever since the sky came down. I'll have to start over.
Dialogue: Phew, it's all dusty ever since the sky came down. I'll have to start over.

Original: NPC: That was scary...
Dialogue: That was scary...

Original: Clerk: You're dressed normal today. If something else interesting comes up, let me in on it.
Dialogue: You're dressed normal today. If something else interesting comes up, let me in on it.

Original: NPC: More strength. I bet you could climb all the way up to the upper plate if you used that pipe. Don't you know? The old man at the Weapon shop can tell you more about it.
Dialogue: More strength. I bet you could climb all the way up to the upper plate if you used that pipe. Don't you know? The old man at the Weapon shop can tell you more about it.

Original: NPC: So? How's it?
Dialogue: So? How's it?

Original: NPC: Hey!! It's you!! Sorry, but I already heard about you. In addition to dressing like a woman, it seems you like to smash and grind things. We only let cultured customers in! Got it? Then you'd better leave!
Dialogue: Hey!! It's you!! Sorry, but I already heard about you. In addition to dressing like a woman, it seems you like to smash and grind things. We only let cultured customers in! Got it? Then you'd better leave!

Original: Kotch: Hey! You're...not them... you're... Please, help me!
Dialogue: Hey! You're...not them... you're... Please, help me!

Original: Kotch: Thanks! You know what? After you left, some Shinra guys forced themselves in here saying things like 'information leaked' and 'good for nothing'. They took Don somewhere and that's it...... I'm still here.
Dialogue: Thanks! You know what? After you left, some Shinra guys forced themselves in here saying things like 'information leaked' and 'good for nothing'. They took Don somewhere and that's it...... I'm still here.

Original: Kotch: Oops! They're here again... I'm outta here! SEE ya
Dialogue: Oops! They're here again... I'm outta here! SEE ya

Original: Kotch: I...I was just following the Don's orders! Help me!
Dialogue: I...I was just following the Don's orders! Help me!

Original: NPC: I wish I could live with a real cat.
Dialogue: I wish I could live with a real cat.

Original: NPC: It's a weird world we live in, so eat up and work hard.
Dialogue: It's a weird world we live in, so eat up and work hard.

Original: NPC: We're not leavin' this city no matter what happens.
Dialogue: We're not leavin' this city no matter what happens.

Original: NPC: I don't know what's gonna happen next, But first, you gotta fill your stomach.
Dialogue: I don't know what's gonna happen next, But first, you gotta fill your stomach.

Original: NPC: Seems like everything has frills on it.
Dialogue: Seems like everything has frills on it.

Original: Cid: Hmm? Let me see that.
Dialogue: Hmm? Let me see that.

Original: Cid: It should work now. Go on, try and use it now.
Dialogue: It should work now. Go on, try and use it now.

Original: Tifa: Cid! What did you do!?
Dialogue: Cid! What did you do!?

Original: Cid: Don't get mad, you'll just get more wrinkles. Hey, something's comin' out.
Dialogue: Don't get mad, you'll just get more wrinkles. Hey, something's comin' out.

Original: NPC: These days, you've got to have strength. Come on, you should work out.
Dialogue: These days, you've got to have strength. Come on, you should work out.

Original: NPC: Oh, so you're back? I got something good for you. Why don't you buy it?
Dialogue: Oh, so you're back? I got something good for you. Why don't you buy it?

Original: Cloud: You probably just found it lying around somewhere, right?
Dialogue: You probably just found it lying around somewhere, right?

Original: NPC: I'll admit that I found it, but you may never be able to get another one like it again. How 'bout 129,000 Gil for it?
Dialogue: I'll admit that I found it, but you may never be able to get another one like it again. How 'bout 129,000 Gil for it?

Original: Cloud: ...What kind of price is that?
Dialogue: ...What kind of price is that?

Original: NPC: Hey, much obliged. You'll never regret it!
Dialogue: Hey, much obliged. You'll never regret it!

Original: On-screen: Received "Sneak Glove"!
Dialogue: Received "Sneak Glove"!

Original: NPC: Hmm, looks like you're a little short, son. Come back again.
Dialogue: Hmm, looks like you're a little short, son. Come back again.

Original: NPC: Hmm, that's too bad. This's really something.
Dialogue: Hmm, that's too bad. This's really something.

Original: NPC: Come again.
Dialogue: Come again.

Original: NPC: Heee,...... The Shinra have occupied this shop!
Dialogue: Heee,...... The Shinra have occupied this shop!

Original: On-screen: Shinra, Inc. This week's phrase
Dialogue: Shinra, Inc. This week's phrase

Original: On-screen: Turtle's Paradise Newsletter No. 2
Dialogue: Turtle's Paradise Newsletter No. 2

Original: NPC 1: Honey...... Buy me that car!
Dialogue: Honey...... Buy me that car!

Original: NPC 2: But baby, that's way too expensive.
Dialogue: But baby, that's way too expensive.

Original: NPC 1: What did you say?
Dialogue: What did you say?

Original: NPC 1: Hh, hey!
Dialogue: Hh, hey!

Original: NPC 2: Ww, wait for meeeeeee.........!
Dialogue: Ww, wait for meeeeeee.........!

Original: Cashier: Welcome. Today we have on special... Eagghhh!! Here, t, take the money...
Dialogue: Welcome. Today we have on special... Eagghhh!! Here, t, take the money...

Original: Barret: Don't want no money. AVALANCHE ain't no packa criminals. We jes want back what your boss stole from us.I mean, "who" he stole from us.
Dialogue: Don't want no money. AVALANCHE ain't no packa criminals. We jes want back what your boss stole from us. I mean, "who" he stole from us.

Original: Cashier: A, AVALANCHE?
Dialogue: A, AVALANCHE?

Original: Barret: Now we ain't gonna hurt you. Might even pay ya, if ya help us.
Dialogue: Now we ain't gonna hurt you. Might even pay ya, if ya help us.

Original: Cashier: Ok...ok...well...
Dialogue: Ok...ok...well...

Original: Cashier: What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Cashier: Thank you and come again... Forget I said that...
Dialogue: Thank you and come again... Forget I said that...

Original: Cashier: Please take all purchases to the register
Dialogue: Please take all purchases to the register

Original: Cashier: You opened up all those things without asking and, hey wait!
Dialogue: You opened up all those things without asking and, hey wait!

Original: NPC 1: I thought I heard a ruckus downstairs a minute ago. Do you know what that was all about?
Dialogue: I thought I heard a ruckus downstairs a minute ago. Do you know what that was all about?

Original: NPC 2: No idea. But no need to worry because everything above the 60th floor is safe.
Dialogue: No idea. But no need to worry because everything above the 60th floor is safe.

Original: NPC: This is the lounge floor. Above us are the special floors for the big wigs in the company. It's tough working under someone. Tires you out.
Dialogue: This is the lounge floor. Above us are the special floors for the big wigs in the company. It's tough working under someone. Tires you out.

Original: NPC: What's keeping her? Did she forget her keycard? Even employees can't walk around above the 60th floor without a keycard.
Dialogue: What's keeping her? Did she forget her keycard? Even employees can't walk around above the 60th floor without a keycard.

Original: NPC: I don't remember seeing your face before... You new here? Say, you're cute. Let me teach you some...things.
Dialogue: I don't remember seeing your face before... You new here? Say, you're cute. Let me teach you some...things.

Original: NPC: Wipe that stupid look off your face. I was only going to teach you how to get to the next floor. The higher ups in the company use the floors above the 60th floor. But you can't get there without a keycard. Get a keycard and you can use the elevators freely. ...voila! You hear that sound and the door opens. Just remember there are different types of cards. One keycard alone won't let you go everywhere. For example, 'Keycard 60' only takes you to the 60th floor. 'Keycard 65' only takes you to the 65th floor. It's a security system worthy of Shinra. After all, all the power in Midgar and the world, for that matter, is controlled by them. Oh, I have to go. Gotta get back to work!
Dialogue: Wipe that stupid look off your face. I was only going to teach you how to get to the next floor. The higher ups in the company use the floors above the 60th floor. But you can't get there without a keycard. Get a keycard and you can use the elevators freely. ...voila! You hear that sound and the door opens. Just remember there are different types of cards. One keycard alone won't let you go everywhere. For example, 'Keycard 60' only takes you to the 60th floor. 'Keycard 65' only takes you to the 65th floor. It's a security system worthy of Shinra. After all, all the power in Midgar and the world, for that matter, is controlled by them. Oh, I have to go. Gotta get back to work!

Original: NPC: Oh? That's too bad...
Dialogue: Oh? That's too bad...

Original: Computer: ...beep...beep... ......verifying key card...... ........................... Level B employee: verified. You are permitted to open doors on this floor up to three times. blip...... If you receive an item coupon, remember to exchange it for an item. ...warning...refrain from entering the air conditioning ducts recklessly - they are very dangerous...
Dialogue: ...beep...beep... ......verifying key card...... ........................... Level B employee verified. You are permitted to open doors on this floor up to three times. blip...... If you receive an item coupon, remember to exchange it for an item. ...warning...refrain from entering the air conditioning ducts recklessly - they are very dangerous...

Original: Comouter: ...bing...bing... Enter command
Dialogue: ...bing...bing... Enter command

Original: Computer: ......bing...bing... Start again from the beginning? The information and materials you received on this floor will all be cleared. Clear them?
Dialogue: ......bing...bing... Start again from the beginning? The information and materials you received on this floor will all be cleared. Clear them?

Original: Computer: ...... ......... ......... Cleared. You are permitted to open any door on this floor up to three times.
Dialogue: ...... ......... ......... Cleared. You are permitted to open any door on this floor up to three times.

Original: Computer: ...beep...beep...... After you have exchanged coupons you may no longer use 'all-clear'.
Dialogue: ...beep...beep...... After you have exchanged coupons you may no longer use 'all-clear'.

Original: Computer: You can exchange your coupons for items. Here are the items you can have... A coupon.........'Star Pendant' B coupon.........'Four Slots' C coupon.........'All' Materia Please use caution...once you have exchanged coupons for items you may not use 'All Clear' function. Exchange coupon?
Dialogue: You can exchange your coupons for items. Here are the items you can have... A coupon.........'Star Pendant' B coupon.........'Four Slots' C coupon.........'All' Materia Please use caution...once you have exchanged coupons for items you may not use 'All Clear' function. Exchange coupon?

Original: Computer: ....... ......... ....... Coupon exchange complete.
Dialogue: ....... ......... ....... Coupon exchange complete.

Original: Computer: You cannot take on more materia. Please discard some materia. Your 'All' materia was returned for a C Coupon.
Dialogue: You cannot take on more materia. Please discard some materia. Your 'All' materia was returned for a C Coupon.

Original: Computer: ...beep......beep...... You do not have any coupons.
Dialogue: ...beep......beep...... You do not have any coupons.

Original: Cloud: An air-duct... It doesn't look like I'll be able to climb in here.
Dialogue: An air-duct... It doesn't look like I'll be able to climb in here.

Original: Cloud: An air-duct......
Dialogue: An air-duct......

Original: Computer: ...beep...beep...... Open the door?
Dialogue: ...beep...beep...... Open the door?

Original: Computer: Bi, bing...... You have opened three doors. If you access the computer, You can begin this process one more time.
Dialogue: Bi, bing...... You have opened three doors. If you access the computer, You can begin this process one more time.

Original: Cloud: Whew...
Dialogue: Whew...

Original: Cloud: Feels like I got a little lighter...... At least I think so...
Dialogue: Feels like I got a little lighter...... At least I think so...

Original: NPC: ...huff...puff... If you're tired, you should get some rest in the next room.
Dialogue: ...huff...puff... If you're tired, you should get some rest in the next room.

Original: NPC: ...huff...wheeze... I'm starting to worry about my belly......
Dialogue: ...huff...wheeze... I'm starting to worry about my belly......

Original: On-screen: Take one to restore your energy!! 'Shinra Gym Special Drink' Only 250 gil!!
Dialogue: Take one to restore your energy!! 'Shinra Gym Special Drink' Only 250 gil!!

Original: Cloud: ...Nothing...
Dialogue: ...Nothing...

Original: Cloud: ...... ...Is it broken?'
Dialogue: ...... ...Is it broken?'

Original: NPC: Sir, what are you doing!? No violence here, please!
Dialogue: Sir, what are you doing!? No violence here, please!

Original: NPC: Hmph, hmph... Since I'm head of security for this building, stamina's very important to me.
Dialogue: Hmph, hmph... Since I'm head of security for this building, stamina's very important to me.

Original: NPC: You must be a visitor. Please feel free to use any unused machines.
Dialogue: You must be a visitor. Please feel free to use any unused machines.

Original: Cloud: A nap room...
Dialogue: A nap room...

Original: NPC: ...zzz... Please......let me...... get some...rest......
Dialogue: ...zzz... Please......let me...... get some...rest......

Original: On-screen: Out of Order
Dialogue: Out of Order

Original: Cloud: There's nothing inside...
Dialogue: There's nothing inside...

Original: Cloud: What is this......a Megaphone? Hanging on to this won't do any good...
Dialogue: What is this......a Megaphone? Hanging on to this won't do any good...

Original: NPC: Whew, I'm so sick of carrying all these files... But I get to meet lots of guys. I guess that's the benefit of being a secretary!
Dialogue: Whew, I'm so sick of carrying all these files... But I get to meet lots of guys. I guess that's the benefit of being a secretary!

Original: NPC: It gives me the feeling that I AM alive. The feeling of moving this world, just with my hands.
Dialogue: It gives me the feeling that I AM alive. The feeling of moving this world, just with my hands.

Original: NPC: Is it just me or does the Conference Room smell? There's some sort of stench coming from somewhere...
Dialogue: Is it just me or does the Conference Room smell? There's some sort of stench coming from somewhere...

Original: NPC: Hey, when you're in the bathroom, do you ever hear whispers coming from somewhere?
Dialogue: Hey, when you're in the bathroom, do you ever hear whispers coming from somewhere?

Original: NPC: They're having another executive meeting. I wonder if it's about that Plate incident.
Dialogue: They're having another executive meeting. I wonder if it's about that Plate incident.

Original: NPC: Sittin' here facing the monitor...day in, day out... I kinda feel......forced...into doing it. And I just don't have any motivation.
Dialogue: Sittin' here facing the monitor...day in, day out... I kinda feel......forced...into doing it. And I just don't have any motivation.

Original: NPC: Come on, we're building the future of Mako!
Dialogue: Come on, we're building the future of Mako!

Original: NPC: It gives me the feeling that I AM alive. The feeling of moving this world, just with my hands.
Dialogue: It gives me the feeling that I AM alive. The feeling of moving this world, just with my hands.

Original: NPC: Welcome... to the fully automated store. Place your order...now.
Dialogue: Welcome... to the fully automated store. Place your order...now.

Original: Cloud: ...... ...Is it broken?'
Dialogue: ...... ...Is it broken?'

Original: On-screen: Received "Mind Source"! Received "Speed Source"!
Dialogue: Received "Mind Source"! Received "Speed Source"!

Original: NPC: Aw, c'mon! Listen to me! Got anything interesting to say?......
Dialogue: Aw, c'mon! Listen to me! Got anything interesting to say?......

Original: NPC: Listen to me! Just now, some guy in a black cloak goes walked east towards that grassy field. And he's got this killer sword, and is looking REAL scary......
Dialogue: Listen to me! Just now, some guy in a black cloak goes walked east towards that grassy field. And he's got this killer sword, and is looking REAL scary......

Original: NPC: Tourists, huh? There are some things you should know that'll come in handy when you travel around the world...... Want me to tell you what they are?
Dialogue: Tourists, huh? There are some things you should know that'll come in handy when you travel around the world...... Want me to tell you what they are?

Original: NPC: Then let me explain how to use the world map. Well then, what do you want to know?
Dialogue: Then let me explain how to use the world map. Well then, what do you want to know?

Original: NPC: Well then, bon voyage!
Dialogue: Well then, bon voyage!

Original: NPC: Is that so? Well, that's that. Have a nice trip.
Dialogue: Is that so? Well, that's that. Have a nice trip.

Original: NPC: I hear that the natural resources near the reactors are being sucked dry. We're better off with them bringing in the Mako energy.
Dialogue: I hear that the natural resources near the reactors are being sucked dry. We're better off with them bringing in the Mako energy.

Original: NPC: I heard President Shinra was killed. And his son Rufus, the new president, was badly hurt. Hey, I bet that's news to you?
Dialogue: I heard President Shinra was killed. And his son Rufus, the new president, was badly hurt. Hey, I bet that's news to you?

Original: NPC: Heh, heh, heh...... This is just between us. I heard it was that there Ava-whaddya call-ums that attacked the President Shinra and his son.
Dialogue: Heh, heh, heh...... This is just between us. I heard it was that there Ava-whaddya call-ums that attacked the President Shinra and his son.

Original: NPC: Don't care? If you're going to travel, you'd best keep an eye on what Shinra's doing.
Dialogue: Don't care? If you're going to travel, you'd best keep an eye on what Shinra's doing.

Original: NPC: Shinra is leading the world around by the nose, and you guys are just gonna sit back and take it?
Dialogue: Shinra is leading the world around by the nose, and you guys are just gonna sit back and take it?

Original: NPC: My old man was a miner, but he couldn't go to work after monsters started appearing in the Mythril Mine. Now all he does is sit around getting drunk in the bar...
Dialogue: My old man was a miner, but he couldn't go to work after monsters started appearing in the Mythril Mine. Now all he does is sit around getting drunk in the bar...

Original: NPC: Mr......Cloud? Your party is waiting for you on the 2nd floor.
Dialogue: Mr......Cloud? Your party is waiting for you on the 2nd floor.

Original: NPC: 20 gil a night. What's it gonna be?
Dialogue: 20 gil a night. What's it gonna be?

Original: NPC: Seems like you're a little short. Why don't you drop by again... when you have money.
Dialogue: Seems like you're a little short. Why don't you drop by again... when you have money.

Original: NPC: Thanks to Mako energy, life's pretty darn convenient. Thanks to Shinra. Don't you think?
Dialogue: Thanks to Mako energy, life's pretty darn convenient. Thanks to Shinra. Don't you think?

Original: NPC: See!? How would we get by without Mako energy?
Dialogue: See!? How would we get by without Mako energy?

Original: NPC: Hmmn. But I'd hate to think of what life'd be like without Mako energy.
Dialogue: Hmmn. But I'd hate to think of what life'd be like without Mako energy.

Original: NPC: Yeah, Mako energy's made our lives much easier. And it's all thanks to Shinra, Inc.
Dialogue: Yeah, Mako energy's made our lives much easier. And it's all thanks to Shinra, Inc.

Original: NPC: Mako energy's made things a lot more convenient...... But seems like a lot of plants and animals have been disappearing at a rapid pace.
Dialogue: Mako energy's made things a lot more convenient...... But seems like a lot of plants and animals have been disappearing at a rapid pace.

Original: NPC: I think the old life was better. Don't you think so?
Dialogue: I think the old life was better. Don't you think so?

Original: NPC: Yeah, sure I'm right! You think so, don't you?
Dialogue: Yeah, sure I'm right! You think so, don't you?

Original: NPC: I thought things were better when I was able to play with animals......
Dialogue: I thought things were better when I was able to play with animals......

Original: NPC: Did you say you came from Midgar? I used to live there, too. But I hear they got lots of troubles lately.
Dialogue: Did you say you came from Midgar? I used to live there, too. But I hear they got lots of troubles lately.

Original: NPC: There was a suspicious-looking man in a black cloak! He was carrying a wicked-looking sword. Why doesn't anyone believe me? I'm all alone...
Dialogue: There was a suspicious-looking man in a black cloak! He was carrying a wicked-looking sword. Why doesn't anyone believe me? I'm all alone...

Original: NPC: Why doesn't anyone believe me? I'm all alone...
Dialogue: Why doesn't anyone believe me? I'm all alone...

Original: NPC: ......My older brother's so stupid. He's so embarrassing I could just puke!
Dialogue: ......My older brother's so stupid. He's so embarrassing I could just puke!

Original: NPC: When I grow up I'm gonna be in SOLDIER. That's why I'm training hard now!! Hyah, hayah, eagghh!
Dialogue: When I grow up I'm gonna be in SOLDIER. That's why I'm training hard now!! Hyah, hayah, eagghh!

Original: NPC: Is it true that Shinra made a Monster?
Dialogue: Is it true that Shinra made a Monster?

Original: NPC: Yeah, well either way, as long as we're using the reactor, we can't stand up to Shinra.
Dialogue: Yeah, well either way, as long as we're using the reactor, we can't stand up to Shinra.

Original: NPC: I heard terrorists bombed a Midgar reactor... There sure have been a lot of dangerous accidents recently. I hate it, just hate it.
Dialogue: I heard terrorists bombed a Midgar reactor... There sure have been a lot of dangerous accidents recently. I hate it, just hate it.

Original: NPC: Me? I used to work in a coal mine down south called Mythril Mine. But, right around then, monsters started appearing. After that, business went to pot and now I spend the days here drinking.
Dialogue: Me? I used to work in a coal mine down south called Mythril Mine. But, right around then, monsters started appearing. After that, business went to pot and now I spend the days here drinking.

Original: NPC: Urrrp! ...hic... I'm stinking drunk!!
Dialogue: Urrrp! ...hic... I'm stinking drunk!!

Original: NPC: It seems there was this group called AVALANCHE runnin' around, but I guess they finally got wiped out by SOLDIER. Shinra is trying to eliminate anyone, who stands up to them. It don't matter if we like it or not. Shinra's taken over, and we gotta live with it!
Dialogue: It seems there was this group called AVALANCHE runnin' around, but I guess they finally got wiped out by SOLDIER. Shinra is trying to eliminate anyone, who stands up to them. It don't matter if we like it or not. Shinra's taken over, and we gotta live with it!

Original: NPC: Stay out of the kitchen.
Dialogue: Stay out of the kitchen.

Original: NPC: Huh? You're looking for your friend? You want to know where the Lifestream is? Let's see, I can't help you with your friend, but I've heard about the Lifestream. When I traveled to the southern islands, a doctor was very kind to me. I seem to recall him telling me something about the Lifestream......
Dialogue: Huh? You're looking for your friend? You want to know where the Lifestream is? Let's see, I can't help you with your friend, but I've heard about the Lifestream. When I traveled to the southern islands, a doctor was very kind to me. I seem to recall him telling me something about the Lifestream......

Original: NPC: Hey, listen to me! The Shinra troops are on the move. The TV news said Rufus came up with 2 plans. One, is to launch a rocket into space containing Huge Materia...... Is Huge Materia really that destructive?
Dialogue: Hey, listen to me! The Shinra troops are on the move. The TV news said Rufus came up with 2 plans. One, is to launch a rocket into space containing Huge Materia...... Is Huge Materia really that destructive?

Original: NPC: Listen to me! Something really big's happening in Midgar. They were just saying on TV it was Rufus second strategy and... That big cannon's pointed due north...... You think the target's......Sephiroth?
Dialogue: Listen to me! Something really big's happening in Midgar. They were just saying on TV it was Rufus second strategy and... That big cannon's pointed due north...... You think the target's......Sephiroth?

Original: NPC: Hey, listen to me! I heard the barrier protecting Sephiroth is gone! But with Rufus dead, the Shinra troops don't know what to do Heidegger and Scarlet don't have what it takes to lead the troops...... I really thought something was finally going to get done, but everything's the same... not a damn thing's changed!
Dialogue: Hey, listen to me! I heard the barrier protecting Sephiroth is gone! But with Rufus dead, the Shinra troops don't know what to do Heidegger and Scarlet don't have what it takes to lead the troops...... I really thought something was finally going to get done, but everything's the same... not a damn thing's changed!

Original: NPC: Ah, youth... You really believe that big meteor filling up the sky's going to fall here?
Dialogue: Ah, youth... You really believe that big meteor filling up the sky's going to fall here?

Original: NPC: If that's the case then all we can do is put our hope in Shinra, Inc.
Dialogue: If that's the case then all we can do is put our hope in Shinra, Inc.

Original: NPC: If Shinra, Inc was our last hope, and they've been beaten by terrorists...... Are we all going to die?
Dialogue: If Shinra, Inc was our last hope, and they've been beaten by terrorists...... Are we all going to die?

Original: NPC: I want you to stop that talk about a Meteor falling on us!
Dialogue: I want you to stop that talk about a Meteor falling on us!

Original: NPC: Sephiroth put up a huge barrier around the North Crater. Rufus wants to use a mammoth cannon to smash the barrier. He plans to have Shinra troops rush in and attack Sephiroth after the barrier falls.
Dialogue: Sephiroth put up a huge barrier around the North Crater. Rufus wants to use a mammoth cannon to smash the barrier. He plans to have Shinra troops rush in and attack Sephiroth after the barrier falls.

Original: NPC: The North Crater barrier's been demolished? So now's the time to defeat Sephiroth.
Dialogue: The North Crater barrier's been demolished? So now's the time to defeat Sephiroth.

Original: NPC: Even if Meteor falls, If you're in Midgar, you ought to be safe. They say it's a "Mako Metropolis" so they should survive somehow......
Dialogue: Even if Meteor falls, If you're in Midgar, you ought to be safe. They say it's a "Mako Metropolis" so they should survive somehow......

Original: NPC: My dad still just sits at the bar drinking, even though he knows that Meteor's coming! It's sad. Even though he's an adult, he just doesn't want to see the world as it really is. I dunno what to do.
Dialogue: My dad still just sits at the bar drinking, even though he knows that Meteor's coming! It's sad. Even though he's an adult, he just doesn't want to see the world as it really is. I dunno what to do.

Original: NPC: One night, 300 gil. Wanna check in?
Dialogue: One night, 300 gil. Wanna check in?

Original: NPC: Seems like you're a little short. Why don't you drop by again... when you have money.
Dialogue: Seems like you're a little short. Why don't you drop by again... when you have money.

Original: On-screen: Can't reach it......
Dialogue: Can't reach it......

Original: Cloud: ......Damn it!!
Dialogue: ......Damn it!!

Original: Tifa: Oh! You!!
Dialogue: Oh! You!!

Original: Cid: ......don't mess with me!!
Dialogue: ......don't mess with me!!

Original: On-screen: ...... Dropped "Megalixir"!
Dialogue: ...... Dropped "Megalixir"!

Original: NPC: They say the meteor is going to fall, but it's okay! I'm sure Shinra will come through for us in the end and do something!
Dialogue: They say the meteor is going to fall, but it's okay! I'm sure Shinra will come through for us in the end and do something!

Original: NPC: Dear, can you believe it!? They say that Shinra's gone under!! This world is coming to an end all because those terrorists called AVALANCHE stuck their noses in the wrong place!
Dialogue: Dear, can you believe it!? They say that Shinra's gone under!! This world is coming to an end all because those terrorists called AVALANCHE stuck their noses in the wrong place!

Original: NPC: I can't believe Meteor's really falling this way...... What's going to happen to us?
Dialogue: I can't believe Meteor's really falling this way...... What's going to happen to us?

Original: NPC: Everyone at Shinra's in an uproar because they heard Weapon's coming. I heard a big hydroplane carrying secret weapons, got attacked by Weapon and was sunk at sea......
Dialogue: Everyone at Shinra's in an uproar because they heard Weapon's coming. I heard a big hydroplane carrying secret weapons, got attacked by Weapon and was sunk at sea......

Original: NPC: If something ever happened to President Rufus, That'd be the end of Shinra, Inc...... and the rest of the world, too.
Dialogue: If something ever happened to President Rufus, That'd be the end of Shinra, Inc...... and the rest of the world, too.

Original: NPC: Oh man, oh man! A meteor's gonna fall on us, and now there's some big huge monster the likes of which I've never seen just wandering around out there!
Dialogue: Oh man, oh man! A meteor's gonna fall on us, and now there's some big huge monster the likes of which I've never seen just wandering around out there!

Original: NPC: What's going to happen to all of us!!?
Dialogue: What's going to happen to all of us!!?

Original: NPC: I'm gonna hurry up and get strong so I can crush the meteor to bits! But I gotta train real hard to do it.
Dialogue: I'm gonna hurry up and get strong so I can crush the meteor to bits! But I gotta train real hard to do it.

Original: NPC: The world's changed a lot in the past few days...... That huge monster Meteor was covering up the sky and acting like he owned it or something... A lot of my friends have died...... I'm goin' on a journey to pray for their souls.
Dialogue: The world's changed a lot in the past few days...... That huge monster Meteor was covering up the sky and acting like he owned it or something... A lot of my friends have died...... I'm goin' on a journey to pray for their souls.

Original: NPC: A map that was sunk along with the ship. ........."Guidebook"
Dialogue: A map that was sunk along with the ship. ........."Guidebook"

Original: NPC: A rose that blooms once every 1000 years in the desert. ........."Desert Rose"
Dialogue: A rose that blooms once every 1000 years in the desert. ........."Desert Rose"

Original: NPC: A harp that soothes those who hear it. ........."Earth Harp"
Dialogue: A harp that soothes those who hear it. ........."Earth Harp"

Original: NPC: I wonder if there's anyone who'll bring it to me?
Dialogue: I wonder if there's anyone who'll bring it to me?

Dialogue: "XXXX" and "XXXX"... Will you guys look for them for me?

Original: NPC: Now if I can just get "XXXX", I can start my journey...
Dialogue: Now if I can just get "XXXX", I can start my journey...

Dialogue: OH! It's "Guidebook"! Wanna trade it for this Underwater Materia? How about it?

Dialogue: Ok then, it's a done deal!

Original: Kalm Traveler: I dunno......

Dialogue: OH! It's "Desert Rose"! Wanna trade it for that Chocobo over there? How about it?

Original: Kalm Traveler: Ok then, it's a done deal!
Dialogue: Ok then, it's a done deal!

Original: Kalm Traveler: It's a Chocobo. Take it, it's yours!
Dialogue: It's a Chocobo. Take it, it's yours!

Original: Cloud: Looks like my Stable's full. I'll come back when I have room.
Dialogue: Looks like my Stable's full. I'll come back when I have room.

Original: Kalm Traveler: I dunno......
Dialogue: I dunno......

Original: Kalm Traveler: OH! It's the Earth Harp! Wanna trade it for some Master Materia? I'm not bein' stingy either! I'll give you all three of 'em! How about it?
Dialogue: OH! It's the Earth Harp! Wanna trade it for some Master Materia? I'm not bein' stingy either! I'll give you all three of 'em! How about it?

Original: Kalm Traveler: Ok then, it's a done deal!
Dialogue: Ok then, it's a done deal!

Dialogue: It's a 3-piece Master Materia set... and it's all yours!

Original: Kalm Traveler: I dunno......
Dialogue: I dunno......

Original: Kalm Traveler: I guess it's time to go on a journey for the souls of my departed friends......
Dialogue: I guess it's time to go on a journey for the souls of my departed friends......

Original: NPC: I heard Shinra's taking all its biggest artillery from Junon and its various other facilities and gathering it in Midgar to fight the meteor and Weapon.
Dialogue: I heard Shinra's taking all its biggest artillery from Junon and its various other facilities and gathering it in Midgar to fight the meteor and Weapon.

Original: NPC: They say the remaining members of AVALANCHE broke Shinra's resistance and destroyed the Mako cannon at Midgar.
Dialogue: They say the remaining members of AVALANCHE broke Shinra's resistance and destroyed the Mako cannon at Midgar.

Original: NPC: What's going to happen to the world...?
Dialogue: What's going to happen to the world...?

Original: NPC: Listen, I've worked hard till now... and you say Meteor's gonna smash everything to bits? Well, I ain't standin' around listenin' to fool talk like this. Makes a person lose the will to work, that's what it does!
Dialogue: Listen, I've worked hard till now... and you say Meteor's gonna smash everything to bits? Well, I ain't standin' around listenin' to fool talk like this. Makes a person lose the will to work, that's what it does!

Original: NPC: What're ya, dense? Something like that'll never happen! It's ridiculous!
Dialogue: What're ya, dense? Something like that'll never happen! It's ridiculous!

Original: NPC: And all of Midgar's gonna be destroyed by a falling meteor? Oh, don't make me laugh! Lately, there's been a number of scary incidents. I hate it. Just hate it!
Dialogue: And all of Midgar's gonna be destroyed by a falling meteor? Oh, don't make me laugh! Lately, there's been a number of scary incidents. I hate it. Just hate it!

Original: NPC: I heard the remaining members of AVALANCHE smashed the Shinra troops at Midgar. Lately, there's been a number of scary incidents. I hate it. Just hate it!
Dialogue: I heard the remaining members of AVALANCHE smashed the Shinra troops at Midgar. Lately, there's been a number of scary incidents. I hate it. Just hate it!

Dialogue: Wark!! Wark!!
