Dialogue: They tried to give you something but you couldn't get it.

Original: Chocobo: Wark!! Wark!!
Dialogue: Wark!! Wark!!

Original: Choco Bill: Welcome.
Dialogue: Welcome.

Original: Choco Bill: How 'bout a Chocobo Lure materia? Each level it increases, makes it easier for you to find a Chocobo.
Dialogue: How 'bout a Chocobo Lure materia? Each level it increases, makes it easier for you to find a Chocobo.

Original: Choco Bill: Oh, what is that? What has this world come to? Stars falling and everything.
Dialogue: Oh, what is that? What has this world come to? Stars falling and everything.

Original: Choco Bill: With things the way they are now, how 'bout raising a Chocobo? No, I'm not trying to persuade you for money. It's just because of the state of things in the world. I thought that it would be a good and healthy thing for you to raise some Chocobos...
Dialogue: With things the way they are now, how 'bout raising a Chocobo? No, I'm not trying to persuade you for money. It's just because of the state of things in the world. I thought that it would be a good and healthy thing for you to raise some Chocobos...

Original: Choco Bill: Hmm...You just happen to be in luck! It just so happens that we aren't taking care of any Chocobos for anyone else, so... I could take care of 6 Chocobos right now, for 10000 gil per Chocobo. How 'bout it?
Dialogue: Hmm...You just happen to be in luck! It just so happens that we aren't taking care of any Chocobos for anyone else, so... I could take care of 6 Chocobos right now, for 10000 gil per Chocobo. How 'bout it?

Original: Choco Bill: To raise a Chocobo, you'll need a 'Chocobo Stable'. And they rent for 10000 gil. Currently, I can rent out up to 6 'Chocobo Stables'. If you rent a 'Chocobo Stable', we will keep up to 4 of the Chocobos you catch in the fenced area outside. At a later date, you can select the Chocobo that you would like to put in your 'Chocobo Stable'.
Dialogue: To raise a Chocobo, you'll need a 'Chocobo Stable'. And they rent for 10000 gil. Currently, I can rent out up to 6 'Chocobo Stables'. If you rent a 'Chocobo Stable', we will keep up to 4 of the Chocobos you catch in the fenced area outside. At a later date, you can select the Chocobo that you would like to put in your 'Chocobo Stable'.

Original: Choco Bill: 'Chocobo Stables' cost 10000 gil...
Dialogue: Chocobo Stables' cost 10000 gil...

Original: Choco Bill: Thank you. My grandson takes care of the Chocobos. He's in the Chocobo Stable at the far right of the farm. Please tell him what you want.
Dialogue: Thank you. My grandson takes care of the Chocobos. He's in the Chocobo Stable at the far right of the farm. Please tell him what you want.

Original: Choco Bill: ....... Ummm, you don't have enough...
Dialogue: ....... Ummm, you don't have enough...

Original: Choco Bill: We don't have enough room to rent out more than 6 here...
Dialogue: We don't have enough room to rent out more than 6 here...

Original: Choco Bill: Someone once told me there is a 'Chocobo Sage'...somewhere. He seems to know how to raise some great Chocobos. If he really does exist, I'd like to meet him someday.
Dialogue: Someone once told me there is a 'Chocobo Sage'...somewhere. He seems to know how to raise some great Chocobos. If he really does exist, I'd like to meet him someday.

Original: Choco Bill: Chocobos aren't hard to take care of. The day to day care will all be done here. But, please buy the food for the Chocobo, and feed them yourselves. Chocobo's abilities will differ with what you feed it, so feel free to choose your own food. Also, if you're able to find a male and a female Chocobo that like each other, they'll produce an egg. But only if you feed them a 'Nut'. New Chocobos inherit the abilities of their parents. I've heard that sometimes new breeds of Chocobo are born with special abilities. I've never actually seen it before, though.
Dialogue: Chocobos aren't hard to take care of. The day to day care will all be done here. But, please buy the food for the Chocobo, and feed them yourselves. Chocobo's abilities will differ with what you feed it, so feel free to choose your own food. Also, if you're able to find a male and a female Chocobo that like each other, they'll produce an egg. But only if you feed them a 'Nut'. New Chocobos inherit the abilities of their parents. I've heard that sometimes new breeds of Chocobo are born with special abilities. I've never actually seen it before, though.

Original: Chole: Welcome! Hey, I've got something good to tell you. The white Chocobo likes it when you scratch behind its ears. But if you scratch it someplace that it doesn't like, it'll get mad, so be careful.
Dialogue: Welcome! Hey, I've got something good to tell you. The white Chocobo likes it when you scratch behind its ears. But if you scratch it someplace that it doesn't like, it'll get mad, so be careful.

Original: Chole: Hey, do you know what a Chocobo Sage is?
Dialogue: Hey, do you know what a Chocobo Sage is?

Original: Chole: What!? You've actually met him!? Wow! What did he tell you?
Dialogue: What!? You've actually met him!? Wow! What did he tell you?

Original: Chole: Wow, that's amazing! ...let me take some notes.
Dialogue: Wow, that's amazing! ...let me take some notes.

Original: Chole: Hey, did you ever see the Chocobo Sage again? What did he tell you?
Dialogue: Hey, did you ever see the Chocobo Sage again? What did he tell you?

Original: Chole: Wow, that's amazing! ...let me take some notes.
Dialogue: Wow, that's amazing! ...let me take some notes.

Original: Chole: What...?
Dialogue: What...?

Original: Chole: Other than regular Chocobo, there are "Mountain Chocobo" and "River-Chocobo".
Dialogue: Other than regular Chocobo, there are "Mountain Chocobo" and "River-Chocobo".

Original: Chole: In order for the "Mountain Chocobo" and "River Chocobo" to be born, You feed the "Carob Nut" to a "Great Chocobo" or a "Good Chocobo" and have it produce an egg. But we don't sell any "Carob Nuts".
Dialogue: In order for the "Mountain Chocobo" and "River Chocobo" to be born, You feed the "Carob Nut" to a "Great Chocobo" or a "Good Chocobo" and have it produce an egg. But we don't sell any "Carob Nuts".

Original: Chole: A "Great Chocobo" and a "Good Chocobo" are found... On an island Southeast of the Chocobo Sage's dwelling at Corel. And in the area west of Corel. The "Carob Nut" can be found south of the Chocobo Sage's dwelling. Monsters carry them. Let's see, is Bone Village just south of there?
Dialogue: A "Great Chocobo" and a "Good Chocobo" are found... On an island Southeast of the Chocobo Sage's dwelling at Corel. And in the area west of Corel. The "Carob Nut" can be found south of the Chocobo Sage's dwelling. Monsters carry them. Let's see, is Bone Village just south of there?

Original: Chole: One surprise If you get the "Mountain Chocobo" and the "River Chocobo" to produce an egg, You'll get a Chocobo that can cross mountains and rivers. I bet that the right nut for that is the "Carob Nut."
Dialogue: One surprise If you get the "Mountain Chocobo" and the "River Chocobo" to produce an egg, You'll get a Chocobo that can cross mountains and rivers. I bet that the right nut for that is the "Carob Nut."

Original: Chole: Bigger surprise: There seems to be a Chocobo that can cross the ocean. If you could cross the ocean, mountains, and rivers, there'd be no place you couldn't go.
Dialogue: Bigger surprise There seems to be a Chocobo that can cross the ocean. If you could cross the ocean, mountains, and rivers, there'd be no place you couldn't go.

Original: Chole: In order to get an Ocean Chocobo you need to get a Mountain-and-river Chocobo to mate with something else.
Dialogue: In order to get an Ocean Chocobo you need to get a Mountain-and-river Chocobo to mate with something else.

Original: Chole: If you mate the Mountain-and-river Chocobo with a "Wonderful Chocobo", You'll get an Ocean Chocobo. But to do that you can't use an ordinary Nut.
Dialogue: If you mate the Mountain-and-river Chocobo with a "Wonderful Chocobo", You'll get an Ocean Chocobo. But to do that you can't use an ordinary Nut.

Original: Chole: The "Nut" that produces Ocean Chocobos is the "Zeio Nut". This is the first I've ever heard of it. I wonder where you get them?
Dialogue: The "Nut" that produces Ocean Chocobos is the "Zeio Nut". This is the first I've ever heard of it. I wonder where you get them?

Original: Chole: Zeio Nuts are found on a little island east of the Chocobo Sage. "Goblins" have them. With this, you can produce an "Ocean Chocobo". According to my research, Mountain, river, and ocean Chocobos are hard to produce. But, if you take the right care of the Chocobo, and increase their Class ranking by winning at the races, it'll increase your chances of getting one.
Dialogue: Zeio Nuts are found on a little island east of the Chocobo Sage. "Goblins" have them. With this, you can produce an "Ocean Chocobo". According to my research, Mountain, river, and ocean Chocobos are hard to produce. But, if you take the right care of the Chocobo, and increase their Class ranking by winning at the races, it'll increase your chances of getting one.

Original: Chole: There are no Chocobo.
Dialogue: There are no Chocobo.

Dialogue: For telling me that story, I'll tell you about each Chocobo's abilities.

Dialogue: From what I see, the fastest sprinter is... I think it's XXXX.

Dialogue: Finally, the most intelligent one is... That's XXXX

Original: Choco Billy: Welcome!
Dialogue: Welcome!

Original: Choco Billy: What the Chocobo eats are 'Greens' The most famous one is the 'Gizzard Greens.' Chocobos will mature differently depending on which 'Greens' they eat. Certain 'Greens' will boost their stamina. You'll have to figure out what kinds have what effects for yourselves. Oh, and Chocobos are born with certain natural abilities. So no matter how much they mature, they can't get more abilities than what they're born with. Remember that if a Chocobo's abilities don't increase even though you feed it, that means its limit is reached. It's best to let those kinds of Chocobo go or mate them to get a new Chocobo.
Dialogue: What the Chocobo eats are 'Greens' The most famous one is the 'Gizzard Greens.' Chocobos will mature differently depending on which 'Greens' they eat. Certain 'Greens' will boost their stamina. You'll have to figure out what kinds have what effects for yourselves. Oh, and Chocobos are born with certain natural abilities. So no matter how much they mature, they can't get more abilities than what they're born with. Remember that if a Chocobo's abilities don't increase even though you feed it, that means its limit is reached. It's best to let those kinds of Chocobo go or mate them to get a new Chocobo.

Original: Choco Billy: A male and a female Chocobo together can produce an egg.
Dialogue: A male and a female Chocobo together can produce an egg.

Original: Choco Billy: The Chocobo out there is part of the stock that you caught. We can only keep 4 Chocobos here at once. If you get a fifth one, the first one will have to be let go. If you don't want that to happen, come back and put it in your own stable.
Dialogue: The Chocobo out there is part of the stock that you caught. We can only keep 4 Chocobos here at once. If you get a fifth one, the first one will have to be let go. If you don't want that to happen, come back and put it in your own stable.

Original: Choco Billy: Yeah, you can ride this one. And even if you take it outside, this Chocobo won't run away when you get off of it. If you want to return it to your 'Chocobo Stable' just ride it onto the farm. Then, you'll be able to feed it again.
Dialogue: Yeah, you can ride this one. And even if you take it outside, this Chocobo won't run away when you get off of it. If you want to return it to your 'Chocobo Stable' just ride it onto the farm. Then, you'll be able to feed it again.

Dialogue: Chocobos 'strengths are divided by 'Class'.

Dialogue: You don't even have any 'Chocobo Stable' If you want to raise Chocobos, go talk to Grandpa.

Dialogue: You spikey-headed jerk! One more time, let's go one more time!

Original: Yuffie: Hey, boobs! Try that again! Just one more time!
Dialogue: Hey, boobs! Try that again! Just one more time!

Original: Yuffie: Hey, you bow-legged ol' man! Give me another chance! I'll fight ya again!
Dialogue: Hey, you bow-legged ol' man! Give me another chance! I'll fight ya again!

Original: Yuffie: I won't lose this time! Take your time and get ready. Holler when you're ready!
Dialogue: I won't lose this time! Take your time and get ready. Holler when you're ready!

Original: Yuffie: No way I'm going to fight with punks like you more than once! I'll keep enough for the doctor bill! Next time, you won't be as lucky!
Dialogue: No way I'm going to fight with punks like you more than once! I'll keep enough for the doctor bill! Next time, you won't be as lucky!

Original: Yuffie: Thinkin' of running away? Stay and fight! FIGHT, I said!
Dialogue: Thinkin' of running away? Stay and fight! FIGHT, I said!

Original: Yuffie: C'mon...... What's the matter? You're pretty scared of me, huh!?
Dialogue: C'mon...... What's the matter? You're pretty scared of me, huh!?

Original: Yuffie: Hmm, just as I thought. What do you expect with my skills? Good luck to you guys too. If you feel up to it, we can go another round. Later!
Dialogue: Hmm, just as I thought. What do you expect with my skills? Good luck to you guys too. If you feel up to it, we can go another round. Later!

Original: Yuffie: I'm really gonna leave! REALLY!
Dialogue: I'm really gonna leave! REALLY!

Original: Yuffie: Oh yeah? Then do whatever you want!
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Then do whatever you want!

Original: Yuffie: What is it, you still have somethin' for me?
Dialogue: What is it, you still have somethin' for me?

Original: Yuffie: ......Hmmm. So is that it? I know you want my help because I'm so good! You want me to go with you?
Dialogue: ......Hmmm. So is that it? I know you want my help because I'm so good! You want me to go with you?

Original: Yuffie: What, you still want somethin'?
Dialogue: What, you still want somethin'?

Original: Yuffie: ...Hmm. So is that it? You want my help 'cause I'm so good! You want me to go with you! Is that what you're saying?
Dialogue: ...Hmm. So is that it? You want my help 'cause I'm so good! You want me to go with you! Is that what you're saying?

Original: Yuffie: What is it, you still want somethin'?
Dialogue: What is it, you still want somethin'?

Original: Yuffie: ...Hmm. So is that it? You want my help 'cause I'm so good! So you want me to come with you! Is that what you're saying?
Dialogue: ...Hmm. So is that it? You want my help 'cause I'm so good! So you want me to come with you! Is that what you're saying?

Original: Yuffie: Heh heh... thought so. You put me in a spot. Hmm, what should I do?
Dialogue: Heh heh... thought so. You put me in a spot. Hmm, what should I do?

Original: Yuffie: But if you want me that bad, I can't refuse...
Dialogue: But if you want me that bad, I can't refuse...

Original: Yuffie: But if you want me that bad, I can't say no...
Dialogue: But if you want me that bad, I can't say no...

Original: Yuffie: But if you want me that bad, I can't really say no...
Dialogue: But if you want me that bad, I can't really say no...

Original: Yuffie: All right! I'll go with you!
Dialogue: All right! I'll go with you!

Original: Yuffie: Me? The name's......
Dialogue: Me? The name's......

Original: Yuffie: What are you talking about!? You're the one who should go first!
Dialogue: What are you talking about!? You're the one who should go first!

Original: Yuffie: Okay forget it! I'm not going with you! Remember, if you piss me off... it'll cost you!!
Dialogue: Okay forget it! I'm not going with you! Remember, if you piss me off... it'll cost you!!

Original: Yuffie': Huh? Hey...HEY!
Dialogue: Huh? Hey...HEY!

Original: Yuffie: Wait! I haven't even told you my name......
Dialogue: Wait! I haven't even told you my name......

Original: Yuffie: I'm Yuffie! Good to meetcha!
Dialogue: I'm Yuffie! Good to meetcha!

Original: Yuffie: Heh heh...... just as I planned. Now all I have to do is... a little this...... and a little that...... nyuk, nyuk, nyuk......
Dialogue: Heh heh...... just as I planned. Now all I have to do is... a little this...... and a little that...... nyuk, nyuk, nyuk......

Original: Yuffie: Hey, wait up! Wait for me!!
Dialogue: Hey, wait up! Wait for me!!

Original: Yuffie: Here, I'll give you back the money I've stole from you! ......or, uh, what's left of it.
Dialogue: Here, I'll give you back the money I've stole from you! ......or, uh, what's left of it.

Original: Yuffie: Wh... what!? Uuuuugh! Now I'm really mad! Make fun of me, will ya! Just watch!!
Dialogue: Wh... what!? Uuuuugh! Now I'm really mad! Make fun of me, will ya! Just watch!!

Original: Barret: Hey, we been had! And... my money!
Dialogue: Hey, we been had! And... my money!

Original: Aeris: Hmm... Hey, don't we have less money than what we had?
Dialogue: Hmm... Hey, don't we have less money than what we had?

Original: Tifa: She's gone... What is it with her?
Dialogue: She's gone... What is it with her?

Original: Tifa: Hey! My money!
Dialogue: Hey! My money!

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): ...... There's some money missing.
Dialogue: ...... There's some money missing.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Hey! My emergency money!
Dialogue: Hey! My emergency money!

Original: Cait Sith: Gil, gil, gil, where's my gil!?
Dialogue: Gil, gil, gil, where's my gil!?

Original: Vincent: ...... Difficult to understand her motivation.
Dialogue: ...... Difficult to understand her motivation.

Original: Vincent: Hmm? ......pretty fast.
Dialogue: Hmm? ......pretty fast.

Original: Cid: What the--!? Gone! It's gone! My money's gone!
Dialogue: What the--!? Gone! It's gone! My money's gone!

Original: On-screen: XXX Gil Stolen!
Dialogue: XXX Gil Stolen!

Original: Barret: Shit!! Gimme back my money!!
Dialogue: Shit!! Gimme back my money!!

Original: Aeris: Geez!! You shouldn't do this!!
Dialogue: Geez!! You shouldn't do this!!

Original: Tifa: Wait a second! Where's my money!?
Dialogue: Wait a second! Where's my money!?

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Greed... A perfect example of human nature.
Dialogue: Greed... A perfect example of human nature.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Give...give back what is rightfully mine!
Dialogue: Give...give back what is rightfully mine!

Original: Cait Sith: Hey, you can't--! My gil, give it back--!
Dialogue: Hey, you can't--! My gil, give it back--!

Original: Vincent: The Gil doesn't seem to be her real objective...
Dialogue: The Gil doesn't seem to be her real objective...

Original: Cid: Steal MY money, will ya? You got a lot of #&^%$ nerve!! Just remember who you're dealin' with, punk!!
Dialogue: Steal MY money, will ya? You got a lot of #&^%$ nerve!! Just remember who you're dealin' with, punk!!

Original: Barret: Gone... Wassup with that?
Dialogue: Gone... Wassup with that?

Original: Aeris: She's gone... So what was that all about?
Dialogue: She's gone... So what was that all about?

Original: Tifa: She's gone... What is it with her...?
Dialogue: She's gone... What is it with her...?

Original: Red XIII: Huh? She's gone...... What is she doing?
Dialogue: Huh? She's gone...... What is she doing?

Original: Cait Sith: ...She disappeared... I don't have a clue what was going on.
Dialogue: ...She disappeared... I don't have a clue what was going on.

Original: Vincent: ...... Difficult to understand her motivation.
Dialogue: ...... Difficult to understand her motivation.

Original: Cid: She's gone, hey...... What's with that kid!?
Dialogue: She's gone, hey...... What's with that kid!?

Original: NPC: We've been fighting the Shinra for a long time at this battlefield. Even now, we're still settled in for a long war with them. If you aren't in a hurry, would you help us fight them?
Dialogue: We've been fighting the Shinra for a long time at this battlefield. Even now, we're still settled in for a long war with them. If you aren't in a hurry, would you help us fight them?

Original: NPC: Listen, we don't want to push you but, if you're in the middle of something, why don't you finish that first?
Dialogue: Listen, we don't want to push you but, if you're in the middle of something, why don't you finish that first?

Original: NPC: Let's see...... Head north along the coast, and keep going for a ways and you'll run into Junon. You gotta be careful 'cause it sits in the shadows of a small hill.
Dialogue: Let's see...... Head north along the coast, and keep going for a ways and you'll run into Junon. You gotta be careful 'cause it sits in the shadows of a small hill.

Original: NPC: Really!? Then go on up and they'll fill you in on the details.
Dialogue: Really!? Then go on up and they'll fill you in on the details.

Original: NPC: All right then...... Take care of yourselves...
Dialogue: All right then...... Take care of yourselves...

Original: NPC: Really!? Then go on up and they'll fill you in on the details.
Dialogue: Really!? Then go on up and they'll fill you in on the details.

Original: NPC: Do you guys want to see it, too?
Dialogue: Do you guys want to see it, too?

Original: Cloud: See what?
Dialogue: See what?

Original: Tifa: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Cid: What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: NPC: The condors. They're huge. Come on, have a look.
Dialogue: The condors. They're huge. Come on, have a look.

Original: NPC: What do ya think? Awesome, huh?
Dialogue: What do ya think? Awesome, huh?

Original: Barret: Ey, let's get some rest.
Dialogue: Ey, let's get some rest.

Original: Aeris: Let's rest. Okay?
Dialogue: Let's rest. Okay?

Original: Tifa: Say, let's take a rest. Okay?
Dialogue: Say, let's take a rest. Okay?

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): We should get some rest while we can.
Dialogue: We should get some rest while we can.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Let's take a rest when we can afford to.
Dialogue: Let's take a rest when we can afford to.

Original: Yuffie: Come on... break time, break time!
Dialogue: Come on... break time, break time!

Original: Cait Sith: Now, shall we get some rest?
Dialogue: Now, shall we get some rest?

Original: Vincent: It's probably best to get some rest now.
Dialogue: It's probably best to get some rest now.

Original: Cid: Come on; let's get some shut-eye.
Dialogue: Come on; let's get some shut-eye.

Original: Cloud: ......
Tifa: Yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah...

Original: Cid: Yo!
Dialogue: Yo!

Original: NPC: Hello. I'm sorry but we're not selling anything now. We're using everything we have for ourselves.
Dialogue: Hello. I'm sorry but we're not selling anything now. We're using everything we have for ourselves.

Original: NPC: Sorry, but I can't sell you anything now.
Dialogue: Sorry, but I can't sell you anything now.

Original: NPC: Hmmn, now this is something, I never thought anyone would ever climb up here.......Your eyes are different.Well, anyhow. Any minute now, this will be a battlefield against Shinra. You'd better get down before you get involved.
Dialogue: Hmmn, now this is something, I never thought anyone would ever climb up here. ......Your eyes are different. Well, anyhow. Any minute now, this will be a battlefield against Shinra. You'd better get down before you get involved.

Original: Barret: Shinra? The hell those jackasses doing here?
Dialogue: Shinra? The hell those jackasses doing here?

Original: Aeris: What do you mean, "a battlefield"?
Dialogue: What do you mean, "a battlefield"?

Original: Tifa: You mean Shinra?
Dialogue: You mean Shinra?

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): The Shinra......
Dialogue: The Shinra......

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Shinra again.
Dialogue: Shinra again.

Original: Yuffie: The Shinra? Here too?
Dialogue: The Shinra? Here too?

Original: Cait Sith: ......
Vincent: What do you mean by that?
Dialogue: What do you mean by that?

Original: Cid: A battlefield, we can't overlook that.
Dialogue: A battlefield, we can't overlook that.

Original: NPC: It appears you have a problem with Shinra, too. After all, you climbed up here. Why not listen to what I have to say for a moment?
Dialogue: It appears you have a problem with Shinra, too. After all, you climbed up here. Why not listen to what I have to say for a moment?

Original: Cloud: ......
Barret: The hell you talkin' about!? They're all fightin' the Shinra too! You gonna ignore that!?
Dialogue: The hell you talkin' about!? They're all fightin' the Shinra too! You gonna ignore that!?

Original: Aeris: After all, we came all this way, Cloud.
Dialogue: After all, we came all this way, Cloud.

Original: Tifa: Cloud, let's listen to what they have to say.
Dialogue: Cloud, let's listen to what they have to say.

Original: Yuffie: Is this about the jewels?
Dialogue: Is this about the jewels?

Original: Cait Sith: I know, I know, Cloud. But let's listen for a bit.
Dialogue: I know, I know, Cloud. But let's listen for a bit.

Original: Vincent: There's no harm in listening to them.
Dialogue: There's no harm in listening to them.

Original: Cid: Man, she sure's cold.
Dialogue: Man, she sure's cold.

Original: Tifa: Oh, by all means.
Dialogue: Oh, by all means.

Original: Cid: All right, talk on!
Dialogue: All right, talk on!

Original: NPC: Do you know what's at the top of this mountain?
Dialogue: Do you know what's at the top of this mountain?

Original: Barret: Huh? Something's up there?
Dialogue: Huh? Something's up there?

Original: Tifa: Come on, let's get it together.
Dialogue: Come on, let's get it together.

Original: Yuffie: Look close, old man.
Dialogue: Look close, old man.

Original: Aeris: A huge bird.
Dialogue: A huge bird.

Original: Red XIII: That's the reactor. And the condor.
Dialogue: That's the reactor. And the condor.

Original: Cait Sith: Yeah, come to think of it there was something.
Dialogue: Yeah, come to think of it there was something.

Original: Vincent: Come to think of it, there was a reactor. But I've never seen anything shaped like it......
Dialogue: Come to think of it, there was a reactor. But I've never seen anything shaped like it......

Original: Cloud: The reactor and the condor.
Dialogue: The reactor and the condor.

Original: Tifa: That's the reactor and the condor.
Dialogue: That's the reactor and the condor.

Original: NPC: I can see you're very perceptive. Yes, it's a reactor and a condor. It seems the Shinra doesn't like the idea of having a condor on top of the reactor.
Dialogue: I can see you're very perceptive. Yes, it's a reactor and a condor. It seems the Shinra doesn't like the idea of having a condor on top of the reactor.

Original: Barret: Damn, that's one big bird! But why are they trying to get rid of it with weapons?
Dialogue: Damn, that's one big bird! But why are they trying to get rid of it with weapons?

Original: Aeris: Why?
Dialogue: Why?

Original: Tifa: What's so wrong with having a condor on top of the reactor?
Dialogue: What's so wrong with having a condor on top of the reactor?

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): It's not very logical.
Dialogue: It's not very logical.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): The logic eludes me.
Dialogue: The logic eludes me.

Original: Yuffie: I'm certain there must be state-of-the-art materia inside the reactor. Am I right?
Dialogue: I'm certain there must be state-of-the-art materia inside the reactor. Am I right?

Original: Cait Sith: Huh?......
Vincent: ......That's too much.
Dialogue: ......That's too much.

Original: Cid: Huh? I don't get it.
Dialogue: Huh? I don't get it.

Original: NPC: It seems there's some type of special materia in the reactor above us. And because the condors came, the Shinra rushed troops here. The military wants to get the condor and all the villagers off this mountain. The condors are now warming their eggs, which hatch only once every few years. We would like to protect the condors from being harmed.
Dialogue: It seems there's some type of special materia in the reactor above us. And because the condors came, the Shinra rushed troops here. The military wants to get the condor and all the villagers off this mountain. The condors are now warming their eggs, which hatch only once every few years. We would like to protect the condors from being harmed.

Original: Cloud: New lives......
Dialogue: New lives......

Original: Barret: I'll do it! I'll protect them from Shinra!
Dialogue: I'll do it! I'll protect them from Shinra!

Original: Aeris: We must protect the condor eggs, right?
Dialogue: We must protect the condor eggs, right?

Original: Tifa: Condors' eggs. A real work of nature. We've got to protect the life of the planet.
Dialogue: Condors' eggs. A real work of nature. We've got to protect the life of the planet.

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): So, to protect the eggs, are you gonna protect the reactor?......
Dialogue: So, to protect the eggs, are you gonna protect the reactor?......

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): We're going to protect the reactor in order to save the eggs.
Dialogue: We're going to protect the reactor in order to save the eggs.

Original: Yuffie: Special materia, huh? Well, well, things are getting interesting.
Dialogue: Special materia, huh? Well, well, things are getting interesting.

Original: Cait Sith: I'm gonna leave it up to you all.
Dialogue: I'm gonna leave it up to you all.

Original: Vincent: ......and come out in one piece?
Dialogue: ......and come out in one piece?

Original: Cid: You guys, what are ya gonna do?
Dialogue: You guys, what are ya gonna do?

Original: NPC: Unfortunately, we don't have the ability to fight Shinra ourselves. That's why we have hired soldiers to help us. As our sponsor you can help us with a contribution or by fighting along side of us... What do you think? You want to join us in our fight?
Dialogue: Unfortunately, we don't have the ability to fight Shinra ourselves. That's why we have hired soldiers to help us. As our sponsor you can help us with a contribution or by fighting along side of us... What do you think? You want to join us in our fight?

Original: Cloud: ......
Barret: What's there to think about? We gotta do it!
Dialogue: What's there to think about? We gotta do it!

Original: Aeris: Cloud, why are you still worrying about it?
Dialogue: Cloud, why are you still worrying about it?

Original: Tifa: Cloud......
Dialogue: Cloud......

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): You decide what we're going to do.
Dialogue: You decide what we're going to do.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): What are we going to do?
Dialogue: What are we going to do?

Original: Yuffie: If things go right, we might even be able to pray to that special materia.
Dialogue: If things go right, we might even be able to pray to that special materia.

Original: Cait Sith: I'll leave it up to you so please do as you see fit.
Dialogue: I'll leave it up to you so please do as you see fit.

Original: Vincent: It's difficult to get back what you've lost......
Dialogue: It's difficult to get back what you've lost......

Original: Cid: Don't be so wishy-washy. Hurry and make up your mind.
Dialogue: Don't be so wishy-washy. Hurry and make up your mind.

Original: Cloud: ......
Barret: Hey! We'll come to the rescue.
Dialogue: Hey! We'll come to the rescue.

Original: Aeris: Yes, yes. Let's do our best.
Dialogue: Yes, yes. Let's do our best.

Original: Tifa: Cloud, thanks.
Dialogue: Cloud, thanks.

Original: Red XIII(before "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): I got it. Let me lend a hand, too.
Dialogue: I got it. Let me lend a hand, too.

Original: Red XIII(after "In the Land of the Study of Planet Life"): Got it. I'm gonna lend a hand, too.
Dialogue: Got it. I'm gonna lend a hand, too.

Original: Yuffie: Okay, it's settled. We're gonna get the materia, right?
Dialogue: Okay, it's settled. We're gonna get the materia, right?

Original: Cait Sith: Well then, let's do our best.
Dialogue: Well then, let's do our best.

Original: Vincent: That's the right decision.
Dialogue: That's the right decision.

Original: Cid: If you've made up your mind, let's just do it.
Dialogue: If you've made up your mind, let's just do it.

Original: Barret: What are you thinking!? And you call yourself a human!?
Dialogue: What are you thinking!? And you call yourself a human!?

Original: Aeris: What a jerk. I'm disappointed in you.
Dialogue: What a jerk. I'm disappointed in you.

Original: Tifa: Well......
Dialogue: Well......

Original: Yuffie: We may have lost the materia.
Dialogue: We may have lost the materia.

Original: Vincent: Now don't regret what's already past.
Dialogue: Now don't regret what's already past.

Original: Cid: If you've made up your mind, let's just do it.
Dialogue: If you've made up your mind, let's just do it.

Original: NPC: I see...... Come back if you should change your mind.
Dialogue: I see...... Come back if you should change your mind.

Original: NPC: Have you by chance changed your mind?
Dialogue: Have you by chance changed your mind?

Original: Tifa: Everyone, listen to what I have to say. I can't possibly leave these people like this. Let's do whatever we can to help them. All right?
Dialogue: Everyone, listen to what I have to say. I can't possibly leave these people like this. Let's do whatever we can to help them. All right?

Original: Cid: If you go that far, what can I say. Well, we'll be able to do something if you leave it up to us.
Dialogue: If you go that far, what can I say. Well, we'll be able to do something if you leave it up to us.

Original: Barret: Hey! We'll come to the rescue.
Dialogue: Hey! We'll come to the rescue.

Original: Red XIII: Got it. I'm gonna lend a hand, too.
Dialogue: Got it. I'm gonna lend a hand, too.

Original: Yuffie: Okay, it's settled. We're gonna get the materia, right?
Dialogue: Okay, it's settled. We're gonna get the materia, right?

Original: Cait Sith: Well then, let's do our best.
Dialogue: Well then, let's do our best.

Original: Vincent: That's the right decision.
Dialogue: That's the right decision.

Original: NPC: Whew, we'll be saved. Ask my son, who's standing guard at the shed, about the details of our military tactics. We're depending on you. Yes, yes, I've also told the store owners about you, so they should sell you various items. And feel free to use our beds.
Dialogue: Whew, we'll be saved. Ask my son, who's standing guard at the shed, about the details of our military tactics. We're depending on you. Yes, yes, I've also told the store owners about you, so they should sell you various items. And feel free to use our beds.

Original: NPC: Hello. Do your best. We will, too.
Dialogue: Hello. Do your best. We will, too.

Original: NPC: You hang in there!
Dialogue: You hang in there!

Original: NPC: So, will you help us? I don't want them to get killed. They're gigantic birds and so striking. We simply can't let them be killed by man's selfishness?
Dialogue: So, will you help us? I don't want them to get killed. They're gigantic birds and so striking. We simply can't let them be killed by man's selfishness?

Original: NPC: Of course not. There's no way, especially at the hands of Shinra. If you're going to go look at them, get on top of that chair over there.
Dialogue: Of course not. There's no way, especially at the hands of Shinra. If you're going to go look at them, get on top of that chair over there.

Original: NPC: Thanks for accepting. Let me explain our strategy. The enemy will climb the mountain looking for the reactor. We will leave a trap for them and hire soldiers to protect the area.
Dialogue: Thanks for accepting. Let me explain our strategy. The enemy will climb the mountain looking for the reactor. We will leave a trap for them and hire soldiers to protect the area.

Original: NPC: Well, that's all, but...... This village doesn't have any money. Even if we wanted to fight, our hands are tied 'cause we're broke. If we hired one soldier, we would need 400 gil. So, if we hire 20 soldiers, we must have 8000 gil. So if you folks have the time, we would like you to use your own money to hire these soldiers, buy the trap, set it up and command the troops. If you're pressed for time we'd like you to help us with the money. If you can give us the money, we can then hire soldiers with the funds and block Shinra's attack. We know that what we're asking is selfish. We have sent our wives and children to another village. We are resigned to our fate.
Dialogue: Well, that's all, but...... This village doesn't have any money. Even if we wanted to fight, our hands are tied 'cause we're broke. If we hired one soldier, we would need 400 gil. So, if we hire 20 soldiers, we must have 8000 gil. So if you folks have the time, we would like you to use your own money to hire these soldiers, buy the trap, set it up and command the troops. If you're pressed for time we'd like you to help us with the money. If you can give us the money, we can then hire soldiers with the funds and block Shinra's attack. We know that what we're asking is selfish. We have sent our wives and children to another village. We are resigned to our fate.

Original: NPC: Let's get back to square one. If the enemy penetrates our shed, you'll have to fight them immediately. Well, just because you lost once, it's not the end of the world, but if you lose repeatedly, it could be dangerous.
Dialogue: Let's get back to square one. If the enemy penetrates our shed, you'll have to fight them immediately. Well, just because you lost once, it's not the end of the world, but if you lose repeatedly, it could be dangerous.

Original: NPC: Now then, is there anything you wish to ask?
Dialogue: Now then, is there anything you wish to ask?

Original: NPC: You can win by wiping out the enemy or killing the enemy commander in charge. If the enemy reaches the shed, they'll attack, and you'll have no choice but to go into battle immediately. In the event that you lose during direct contact, even if the enemy gets to the reactor, there's still a chance to save things. But it's only a slight chance, and we have no idea how much the reactor can endure in an attack. When we can't stand up to the attack any longer, the Shinra will take both the condors and our lives, as well as all the materia within the reactor.
Dialogue: You can win by wiping out the enemy or killing the enemy commander in charge. If the enemy reaches the shed, they'll attack, and you'll have no choice but to go into battle immediately. In the event that you lose during direct contact, even if the enemy gets to the reactor, there's still a chance to save things. But it's only a slight chance, and we have no idea how much the reactor can endure in an attack. When we can't stand up to the attack any longer, the Shinra will take both the condors and our lives, as well as all the materia within the reactor.

Original: NPC: There are four types of enemies.
Dialogue: There are four types of enemies.

Original: NPC: Wyverns are flying types that can move at high speed. Stoner and Tristoner aren't effective against them.
Dialogue: Wyverns are flying types that can move at high speed. Stoner and Tristoner aren't effective against them.

Original: NPC: Beasts are monster types that do not move quickly, but have explosive attacking power.
Dialogue: Beasts are monster types that do not move quickly, but have explosive attacking power.

Original: NPC: Barbarians are human types. They attack indirectly, so you've got to be on your toes.
Dialogue: Barbarians are human types. They attack indirectly, so you've got to be on your toes.

Original: NPC: Commanders are the enemy commanders. They're the ones we want to subdue, but they're formidable foes.
Dialogue: Commanders are the enemy commanders. They're the ones we want to subdue, but they're formidable foes.

Original: NPC: Your mobile allies are: Fighters, Attackers, Defenders, Shooters, Repairers and Workers. Your immobile allies are: Stoner, Tristoner, Catapult, and Fire Catapult. Which do you want to hear about?
Dialogue: Your mobile allies are Fighters, Attackers, Defenders, Shooters, Repairers and Workers. Your immobile allies are Stoner, Tristoner, Catapult, and Fire Catapult. Which do you want to hear about?

Original: NPC: Which do you want to hear about?
Dialogue: Which do you want to hear about?

Original: NPC: Fighters are good at defending and attacking, but aren't especially effective or deficient for any enemy.
Dialogue: Fighters are good at defending and attacking, but aren't especially effective or deficient for any enemy.

Original: NPC: Attackers move extremely fast and are best for expanding the front line. They work good against enemy Beasts, but not enemy Barbarians.
Dialogue: Attackers move extremely fast and are best for expanding the front line. They work good against enemy Beasts, but not enemy Barbarians.

Original: NPC: Defenders have high endurance, but move slowly. They're best suited for defense. Defenders work best against enemy Barbarians, but not enemy Wyverns.
Dialogue: Defenders have high endurance, but move slowly. They're best suited for defense. Defenders work best against enemy Barbarians, but not enemy Wyverns.

Original: NPC: Shooters attack indirectly, but has low endurance. Shooters work best against enemy Wyverns, but not enemy Beasts.
Dialogue: Shooters attack indirectly, but has low endurance. Shooters work best against enemy Wyverns, but not enemy Beasts.

Original: NPC: Repairers repair allied aircraft, but have little attacking power.
Dialogue: Repairers repair allied aircraft, but have little attacking power.

Original: NPC: Workers set torpedoes. Torpedoes have strong attacking power, but Workers don't. Torpedoes explode when touched by the enemy. The explosions will damage everything in the immediate area.
Dialogue: Workers set torpedoes. Torpedoes have strong attacking power, but Workers don't. Torpedoes explode when touched by the enemy. The explosions will damage everything in the immediate area.

Original: NPC: Which do you want to hear about?
Dialogue: Which do you want to hear about?

Original: NPC: Stoners can fire a single boulder, causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.
Dialogue: Stoners can fire a single boulder, causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.

Original: NPC: Tristoners can fire three boulders simultaneously, causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.
Dialogue: Tristoners can fire three boulders simultaneously, causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.

Original: NPC: We can't use the Tristoner or Fire Catapult, because they are still being developed.
Dialogue: We can't use the Tristoner or Fire Catapult, because they are still being developed.

Original: NPC: The Fire Catapult is ready now, so we can set it up. We can't use the Tristoner, because it is still being developed.
Dialogue: The Fire Catapult is ready now, so we can set it up. We can't use the Tristoner, because it is still being developed.

Original: NPC: Catapults shoot rocks a great distance. causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.
Dialogue: Catapults shoot rocks a great distance. causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.

Original: NPC: Fire Catapults fire bombs a great distance. causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.
Dialogue: Fire Catapults fire bombs a great distance. causing extensive damage to every enemy it hits.

Original: NPC: We can't use the Tristoner or Fire Catapult, because they are still being developed.
Dialogue: We can't use the Tristoner or Fire Catapult, because they are still being developed.

Original: NPC: The Fire Catapult is ready now, so we can set it up. We can't use the Tristoner, because it is still being developed.
Dialogue: The Fire Catapult is ready now, so we can set it up. We can't use the Tristoner, because it is still being developed.

Original: NPC: We have XXXX gil right now.
Dialogue: We have XXXX gil right now.

Original: NPC: We need 3000 gil for each battle. How much can you help?
Dialogue: We need 3000 gil for each battle. How much can you help?

Original: NPC: Thanks. This makes XXXX gil.
Dialogue: Thanks. This makes XXXX gil.

Original: NPC: We are very grateful, but you don't have enough money.
Dialogue: We are very grateful, but you don't have enough money.

Original: NPC: That's enough money for now. If we run out, we'll ask you for more.
Dialogue: That's enough money for now. If we run out, we'll ask you for more.

Original: NPC: First off, we must prepare the troops. Move the cursor wherever the x mark does not appear, then press the O button to set-up. After all positions are in place, select by pressing the X button. This starts the battle.
Dialogue: First off, we must prepare the troops. Move the cursor wherever the x mark does not appear, then press the O button to set-up. After all positions are in place, select by pressing the X button. This starts the battle.

Original: NPC: Soldiers can only be arranged near the shed, in the beginning. That's because if the soldiers are too far away, they won't be able to follow instructions. You can only put soldiers on the horizontal line at the very bottom. Soldiers can be instructed by pushing the select button. So if any commands are unclear, push it. Soldiers can report by pushing the
Dialogue: Soldiers can only be arranged near the shed, in the beginning. That's because if the soldiers are too far away, they won't be able to follow instructions. You can only put soldiers on the horizontal line at the very bottom. Soldiers can be instructed by pushing the select button. So if any commands are unclear, push it. Soldiers can report by pushing the

Original: NPC: The cursor will move to the soldier who made the report. Press the
Dialogue: The cursor will move to the soldier who made the report. Press the

Original: NPC: It would be great if you could spare the time to help us... But if you really don't have time, would you contribute some financial assistance.
Dialogue: It would be great if you could spare the time to help us... But if you really don't have time, would you contribute some financial assistance.

Original: NPC: Hey, this one climbing up here looks like they'd be just right. Please, any help is appreciated...
Dialogue: Hey, this one climbing up here looks like they'd be just right. Please, any help is appreciated...

Original: NPC: Preparations ready?
Dialogue: Preparations ready?

Original: NPC: Perfect timing! They're just around the corner. Get ready.
Dialogue: Perfect timing! They're just around the corner. Get ready.

Original: NPC: The situation has changed. Looks like the enemy is set to attack. If we lose here, it's over. Our lives are in your hands. We're counting on you. Ready?
Dialogue: The situation has changed. Looks like the enemy is set to attack. If we lose here, it's over. Our lives are in your hands. We're counting on you. Ready?

Original: NPC: Ready?
Dialogue: Ready?

Original: NPC: Hey we're a little short on money... So could you at least make it 4000 gil?
Dialogue: Hey we're a little short on money... So could you at least make it 4000 gil?

Original: NPC: I see, very well then. Maybe, we'll fight together again sometime.
Dialogue: I see, very well then. Maybe, we'll fight together again sometime.

Original: NPC: Sorry. We only have XXXX gil. We have to beg for your help.
Dialogue: Sorry. We only have XXXX gil. We have to beg for your help.

Original: NPC: You have 10 enemies. There appear to be many Beasts, so you may want to deploy more Attackers.
Dialogue: You have 10 enemies. There appear to be many Beasts, so you may want to deploy more Attackers.

Original: NPC: The Barbarians are mixed during this attack. There are more than 20. Set up for a balanced-attack or we'll be in trouble.
Dialogue: The Barbarians are mixed during this attack. There are more than 20. Set up for a balanced-attack or we'll be in trouble.

Original: NPC: A strong unit's on their way. Looks like around 30. They'll probably climb up here using various routes. Better be careful or we'll be in trouble. And make sure to deploy Fire Catapults.
Dialogue: A strong unit's on their way. Looks like around 30. They'll probably climb up here using various routes. Better be careful or we'll be in trouble. And make sure to deploy Fire Catapults.

Original: NPC: You're probably used to it now, but don't let your guard down. Deploy Tristoners.
Dialogue: You're probably used to it now, but don't let your guard down. Deploy Tristoners.

Original: NPC:Looks like the enemy numbers 40. Don't let your guard down.
Dialogue: Looks like the enemy numbers 40. Don't let your guard down.

Original: NPC: I think you don't need my advice. The rest is up to you.
Dialogue: I think you don't need my advice. The rest is up to you.

Original: NPC: This is the deciding battle. The enemy numbers more than ever before.
Dialogue: This is the deciding battle. The enemy numbers more than ever before.

Original: NPC: Let's give them all the gil we have.
Dialogue: Let's give them all the gil we have.

Original: On-screen: Received "XXXX gil"!
Dialogue: Received "XXXX gil"!

Original: NPC: Whew, that was good. But Shinra's troops will be back. Be sure and scout the area well... we don't know when they'll attack again. We have XXX allies left, so here's XXXX gil.
Dialogue: Whew, that was good. But Shinra's troops will be back. Be sure and scout the area well... we don't know when they'll attack again. We have XXX allies left, so here's XXXX gil.

Original: NPC: Oh, yeah. I found this just now on the battlefield. Maybe it'll come in handy for you guys.
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. I found this just now on the battlefield. Maybe it'll come in handy for you guys.

Original: On-screen: Received "XXXXX"!
Dialogue: Received "XXXXX"!

Original: NPC: My God! They're attacking! We're counting on you.
Dialogue: My God! They're attacking! We're counting on you.

Original: NPC: We made it through that one somehow. But Shinra'll be back. Be sure and scout the area well... we don't know when they'll attack again.
Dialogue: We made it through that one somehow. But Shinra'll be back. Be sure and scout the area well... we don't know when they'll attack again.

Original: NPC: Are you all right? Looks like a few got through.
Dialogue: Are you all right? Looks like a few got through.

Original: NPC: How goes it? The Shinra troops have attacked [number] times since you were here. So we're getting a little short on funds. We have XXXX gil right now.
Dialogue: How goes it? The Shinra troops have attacked [number] times since you were here. So we're getting a little short on funds. We have XXXX gil right now.

Original: NPC: How are things going? Seems like there's no activity at Shinra.
Dialogue: How are things going? Seems like there's no activity at Shinra.

Original: NPC: If you want to get on the elevator that badly, give me 10 gil!
Dialogue: If you want to get on the elevator that badly, give me 10 gil!

Original: NPC: Hurry up and get in!
Dialogue: Hurry up and get in!

Original: NPC: That's not enough! Can't let you get on...
Dialogue: That's not enough! Can't let you get on...

Original: NPC: You're such a cheapskate.
Dialogue: You're such a cheapskate.

Original: NPC: If you see a weapon you want, you'd better buy it.
Dialogue: If you see a weapon you want, you'd better buy it.

Original: NPC: You want me?
Dialogue: You want me?

Original: NPC: Wow, now this is rare. We almost never have anyone other than the Shinra people visit this town.
Dialogue: Wow, now this is rare. We almost never have anyone other than the Shinra people visit this town.

Original: NPC: I know you guys want to go to the Western Continent, but the only way is on a Shinra ship.
Dialogue: I know you guys want to go to the Western Continent, but the only way is on a Shinra ship.

Original: NPC: For the past few decades, the only thing I've been hearing about is the Shinra. I miss the times when we used to talk only about fish...
Dialogue: For the past few decades, the only thing I've been hearing about is the Shinra. I miss the times when we used to talk only about fish...

Original: NPC: Ever since...Shinra built that city up above during the war, ... ugh,ugh. There's been no fish in the water! It got so polluted...phew...
Dialogue: Ever since...Shinra built that city up above during the war, ... ugh,ugh. There's been no fish in the water! It got so polluted...phew...

Original: NPC: I don't think I'll ever...cough... ...live to see things... ...beautiful again.
Dialogue: I don't think I'll ever...cough... ...live to see things... ...beautiful again.

Original: NPC: There's nothing here now... But it used to be a busy port.
Dialogue: There's nothing here now... But it used to be a busy port.

Original: Cloud: What kinda place is this?
Dialogue: What kinda place is this?

Original: NPC: Who are you people? Where did you come from?
Dialogue: Who are you people? Where did you come from?

Original: Cloud: Did you see a man with a black cape?
Dialogue: Did you see a man with a black cape?

Original: NPC: Hmm... I've never seen that feller before.
Dialogue: Hmm... I've never seen that feller before.

Original: NPC: Sorry, Cloud. Priscilla needs to rest for a while.
Dialogue: Sorry, Cloud. Priscilla needs to rest for a while.

Original: On-screen: Jump up to the cargo ship on the dolphin?
Dialogue: Jump up to the cargo ship on the dolphin?

Original: NPC: I almost passed out when I saw Weapon. It seems Weapon was beaten, but a Shinra soldier told me there are 4 more.
Dialogue: I almost passed out when I saw Weapon. It seems Weapon was beaten, but a Shinra soldier told me there are 4 more.

Original: NPC: They say Shinra's gathering Huge Materia from around the world and bringing it to Junon. Bringing it to Junon must mean they want to use their airplanes.
Dialogue: They say Shinra's gathering Huge Materia from around the world and bringing it to Junon. Bringing it to Junon must mean they want to use their airplanes.

Original: NPC: I've noticed there's been a lot of Shinra ships recently. I think they're going to the off-shore Underwater Reactor. Isn't Shinra trying to transport the Reactor's Huge Materia?
Dialogue: I've noticed there's been a lot of Shinra ships recently. I think they're going to the off-shore Underwater Reactor. Isn't Shinra trying to transport the Reactor's Huge Materia?

Original: NPC: I heard a war's about to start! And that's why they're moving the big cannon!
Dialogue: I heard a war's about to start! And that's why they're moving the big cannon!

Original: NPC: Could be the end of the world...
Dialogue: Could be the end of the world...

Original: NPC: Once Meteor hits, not just the fish, but the whole ocean will be destroyed...
Dialogue: Once Meteor hits, not just the fish, but the whole ocean will be destroyed...

Original: NPC: It seems like there's something going on again up there. Is that huge plane going to take off again with that deafening roar?
Dialogue: It seems like there's something going on again up there. Is that huge plane going to take off again with that deafening roar?

Original: NPC: What? Cloud is missing?
Dialogue: What? Cloud is missing?

Original: Tifa: Maybe...he dropped some from the North Caves into the Lifestream... Sir, do you know where the Lifestream runs through? Cloud might have drifted from there.
Dialogue: Maybe...he dropped some from the North Caves into the Lifestream... Sir, do you know where the Lifestream runs through? Cloud might have drifted from there.

Original: NPC: What? The Northern...what? Sorry, but I don't think I follow. But...I think I remember hearing Priscilla saying 'Life...something' before.
Dialogue: What? The Northern...what? Sorry, but I don't think I follow. But...I think I remember hearing Priscilla saying 'Life...something' before.

Original: NPC: I think I've heard Priscilla mentioning 'Life...something' before.
Dialogue: I think I've heard Priscilla mentioning 'Life...something' before.

Original: NPC: I remember years ago, seein' the Shinra build a long pipe underwater. The underwater reactor is connected to Junon by a pipe. You should be able to get to the reactor through it.
Dialogue: I remember years ago, seein' the Shinra build a long pipe underwater. The underwater reactor is connected to Junon by a pipe. You should be able to get to the reactor through it.

Original: NPC: I just saw some Shinra soldiers all huddled together discussing something. They said a plane carrying Huge Materia would be taking off from the airport above.
Dialogue: I just saw some Shinra soldiers all huddled together discussing something. They said a plane carrying Huge Materia would be taking off from the airport above.

Original: NPC: Listen Cloud, I'm over the hill, but Priscilla is still a child. Isn't there a way to protect at least her from Meteor?
Dialogue: Listen Cloud, I'm over the hill, but Priscilla is still a child. Isn't there a way to protect at least her from Meteor?

Original: Priscilla: Who are you---?
Dialogue: Who are you---?

Original: Priscilla: Cloud!! Stupid jerk! Look how much you made me worry!! Were you at the Lifestream?
Dialogue: Cloud!! Stupid jerk! Look how much you made me worry!! Were you at the Lifestream?

Original: Cloud: Yeah, that's right.
Dialogue: Yeah, that's right.

Original: Priscilla: You've gotta be more careful! Because you're going to marry me one day.
Dialogue: You've gotta be more careful! Because you're going to marry me one day.

Original: Priscilla: At least knock when you enter a lady's room!
Dialogue: At least knock when you enter a lady's room!

Original: Priscilla: Lifestream? Yeah, I know! It's Mr. Dolphin's playground. There's a Three-taloned island south of the continent. I heard the Lifestream runs below that island. But why are you asking about the Lifestream?
Dialogue: Lifestream? Yeah, I know! It's Mr. Dolphin's playground. There's a Three-taloned island south of the continent. I heard the Lifestream runs below that island. But why are you asking about the Lifestream?

Original: Tifa: Cloud fell into the Lifestream at the North Cave, and has been missing ever since.
Dialogue: Cloud fell into the Lifestream at the North Cave, and has been missing ever since.

Original: Priscilla: Huh, Cloud!? Hurry up and help him!! He's very important to me.
Dialogue: Huh, Cloud!? Hurry up and help him!! He's very important to me.

Original: Priscilla: There's a Three-taloned island south of the continent. I heard the Lifestream runs below that island.
Dialogue: There's a Three-taloned island south of the continent. I heard the Lifestream runs below that island.

Original: Cid: We found Cloud!
Dialogue: We found Cloud!

Original: Priscilla: I'm so happy!! Someday I'm going to be Cloud's wife.
Dialogue: I'm so happy!! Someday I'm going to be Cloud's wife.

Original: Priscilla: I've decided I'm gonna be Cloud's wife.
Dialogue: I've decided I'm gonna be Cloud's wife.

Original: NPC: Someday I'll get to use my special pose in a real battle!
Dialogue: Someday I'll get to use my special pose in a real battle!

Original: NPC: Same here!! I'll keep practicing until then!
Dialogue: Same here!! I'll keep practicing until then!

Original: NPC: Hey!! Civilian!! Stay out of our training!!
Dialogue: Hey!! Civilian!! Stay out of our training!!

Original: NPC: Go around them! And stay out of their way!!
Dialogue: Go around them! And stay out of their way!!

Original: NPC: Grrrrgh--- ---Grrrgh
Dialogue: Grrrrgh--- ---Grrrgh

Original: NPC: ZZZZZ......
Dialogue: ZZZZZ......

Original: NPC: This is a Respectable Inn... guests only!
Dialogue: This is a Respectable Inn... guests only!

Original: NPC: You should absorb all the wisdom until it is a part of you.
Dialogue: You should absorb all the wisdom until it is a part of you.

Original: NPC: Ok wise-guy, I'll ask about Materia just so you can let off some stress.
Dialogue: Ok wise-guy, I'll ask about Materia just so you can let off some stress.

Original: Cloud: You're right...
Dialogue: You're right...

Original: Cloud: First off, the main points. Some types of Materia, like Magic, grow as you use them. Some, like Summon Magic, grow from being used once a battle, to several times per battle. Their effectiveness changes too. ...There are all different kinds. Some types don't change, but they must grow in order to be divided. ...And that's it. Maybe that sounded too official.
Dialogue: First off, the main points. Some types of Materia, like Magic, grow as you use them. Some, like Summon Magic, grow from being used once a battle, to several times per battle. Their effectiveness changes too. ...There are all different kinds. Some types don't change, but they must grow in order to be divided. ...And that's it. Maybe that sounded too official.

Original: Cloud: Types of Materia... Here goes...!
Dialogue: Types of Materia... Here goes...!

Original: Cloud: There's no single way to combine Materia. So here goes the basics. Support Materia... The basic combination is Magic + All. The variety of magic you can cast will increase as your Magic Level increases. When your All level increases, so does the number of times you can use it in a battle. That about covers it.
Dialogue: There's no single way to combine Materia. So here goes the basics. Support Materia... The basic combination is Magic + All. The variety of magic you can cast will increase as your Magic Level increases. When your All level increases, so does the number of times you can use it in a battle. That about covers it.

Original: NPC: Huh? Wait a sec...
Dialogue: Huh? Wait a sec...

Original: Cloud: You can change between Magic-All and Magic with the L1/R1 buttons. I'll bet you've probably already done this. One effective combination is Elemental + Summon Materia. If you equip this combination to your weapon, you can put Magic and Summon Elementals on your weapon. For example, if you equip Fire + Elemental to your sword, you will end up with Fire Elemental Sword. I'm getting off the subject,... If you equip Fire + Elemental to your armor, it will have twice the resistance to fire damage. Now this is important. When the Elemental levels in your armor increase, so will their effectiveness. From half damage - no damage - absorb. If you combined Elemental and Fire you could develop Fire absorbing armor.
Dialogue: You can change between Magic-All and Magic with the L1/R1 buttons. I'll bet you've probably already done this. One effective combination is Elemental + Summon Materia. If you equip this combination to your weapon, you can put Magic and Summon Elementals on your weapon. For example, if you equip Fire + Elemental to your sword, you will end up with Fire Elemental Sword. I'm getting off the subject,... If you equip Fire + Elemental to your armor, it will have twice the resistance to fire damage. Now this is important. When the Elemental levels in your armor increase, so will their effectiveness. From half damage - no damage - absorb. If you combined Elemental and Fire you could develop Fire absorbing armor.

Original: Cloud: Wait, there's more. Next is the Added Effect for Support Materia. The Added Effect Materia grafts the effects of Compound Status Materia into your weapons and armor. For example, equip Added Effect + Poison to your weapon and select [Attack]. Sometimes you'll give a Poison status. Of course, it doesn't always work. If you don't combine the Added Effect Materia with Status Change Materia, like Confusion or Time, you won't get any effect. To learn more about Added Effect, access the menu and check the Status. It's a little hard to get, but if you take your time, you'll be all right.
Dialogue: Wait, there's more. Next is the Added Effect for Support Materia. The Added Effect Materia grafts the effects of Compound Status Materia into your weapons and armor. For example, equip Added Effect + Poison to your weapon and select [Attack]. Sometimes you'll give a Poison status. Of course, it doesn't always work. If you don't combine the Added Effect Materia with Status Change Materia, like Confusion or Time, you won't get any effect. To learn more about Added Effect, access the menu and check the Status. It's a little hard to get, but if you take your time, you'll be all right.

Original: Cloud: Division... I'm pretty good at this. People tell me that my personality is divided. But I don't think so, but maybe it is... Anyhow... Once your Materia reaches the maximum Level, it will divide. The original Materia will no longer grow. Once that happens, all you can do is use it as it is. New Materia always starts out with zero AP, so you need to raise its levels! Of course, once the new Materia reaches its max, it'll divide. That's how you increase your Materia collection. Ha, ha...... Right now I feel like I'm dividing myself.
Dialogue: Division... I'm pretty good at this. People tell me that my personality is divided. But I don't think so, but maybe it is... Anyhow... Once your Materia reaches the maximum Level, it will divide. The original Materia will no longer grow. Once that happens, all you can do is use it as it is. New Materia always starts out with zero AP, so you need to raise its levels! Of course, once the new Materia reaches its max, it'll divide. That's how you increase your Materia collection. Ha, ha...... Right now I feel like I'm dividing myself.

Original: Cloud: Once Materia starts dividing, you must be careful. There's a limit to how much Materia you can have. Since we're fighting for the life of the Planet, it goes against my beliefs carrying too much Materia. Either way, I don't really care, but...I'll leave it up to you. That's why, the amount of Materia that we can have is limited to 200... only what we can equip. When you have too much Materia, you need to dispose of some. If you don't, you can't take on any more. So, ditch some Materia before that happens... Ahem...I mean, give them back to the Planet.
Dialogue: Once Materia starts dividing, you must be careful. There's a limit to how much Materia you can have. Since we're fighting for the life of the Planet, it goes against my beliefs carrying too much Materia. Either way, I don't really care, but...I'll leave it up to you. That's why, the amount of Materia that we can have is limited to 200... only what we can equip. When you have too much Materia, you need to dispose of some. If you don't, you can't take on any more. So, ditch some Materia before that happens... Ahem...I mean, give them back to the Planet.

Original: NPC: Ok. Expert! Enlighten us on Limit Techniques, why doncha?
Dialogue: Ok. Expert! Enlighten us on Limit Techniques, why doncha?

Original: Cloud: I don't have too much to say about that...
Dialogue: I don't have too much to say about that...

Original: Cloud: There are 2 basic ways of building up your Limit techniques. First, just use them! And second is to finish off as many enemies as possible! It sounds easier than it is. Everyone knows that when you gain a new Limit technique, you need to select it in the menu. And you knew that you won't be able to use advanced techniques on each level if you haven't used the basic ones. Since the type and growth for each limit techniques is different, that's about all I will say.
Dialogue: There are 2 basic ways of building up your Limit techniques. First, just use them! And second is to finish off as many enemies as possible! It sounds easier than it is. Everyone knows that when you gain a new Limit technique, you need to select it in the menu. And you knew that you won't be able to use advanced techniques on each level if you haven't used the basic ones. Since the type and growth for each limit techniques is different, that's about all I will say.

Original: Cloud: A long time ago I heard extreme techniques exist within the Limit techniques. But, if that's true you wouldn't be able to get it in any normal way. That's about all I know about it.
Dialogue: A long time ago I heard extreme techniques exist within the Limit techniques. But, if that's true you wouldn't be able to get it in any normal way. That's about all I know about it.

Original: NPC: Ok, Mr. Know-it-all, ex-SOLDIER! Let me revenge...I mean, review!
Dialogue: Ok, Mr. Know-it-all, ex-SOLDIER! Let me revenge...I mean, review!

Original: Cloud: What do you want to review?
Dialogue: What do you want to review?

Original: Cloud: ATB means Active Time Battle. It's a system in which time continuously runs during battle. If the ATB is changed to [WAIT] in the Config Menu... Time stops during battle while you select magic or an item. That lets you select your commands carefully. It's geared especially for beginners like you. In config, if you change from ATB to [Recommended]... Time will stop while magic or item effects are displayed. This lets you watch the effects carefully. Letting you fight at your own pace... this is the way to go. I always use ACTIVE mode, but choose what you want. That's all.
Dialogue: ATB means Active Time Battle. It's a system in which time continuously runs during battle. If the ATB is changed to [WAIT] in the Config Menu... Time stops during battle while you select magic or an item. That lets you select your commands carefully. It's geared especially for beginners like you. In config, if you change from ATB to [Recommended]... Time will stop while magic or item effects are displayed. This lets you watch the effects carefully. Letting you fight at your own pace... this is the way to go. I always use ACTIVE mode, but choose what you want. That's all.

Original: Cloud: During a battle, white numbers that appear on the screen indicate damage, and green numbers indicate recovery points. Remember that, if you don't want to be wiped out.
Dialogue: During a battle, white numbers that appear on the screen indicate damage, and green numbers indicate recovery points. Remember that, if you don't want to be wiped out.

Original: Cloud: Change will change your fighting position to either the front or back row. If you select the back row, the amount of damage you receive is reduced, but so is your attacking power. [Change] can be selected from the battle menu by pushing the [left Directional button]. You can also select [Defend] from battle menu by pushing the Directional button to the right. Defend will reduce your damage by half until your next turn. It's better to use Defend for strong enemies. Of course, I don't need anything like that.
Dialogue: Change will change your fighting position to either the front or back row. If you select the back row, the amount of damage you receive is reduced, but so is your attacking power. [Change] can be selected from the battle menu by pushing the [left Directional button]. You can also select [Defend] from battle menu by pushing the Directional button to the right. Defend will reduce your damage by half until your next turn. It's better to use Defend for strong enemies. Of course, I don't need anything like that.

Original: Cloud: I don't know too much about Escape during battles since I never do it, but...someone like you might need it. You can escape by holding down the
Dialogue: I don't know too much about Escape during battles since I never do it, but...someone like you might need it. You can escape by holding down the

Original: Cloud: It might be hard to understand this next one since you can't check it right now, but just listen. I'm talking about the Gauges displayed during battle. Time Gauge shows the time remaining until your next turn during battle. You can enter a command once the Gauge is full, but if you don't want to enter a command, press the
Dialogue: It might be hard to understand this next one since you can't check it right now, but just listen. I'm talking about the Gauges displayed during battle. Time Gauge shows the time remaining until your next turn during battle. You can enter a command once the Gauge is full, but if you don't want to enter a command, press the

Original: Cloud: Status simply means the status of the characters. I don't want to repeat myself too much, so I'll mention the main points.
Dialogue: Status simply means the status of the characters. I don't want to repeat myself too much, so I'll mention the main points.

Original: Cloud: Phew...I'm tired. Changed Status can be changed with magic and items, so always double check it when you buy things.
Dialogue: Phew...I'm tired. Changed Status can be changed with magic and items, so always double check it when you buy things.

Original: Cloud: Elementals are special Elementals that come with magic and weapons. You have to use this to your advantage in battle. Only once you start thinking in terms of Elementals can you truly be called an intermediate player. Here are some examples. Remember, they're just examples. You don't have to memorize them.
Dialogue: Elementals are special Elementals that come with magic and weapons. You have to use this to your advantage in battle. Only once you start thinking in terms of Elementals can you truly be called an intermediate player. Here are some examples. Remember, they're just examples. You don't have to memorize them.

Original: Cloud: Using opposite Elementals often is effective in battle. Using the same Elementals usually increases Defense. But, the reverse is also true. Watch out for it. To find out what Elementals an enemy has, you need Sense Materia. Once you get it, try it out.
Dialogue: Using opposite Elementals often is effective in battle. Using the same Elementals usually increases Defense. But, the reverse is also true. Watch out for it. To find out what Elementals an enemy has, you need Sense Materia. Once you get it, try it out.

Original: Cloud: If you don't understand what I just told you, I guess you just have a limited capacity for information. But, relax. Push the [SELECT] Button during battle. A Help Message should explain the different commands to you. It'll tell you things like the monsters' names, even I look at it, sometimes... So don't be ashamed to use it.
Dialogue: If you don't understand what I just told you, I guess you just have a limited capacity for information. But, relax. Push the [SELECT] Button during battle. A Help Message should explain the different commands to you. It'll tell you things like the monsters' names, even I look at it, sometimes... So don't be ashamed to use it.

Original: NPC: This is the Beginner's Hall (Intermediate)! Your explanations were so complicated I couldn't return to the Planet. So, I have a right to ask you again.
Dialogue: This is the Beginner's Hall (Intermediate)! Your explanations were so complicated I couldn't return to the Planet. So, I have a right to ask you again.

Original: Cloud: What do you want to know?
Dialogue: What do you want to know?

Original: Cloud: For my explanation, I'll need a Potion.
Dialogue: For my explanation, I'll need a Potion.

Original: NPC: Man, ex-SOLDIER's sure are cheap. OK, I'll GIVE you a Potion...
Dialogue: Man, ex-SOLDIER's sure are cheap. OK, I'll GIVE you a Potion...

Original: NPC: I don't seem to have any on me. Why don't you go buy one?
Dialogue: I don't seem to have any on me. Why don't you go buy one?

Original: Cloud: I think you know the basics, but just in case... Do not open the PlayStation or change discs until instructed. If you open the Disc Cover, I can't guarantee anything. That is all.
Dialogue: I think you know the basics, but just in case... Do not open the PlayStation or change discs until instructed. If you open the Disc Cover, I can't guarantee anything. That is all.

Original: NPC: How 'bout a ship taxi? Only in Junon! Free to Air Force personnel!
Dialogue: How 'bout a ship taxi? Only in Junon! Free to Air Force personnel!

Original: NPC: Roger!! Hey! Taxi!!
Dialogue: Roger!! Hey! Taxi!!

Original: NPC: Where to?
Dialogue: Where to?

Original: NPC: Right! The next town it is!!
Dialogue: Right! The next town it is!!

Original: NPC: Thanks!!
Dialogue: Thanks!!

Original: NPC: Then outside Junon it is! Take care!!
Dialogue: Then outside Junon it is! Take care!!

Original: NPC: Just holler whenever you want a ride! If you get sick easily, maybe you'd better not go.
Dialogue: Just holler whenever you want a ride! If you get sick easily, maybe you'd better not go.

Original: NPC: Hey!! Stay out of the way!
Dialogue: Hey!! Stay out of the way!

Original: NPC: Enjoy your stay.
Dialogue: Enjoy your stay.

Original: NPC: Good morning! You still seem a little sleepy. Looking forward to seeing you again.
Dialogue: Good morning! You still seem a little sleepy. Looking forward to seeing you again.

Original: NPC: Aw, knock it off already! You don't have enough moolah! No, you 'forget it'!
Dialogue: Aw, knock it off already! You don't have enough moolah! No, you 'forget it'!

Original: NPC: Come again.
Dialogue: Come again.

Original: NPC: Please! Come in...
Dialogue: Please! Come in...

Original: NPC: Welcome!
Dialogue: Welcome!

Original: NPC: I won't charge you for a smile...
Dialogue: I won't charge you for a smile...

Original: NPC: Buy a lot, cutie!
Dialogue: Buy a lot, cutie!

Original: NPC: Please go to the counter.
Dialogue: Please go to the counter.

Original: NPC: Thank you very much!
Dialogue: Thank you very much!

Original: NPC: ...gulp... Going do---wn.
Dialogue: ...gulp... Going do---wn.

Original: NPC: This floor is the Submarine Dock... Those of you visiting the Underwater Reactor, please proceed through the connecting tunnel.
Dialogue: This floor is the Submarine Dock... Those of you visiting the Underwater Reactor, please proceed through the connecting tunnel.

Original: NPC: ...gulp... Going u---p.
Dialogue: ...gulp... Going u---p.

Original: NPC: Returning to Junon.
Dialogue: Returning to Junon.

Original: NPC: ...gulp... We're here...
Dialogue: ...gulp... We're here...

Original: NPC: A new version of submarine. I'll be sailing on it. Man, I can't wait!
Dialogue: A new version of submarine. I'll be sailing on it. Man, I can't wait!

Original: NPC: Man...... It's so boring keeping watch at the Underwater Reactor.
Dialogue: Man...... It's so boring keeping watch at the Underwater Reactor.

Original: NPC: All I wanted was to become a pilot! It used to leave me speechless watching the Highwind in the sunset!
Dialogue: All I wanted was to become a pilot! It used to leave me speechless watching the Highwind in the sunset!

Original: NPC 1: Ever since I was late to that parade, they've been on my back everyday with basic training. I can't handle it anymore!
Dialogue: Ever since I was late to that parade, they've been on my back everyday with basic training. I can't handle it anymore!

Original: NPC 2: Hey! Stop yappin'!
Dialogue: Hey! Stop yappin'!

Original: NPC: Hmm? A know-it-all, huh? All right!! Come in!!
Dialogue: Hmm? A know-it-all, huh? All right!! Come in!!

Original: NPC: Ugh...My eyes are tired... No, this is the time for me to really buckle down! Until I become SOLDIER First Class.
Dialogue: Ugh...My eyes are tired... No, this is the time for me to really buckle down! Until I become SOLDIER First Class.

Original: NPC: Oh, welcome!
Dialogue: Oh, welcome!

Original: NPC: I've got nothing to sell to you! Come back later!
Dialogue: I've got nothing to sell to you! Come back later!

Original: NPC: Hey! Yo! You want weapons?
