Dialogue: Hey! Yo! You want weapons?

Original: NPC: Hey! Yo! Our weapons are the best!
Dialogue: Hey! Yo! Our weapons are the best!

Original: NPC: Hey! Yo! Would you like to buy the whole store?
Dialogue: Hey! Yo! Would you like to buy the whole store?

Original: NPC: I'm sorry! It's all rented out today!
Dialogue: I'm sorry! It's all rented out today!

Original: NPC: Looks like something's going on outside, but we're too smashed to do anything...
Dialogue: Looks like something's going on outside, but we're too smashed to do anything...

Original: NPC: Ooh, oohh... Oh man, my head's burning up...
Dialogue: Ooh, oohh... Oh man, my head's burning up...

Original: NPC: Seems like you're all a little too young to be in here.
Dialogue: Seems like you're all a little too young to be in here.

Original: NPC: Seaweed... Seaweed...
Dialogue: Seaweed... Seaweed...

Original: NPC: It just isn't a party without Rude!
Dialogue: It just isn't a party without Rude!

Original: NPC: Welcome! I was just starting to get worried... You see our sales were pretty bad today.
Dialogue: Welcome! I was just starting to get worried... You see our sales were pretty bad today.

Original: NPC: Only authorized personnel are allowed past this point!
Dialogue: Only authorized personnel are allowed past this point!

Original: NPC: You know too, right? About Junon Navy's important classified information. A new submarine has almost been completed using Shinra's top technology.
Dialogue: You know too, right? About Junon Navy's important classified information. A new submarine has almost been completed using Shinra's top technology.

Original: NPC: Oh! Welcome! We don't have anything special now. I kind of messed up the last time I ordered but feel free to look around!
Dialogue: Oh! Welcome! We don't have anything special now. I kind of messed up the last time I ordered but feel free to look around!

Original: NPC: Welcome to 'Inn'd of the line' in Junon. Wait, I shouldn't be sayin' stuff like that. Wanna spend the night?
Dialogue: Welcome to 'Inn'd of the line' in Junon. Wait, I shouldn't be sayin' stuff like that. Wanna spend the night?

Original: NPC: These barracks are for soldiers. This is no place for civilians.
Dialogue: These barracks are for soldiers. This is no place for civilians.

Original: Shinra manager: It's so shameful! ...and they told me that I would be staying at five star hotels on these trips...
Dialogue: It's so shameful! ...and they told me that I would be staying at five star hotels on these trips...

Original: Shinra manager: How can you guys sleep in a place like this?
Dialogue: How can you guys sleep in a place like this?

Original: NPC: There're lots of stores in Junon. If we don't do this...we can't compete. But, what bothers me is that the girls make more than me.
Dialogue: There're lots of stores in Junon. If we don't do this...we can't compete. But, what bothers me is that the girls make more than me.

Original: NPC: I used to be in SOLDIER... Once I left, I opened up this shop... But to tell you the truth, I'd rather be at the shop downstairs.
Dialogue: I used to be in SOLDIER... Once I left, I opened up this shop... But to tell you the truth, I'd rather be at the shop downstairs.

Original: NPC: Mommy... My mommy...
Dialogue: Mommy... My mommy...

Original: NPC: I'm a good lookin' man once I take my uniform off.
Dialogue: I'm a good lookin' man once I take my uniform off.

Original: NPC: Booze, booze! Ain't nothing like booze during working hours.
Dialogue: Booze, booze! Ain't nothing like booze during working hours.

Original: NPC: I'm sorry. The bar is only for Shinra employees.
Dialogue: I'm sorry. The bar is only for Shinra employees.

Original: NPC: Lately it seems like the economy's been better. Must be the 'Rufus' effect. Cargo ships are always coming and going from Costa del Sol. Now I'll overlook the fact that you're a stowaway, but you better at least help with the cargo.
Dialogue: Lately it seems like the economy's been better. Must be the 'Rufus' effect. Cargo ships are always coming and going from Costa del Sol. Now I'll overlook the fact that you're a stowaway, but you better at least help with the cargo.

Original: NPC: It's kinda lonely at the airport without the Highwind, isn't it? I miss that bikini girl on the side of the plane.
Dialogue: It's kinda lonely at the airport without the Highwind, isn't it? I miss that bikini girl on the side of the plane.

Original: NPC: Right now the Shinra's using it to gather the Huge Materia from the Corel Reactor and from the Fort Condor Reactor. The Gelnika's flying all over the place! The only one that's not busy, is probably me!
Dialogue: Right now the Shinra's using it to gather the Huge Materia from the Corel Reactor and from the Fort Condor Reactor. The Gelnika's flying all over the place! The only one that's not busy, is probably me!

Original: NPC: The Shinra's collecting Huge Materia at the Junon Undersea Reactor! When they're done, they'll bring it to this airport. Get out of here before you get in the way!
Dialogue: The Shinra's collecting Huge Materia at the Junon Undersea Reactor! When they're done, they'll bring it to this airport. Get out of here before you get in the way!

Original: NPC: What...me? I'm gonna be watching from here, so that I don't get in their way either!
Dialogue: What...me? I'm gonna be watching from here, so that I don't get in their way either!

Original: NPC: Finished loading the Huge Materia! All we have to do now is to ready the cargo ship, 'Gelnika', for departure and we're done!
Dialogue: Finished loading the Huge Materia! All we have to do now is to ready the cargo ship, 'Gelnika', for departure and we're done!

Original: NPC: I'm glad we got Gelnika to the Rocket Town safely. But they sure think big. Looks like they're going to use the Huge Materia's to break up Meteor...
Dialogue: I'm glad we got Gelnika to the Rocket Town safely. But they sure think big. Looks like they're going to use the Huge Materia's to break up Meteor...

Original: NPC: The Shinra Army's gathered at Midgar. Now it's just a matter of time Sephiroth's dead.
Dialogue: The Shinra Army's gathered at Midgar. Now it's just a matter of time Sephiroth's dead.

Original: NPC:What...me? I don't mind. I'll just wait here. My life is important to me.
Dialogue: What...me? I don't mind. I'll just wait here. My life is important to me.

Original: NPC: I finally got orders to join the Great Sephiroth Plan. I even get to go on the Gelnika too...
Dialogue: I finally got orders to join the Great Sephiroth Plan. I even get to go on the Gelnika too...

Original: NPC: But, I'm just gonna ignore them. I wanna live to see the end of the world. If I'm lucky... There'll be a good place for me in the New World.
Dialogue: But, I'm just gonna ignore them. I wanna live to see the end of the world. If I'm lucky... There'll be a good place for me in the New World.

Original: NPC: Doesn't it bother you? Flying around knowing that you could die at any moment? If that's the case, might as well live on the edge, I say. But before I can do that, I gotta get a license first.
Dialogue: Doesn't it bother you? Flying around knowing that you could die at any moment? If that's the case, might as well live on the edge, I say. But before I can do that, I gotta get a license first.

Original: NPC 1: I sure was frightened when Weapon attacked. It gives me the chills knowing there's still two of them left.
Dialogue: I sure was frightened when Weapon attacked. It gives me the chills knowing there's still two of them left.

Original: NPC 2: Oh yeah? Well, I'm ready to fight the worst enemy mankind's ever had like a real warrior. It's not everyday you get to fight in an inter-planetary war.
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Well, I'm ready to fight the worst enemy mankind's ever had like a real warrior. It's not everyday you get to fight in an inter-planetary war.

Original: NPC 1: The President is gathering up all the Huge Materia on the planet. He wants to shoot it at Meteor in the rocket.
Dialogue: The President is gathering up all the Huge Materia on the planet. He wants to shoot it at Meteor in the rocket.

Original: NPC 2: President Rufus is different from the older generation. He'll protect the planet with all of the technology Shinra currently has.
Dialogue: President Rufus is different from the older generation. He'll protect the planet with all of the technology Shinra currently has.

Original: NPC 1: Protect? No, I don't think so. The President isn't the type to do anything so heroic. It's all just a game--a question of winning or losing--to him...
Dialogue: Protect? No, I don't think so. The President isn't the type to do anything so heroic. It's all just a game--a question of winning or losing--to him...

Original: NPC 1: After they get it, they'll take it to the airport and will transport it to Rocket Town by Gelnika. Don't let your guard down!
Dialogue: After they get it, they'll take it to the airport and will transport it to Rocket Town by Gelnika. Don't let your guard down!

Original: NPC 2: They've finally started collecting the Huge Materia from the Junon Underwater Reactor.
Dialogue: They've finally started collecting the Huge Materia from the Junon Underwater Reactor.

Original: NPC 1: Whew...I hope everything goes all right until we get to Rocket Town. Then, our mission is nearly complete.
Dialogue: Whew...I hope everything goes all right until we get to Rocket Town. Then, our mission is nearly complete.

Original: NPC 2: Not so fast. We still have one major task... we still have to transport the stuff...
Dialogue: Not so fast. We still have one major task... we still have to transport the stuff...

Original: NPC 1: The stuff...
Dialogue: The stuff...

Original: NPC: Come on in!
Dialogue: Come on in!

Original: NPC: Our forces are in the process of gathering the Huge Materia from the Corel and the Fort Condor Reactors! Once these two missions are completed, the Underwater Reactor will be our next target! Till then, we do nothing but train, train, train!
Dialogue: Our forces are in the process of gathering the Huge Materia from the Corel and the Fort Condor Reactors! Once these two missions are completed, the Underwater Reactor will be our next target! Till then, we do nothing but train, train, train!

Original: NPC 1: I'm starting to feel like I can't stop anymore. I've been had!! I want to get in a real battle, too!
Dialogue: I'm starting to feel like I can't stop anymore. I've been had!! I want to get in a real battle, too!

Original: NPC 2: Hey! Stop yappin'!
Dialogue: Hey! Stop yappin'!

Original: NPC: Hmmm? You have no right to enter!
Dialogue: Hmmm? You have no right to enter!

Original: NPC: Hmmm? Back again, Mr. Know-it-all!? All right! You can enter!!
Dialogue: Hmmm? Back again, Mr. Know-it-all!? All right! You can enter!!

Original: NPC: I lost most of my rivals in the attack on Weapon. Oh, of course, I was here, studying. And the coveted green officer's uniform is almost in my reach.
Dialogue: I lost most of my rivals in the attack on Weapon. Oh, of course, I was here, studying. And the coveted green officer's uniform is almost in my reach.

Original: NPC: After that, I'll get on the newspapers as a plain clothed First Class officer in SOLDIER... A triumphant return to my homeland!! Tons of fan letters... My future's peachy!
Dialogue: After that, I'll get on the newspapers as a plain clothed First Class officer in SOLDIER... A triumphant return to my homeland!! Tons of fan letters... My future's peachy!

Original: NPC: Everyday there's no ship coming in, I always come here to watch the sun go down. The sun disappears almost like it's swallowed up in the big horizon. And somewhere out there is a big unknown continent with another port city. Twilight always gets me misty... I'm so glad I became a seaman.
Dialogue: Everyday there's no ship coming in, I always come here to watch the sun go down. The sun disappears almost like it's swallowed up in the big horizon. And somewhere out there is a big unknown continent with another port city. Twilight always gets me misty... I'm so glad I became a seaman.

Original: NPC: Well...I wouldn't have time for one now anyway because of that Weapon thing...
Dialogue: Well...I wouldn't have time for one now anyway because of that Weapon thing...

Original: NPC: I haven't had a girl friend in 18 years. And I'm a romantic!......phew.
Dialogue: I haven't had a girl friend in 18 years. And I'm a romantic!......phew.

Original: NPC: They're not going to get me down! Not me!! Weapon, Meteor, even bad customers, aren't going to get me!
Dialogue: They're not going to get me down! Not me!! Weapon, Meteor, even bad customers, aren't going to get me!

Original: NPC: This machine hasn't been working right ever since Weapon got to it!
Dialogue: This machine hasn't been working right ever since Weapon got to it!

Original: NPC: I'd like to close down this shop, but we got the regulars to think about... I don't know what to do......
Dialogue: I'd like to close down this shop, but we got the regulars to think about... I don't know what to do......

Original: NPC: Weapon and Meteor scared everyone else off, but I'm sittin' here soused as usual.
Dialogue: Weapon and Meteor scared everyone else off, but I'm sittin' here soused as usual.

Original: NPC: Welcome!! I just can't believe it. I never thought a monster like Weapon really existed.
Dialogue: Welcome!! I just can't believe it. I never thought a monster like Weapon really existed.

Original: NPC: Weapon was really something. Nothing can compare with his strength, but with a selection like this, our weapons'll win.
Dialogue: Weapon was really something. Nothing can compare with his strength, but with a selection like this, our weapons'll win.

Original: NPC: Our rates are the same as the 1st class hotels. Would you like to stay?
Dialogue: Our rates are the same as the 1st class hotels. Would you like to stay?

Original: NPC: All the real soldiers were killed fighting Weapon. It may seem ironic that losers like me are still alive. But that's the reality of it.
Dialogue: All the real soldiers were killed fighting Weapon. It may seem ironic that losers like me are still alive. But that's the reality of it.

Original: NPC: I'm learning to be a delinquent soldier!! I just can't seem to get the hang of it! It just isn't going right!!
Dialogue: I'm learning to be a delinquent soldier!! I just can't seem to get the hang of it! It just isn't going right!!

Original: Shinra manager: I only came to help with the transporting of Junon's Huge Cannon, Sister Ray, but... Now the company tells me not to bother coming back... What's being a Shinra employee all about...?
Dialogue: I only came to help with the transporting of Junon's Huge Cannon, Sister Ray, but... Now the company tells me not to bother coming back... What's being a Shinra employee all about...?

Original: Shinra manager: Yeeeeee...... If Weapon killed all the upper management... then I'll be President...!!
Dialogue: Yeeeeee...... If Weapon killed all the upper management... then I'll be President...!!

Original: NPC: Look, why not forget about Meteor and Weapon for now and do a little impulse shopping!?
Dialogue: Look, why not forget about Meteor and Weapon for now and do a little impulse shopping!?

Original: NPC: Why don't you surround yourself with young girls and have some fun...maybe for the last time.
Dialogue: Why don't you surround yourself with young girls and have some fun...maybe for the last time.

Original: NPC: I hired more girls after hearing that the world's coming to an end, but I wonder if I made a mistake. I keep getting more and more in debt. I've got to get out from under it somehow. Maybe I'll have Weapon help me.
Dialogue: I hired more girls after hearing that the world's coming to an end, but I wonder if I made a mistake. I keep getting more and more in debt. I've got to get out from under it somehow. Maybe I'll have Weapon help me.

Original: NPC: I used to be in SOLDIER. Recently, I've felt like dressing up like this... I don't know why, it's out of season, but...
Dialogue: I used to be in SOLDIER. Recently, I've felt like dressing up like this... I don't know why, it's out of season, but...

Original: NPC: I'm sorry. I've decided to close this place down. All my regular customers were killed by Weapon. Everyone was pretty weird, but I got a lot of memories of them.
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I've decided to close this place down. All my regular customers were killed by Weapon. Everyone was pretty weird, but I got a lot of memories of them.

Original: NPC: Welcome to Bar del Sol! Here's to tropical nights!
Dialogue: Welcome to Bar del Sol! Here's to tropical nights!

Original: NPC: Hmm... Is this some kind of joke?
Dialogue: Hmm... Is this some kind of joke?

Original: NPC: 'Praise the Lord,' it's a miracle!! Who'd ever think someone with some real money would ever come here......
Dialogue: Praise the Lord,' it's a miracle!! Who'd ever think someone with some real money would ever come here......

Original: NPC: I probably shouldn't even ask, but Are you really going to buy it?
Dialogue: I probably shouldn't even ask, but Are you really going to buy it?

Original: On-screen: Bought "Villa Cloud"!
Dialogue: Bought "Villa Cloud"!

Original: NPC: Hmm, good-bye!! Good-bye fluffy bed!!
Dialogue: Hmm, good-bye!! Good-bye fluffy bed!!

Original: NPC: Oh well I'm kind of glad!
Dialogue: Oh well I'm kind of glad!

Original: Cloud: This is MY villa.
Dialogue: This is MY villa.

Original: On-screen: Rest up in your new villa?
Dialogue: Rest up in your new villa?

Original: NPC: ...SNORE...SNORE...
Dialogue: ...SNORE...SNORE...

Original: NPC: Geez my lower back's killing me!
Dialogue: Geez my lower back's killing me!

Original: NPC: Y, yes...sir!! How do you do! I'm the Manager. Nice to meet you. Well, if you'll pardon me, I'll be leaving. Good-night.
Dialogue: Y, yes...sir!! How do you do! I'm the Manager. Nice to meet you. Well, if you'll pardon me, I'll be leaving. Good-night.

Original: NPC: ...SNORE...SNORE...
Dialogue: ...SNORE...SNORE...

Original: (Upon taking the items on the ground.)NPC: Y, yes...sir!!
Dialogue: Y, yes...sir!!

Original: NPC: Oh, those items are free, so please help yourself.
Dialogue: Oh, those items are free, so please help yourself.

Original: NPC: You're stowaways, right? It's okay. I'm used to them. The truth is, before I worked here, I was one of the best.
Dialogue: You're stowaways, right? It's okay. I'm used to them. The truth is, before I worked here, I was one of the best.

Original: NPC: Costa del Sol...a harbor paradise where the sun always shines and it's summer all year round! Hmm......Things aren't going well...... You can go sightseeing in the city.
Dialogue: Costa del Sol...a harbor paradise where the sun always shines and it's summer all year round! Hmm......Things aren't going well...... You can go sightseeing in the city.

Original: NPC: Damn. I'm soaking wet down to my underwear.
Dialogue: Damn. I'm soaking wet down to my underwear.

Original: NPC: Oops! You must be those AVALANCHE guys! Quick! Let's get outta here! Heidegger's in charge of the transport ship. That's tough for both of us.
Dialogue: Oops! You must be those AVALANCHE guys! Quick! Let's get outta here! Heidegger's in charge of the transport ship. That's tough for both of us.

Original: NPC: The transport ship won't be sailing for a quite a while. Heidegger's orders.
Dialogue: The transport ship won't be sailing for a quite a while. Heidegger's orders.

Original: NPC: Thinking of being stowaways? It's 100 gil to Junon. Give it to me, and I'll put in a good word with the captain. What'll we do?
Dialogue: Thinking of being stowaways? It's 100 gil to Junon. Give it to me, and I'll put in a good word with the captain. What'll we do?

Original: NPC: Okay. Come on. This way.
Dialogue: Okay. Come on. This way.

Original: NPC: It's not the most pleasant ride but make the best of it.
Dialogue: It's not the most pleasant ride but make the best of it.

Original: NPC: Hey! No money? And you're trying to stowaway? Don't make me laugh!
Dialogue: Hey! No money? And you're trying to stowaway? Don't make me laugh!

Original: NPC: Thank you. Come back any time you want to stowaway on our ship.
Dialogue: Thank you. Come back any time you want to stowaway on our ship.

Original: NPC: Don't bug me. This is Rufus's first official visit since becoming President. It seems like he's here on business this time. I'm so jealous of him, I could spit. We're both about the same age, but, he's President.
Dialogue: Don't bug me. This is Rufus's first official visit since becoming President. It seems like he's here on business this time. I'm so jealous of him, I could spit. We're both about the same age, but, he's President.

Original: NPC: Rufus complimented me on my job! Wow!! I guess it pays to do good work.
Dialogue: Rufus complimented me on my job! Wow!! I guess it pays to do good work.

Original: NPC: Oh crap... The manager of Shinra won't come down. Even though the President's here on business. All he does is play, forgetting everything to do with work.
Dialogue: Oh crap... The manager of Shinra won't come down. Even though the President's here on business. All he does is play, forgetting everything to do with work.

Original: NPC: But a bunch of hardworking deckhands like you wouldn't understand. On the marine blue sea, Gazing at the eternal skies that seem to go on forever... Gives you the feeling like you're taking a nap on the wing of a Cessna. It's the ultimate high!
Dialogue: But a bunch of hardworking deckhands like you wouldn't understand. On the marine blue sea, Gazing at the eternal skies that seem to go on forever... Gives you the feeling like you're taking a nap on the wing of a Cessna. It's the ultimate high!

Original: NPC: He's quite handsome, isn't he?...... Oh, don't worry, I'm not talking about you. I'm talking about President Rufus. Charming, rich, blond... He even looks good in a double-breasted suit.
Dialogue: He's quite handsome, isn't he?...... Oh, don't worry, I'm not talking about you. I'm talking about President Rufus. Charming, rich, blond... He even looks good in a double-breasted suit.

Original: NPC: Today's a great day for a nap in the sun. It always puts me in a good mood!
Dialogue: Today's a great day for a nap in the sun. It always puts me in a good mood!

Original: NPC: Heh, heh... I hear the Shinra brass are arriving soon. Heh, heh...! Got nothing to do with us, does it?
Dialogue: Heh, heh... I hear the Shinra brass are arriving soon. Heh, heh...! Got nothing to do with us, does it?

Original: NPC: Hey! Spread out, all of you, out!! Put any fingerprints, scratches, or dents on that plane and I'll put one in your head!
Dialogue: Hey! Spread out, all of you, out!! Put any fingerprints, scratches, or dents on that plane and I'll put one in your head!

Original: NPC: Da plane, da plane!! This's something you'll never be able to do in your lifetime. So you just watch from a distance... and wish.
Dialogue: Da plane, da plane!! This's something you'll never be able to do in your lifetime. So you just watch from a distance... and wish.

Original: NPC: Hey, who're you?. You look like you've been around the world twice. I don't know what your story is, but hang in there.
Dialogue: Hey, who're you?. You look like you've been around the world twice. I don't know what your story is, but hang in there.

Original: Shinra manager: Oh, oh, oh!!! I'm gonna quit this company!! I mean it, I'm really gonna quit!!
Dialogue: Oh, oh, oh!!! I'm gonna quit this company!! I mean it, I'm really gonna quit!!

Original: Shinra manager: Heidegger's such an idiot!! And Rufus, acting all big!!
Dialogue: Heidegger's such an idiot!! And Rufus, acting all big!!

Original: Shinra manager: God, that sure felt good...
Dialogue: God, that sure felt good...

Original: NPC: Say, aren't you bored?
Dialogue: Say, aren't you bored?

Original: NPC: Oh, really? I'm a little bored. Come on, back to work now!
Dialogue: Oh, really? I'm a little bored. Come on, back to work now!

Original: NPC: Isn't that good? You're just expecting too much.
Dialogue: Isn't that good? You're just expecting too much.

Original: NPC: Here you are! The Costa del Sol tourist information guide. What do you want to know?
Dialogue: Here you are! The Costa del Sol tourist information guide. What do you want to know?

Original: NPC: Let's see. I recommend a resort located on the outskirts of the city.
Dialogue: Let's see. I recommend a resort located on the outskirts of the city.

Original: NPC: If you're looking for souvenirs, we recommend Butch's.
Dialogue: If you're looking for souvenirs, we recommend Butch's.

Original: NPC: Wait a minute. I'm going to look at my guidebook. It says, Costa del Sol is the gateway to the West. And has a prominent world renown resort, which has been around for ages.
Dialogue: Wait a minute. I'm going to look at my guidebook. It says, Costa del Sol is the gateway to the West. And has a prominent world renown resort, which has been around for ages.

Original: NPC: Come on! I don't care about that! If you want a good time, come to the beach! There are lots of beautiful women. You wouldn't happen to be...rich?
Dialogue: Come on! I don't care about that! If you want a good time, come to the beach! There are lots of beautiful women. You wouldn't happen to be...rich?

Original: NPC: You're kidding! You can't tell just by looking. But I'll tell you just in case. After relaxing at Costa del Sol, stop by the Gold Saucer. It's a rich and exciting place to play!
Dialogue: You're kidding! You can't tell just by looking. But I'll tell you just in case. After relaxing at Costa del Sol, stop by the Gold Saucer. It's a rich and exciting place to play!

Original: NPC: I thought so. Are you interested? This is the road to Gold Saucer.
Dialogue: I thought so. Are you interested? This is the road to Gold Saucer.

Original: NPC: Head south to the Gold Saucer, and you'll find casinos and an amusement park. But if you're planning to walk, you'll have to cross mountains and valleys. I wouldn't recommend it. But if you're on a vacation, you should go there at least once.
Dialogue: Head south to the Gold Saucer, and you'll find casinos and an amusement park. But if you're planning to walk, you'll have to cross mountains and valleys. I wouldn't recommend it. But if you're on a vacation, you should go there at least once.

Original: NPC: 1, 2, 3, here we go!
Dialogue: 1, 2, 3, here we go!

Original: NPC: I heard. That big dog talks like a human. That's cool ...but it's weird.
Dialogue: I heard. That big dog talks like a human. That's cool ...but it's weird.

Original: NPC: It's the ocean. A creepy man was signaling for us to come. I was scared to come here!
Dialogue: It's the ocean. A creepy man was signaling for us to come. I was scared to come here!

Original: NPC: It hurts when you kick me with your bare feet!
Dialogue: It hurts when you kick me with your bare feet!

Original: NPC 1: Shall we play our hand around here?
Dialogue: Shall we play our hand around here?

Original: NPC 2: Not yet. Remember, no compromises.
Dialogue: Not yet. Remember, no compromises.

Original: NPC 1: You're right. After all, this trip was expensive.
Dialogue: You're right. After all, this trip was expensive.

Original: NPC 2: But only your average Joes are trying to pick us up.
Dialogue: But only your average Joes are trying to pick us up.

Original: NPC 1: Well, that's because we're just too beautiful and hard to approach.
Dialogue: Well, that's because we're just too beautiful and hard to approach.

Original: NPC 2: I guess so. Well, I envy the plain Janes.
Dialogue: I guess so. Well, I envy the plain Janes.

Original: NPC 1: Why don't we compromise? We'll make do with what we have.
Dialogue: Why don't we compromise? We'll make do with what we have.

Original: NPC 1: Why's that!?
Dialogue: Why's that!?

Original: NPC 2: Not yet!!
Dialogue: Not yet!!

Original: NPC 1: Eaghhh!
Dialogue: Eaghhh!

Original: NPC 2: It's your fault!
Dialogue: It's your fault!

Original: NPC 1: What's wrong with you!?
Dialogue: What's wrong with you!?

Original: NPC 2: You wanna go!?
Dialogue: You wanna go!?

Original: NPC 1: Whew!!!
Dialogue: Whew!!!

Original: NPC 1: A man......
Dialogue: A man......

Original: NPC 2: A good-looking man......
Dialogue: A good-looking man......

Original: NPC 1: Where......
Dialogue: Where......

Original: NPC 2: Ho! Ho! Ho......
Dialogue: Ho! Ho! Ho......

Original: NPC 1: Yipes!!
Dialogue: Yipes!!

Original: NPC 2: Grrrr......
Dialogue: Grrrr......

Original: NPC 1: ...pant...wheeze!......
Dialogue: ...pant...wheeze!......

Original: NPC: How about a 'Soft' as a memento of this wonderful trip? Made especially in Costa del Sol!
Dialogue: How about a 'Soft' as a memento of this wonderful trip? Made especially in Costa del Sol!

Original: Butch: Yeah, I'd like to hire a gorgeous chick and have a great time.
Dialogue: Yeah, I'd like to hire a gorgeous chick and have a great time.

Original: Butch: Well, we're lucky to have that cutie working for us part-time.
Dialogue: Well, we're lucky to have that cutie working for us part-time.

Original: Butch: You got me there...... We just hired her part-time. She ran off with our money and Materia. I guess a situation that's too good to be true, usually is.
Dialogue: You got me there...... We just hired her part-time. She ran off with our money and Materia. I guess a situation that's too good to be true, usually is.

Original: Butch: Well, please feel free to browse around. Just don't mind looking at what's left.
Dialogue: Well, please feel free to browse around. Just don't mind looking at what's left.

Original: NPC: Yeah, snowboarding's what's happening this year. I'm sick of surfing.
Dialogue: Yeah, snowboarding's what's happening this year. I'm sick of surfing.

Original: NPC: We look like great surfers... Only because we don't have any clothes other than these swim trunks.
Dialogue: We look like great surfers... Only because we don't have any clothes other than these swim trunks.

Original: NPC: We're all headin' over to Gold Saucer now. We're gonna make a ton of money at the Chocobo races. Then we're gonna take a trip to Icicle Inn and snowboard.
Dialogue: We're all headin' over to Gold Saucer now. We're gonna make a ton of money at the Chocobo races. Then we're gonna take a trip to Icicle Inn and snowboard.

Original: NPC: I traveled around a long time... And this town has the most beautiful ocean I've ever seen. Sometimes you can't realize it when it's right in front of you. I guess I took it for granted because it's so close, and I was so used to seeing it all the time. That's the reason I found my way back here.
Dialogue: I traveled around a long time... And this town has the most beautiful ocean I've ever seen. Sometimes you can't realize it when it's right in front of you. I guess I took it for granted because it's so close, and I was so used to seeing it all the time. That's the reason I found my way back here.

Original: NPC: Come on...please. If you don't buy from me... I can't make ends meet.
Dialogue: Come on...please. If you don't buy from me... I can't make ends meet.

Original: Mukki: I really like this town. You could walk around nearly naked, and no one'd look twice at you.
Dialogue: I really like this town. You could walk around nearly naked, and no one'd look twice at you.

Original: NPC: ......HIC... Mm? Wanna order? We're outta that now.
Dialogue: ......HIC... Mm? Wanna order? We're outta that now.

Original: NPC: ...huff...puff... I can't stand hot places...
Dialogue: ...huff...puff... I can't stand hot places...

Original: NPC: You want drink? Iz ok. You take time.
Dialogue: You want drink? Iz ok. You take time.

Original: NPC: Hey! I thought you'd drop by. (That's 1, 2...4 fishes all together...... not bad.)
Dialogue: Hey! I thought you'd drop by. (That's 1, 2...4 fishes all together...... not bad.)

Original: Johnny: mumble...mumble... (Tifa, promise me you're gonna be happy.)
Dialogue: mumble...mumble... (Tifa, promise me you're gonna be happy.)

Original: Johnny: Heh, heh, heh!...... My woman and me are getting along pretty good. But I'm such a pitiful waste......
Dialogue: Heh, heh, heh!...... My woman and me are getting along pretty good. But I'm such a pitiful waste......

Original: Johnny: ...sigh......I'm not good enough for her. What I should do?
Dialogue: ...sigh......I'm not good enough for her. What I should do?

Original: NPC: What a fluffy bed...... feels so great......
Dialogue: What a fluffy bed...... feels so great......

Original: NPC: Mmm... Just a little longer......
Dialogue: Mmm... Just a little longer......

Original: NPC: Oh!!
Dialogue: Oh!!

Original: NPC: Oh, I'm sorry...... I didn't know you were here. This is embarrassing. Take your time and look around.
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry...... I didn't know you were here. This is embarrassing. Take your time and look around.

Original: NPC: By the way, are you seriously considering buying?
Dialogue: By the way, are you seriously considering buying?

Original: Cloud: What are you selling?
Dialogue: What are you selling?

Original: NPC: That's pretty low. Are you pulling my leg?
Dialogue: That's pretty low. Are you pulling my leg?

Original: NPC: I'm talking about this house. This villa used to belong to President Shinra. It only recently came back on the market. How do you like it? It has a large lot, comes fully furnished with this goose-down bed, and there's even a basement to boot. The villagers call it the Shinra Villa. Of course, we're not giving it away...
Dialogue: I'm talking about this house. This villa used to belong to President Shinra. It only recently came back on the market. How do you like it? It has a large lot, comes fully furnished with this goose-down bed, and there's even a basement to boot. The villagers call it the Shinra Villa. Of course, we're not giving it away...

Original: NPC: Wha? How do you plan to buy it without a dime on you?
Dialogue: Wha? How do you plan to buy it without a dime on you?

Original: NPC: Well, I'll tell the price just for your information. It's a steal at 300,000 gil. Out of your range? Out! Go on, out!
Dialogue: Well, I'll tell the price just for your information. It's a steal at 300,000 gil. Out of your range? Out! Go on, out!

Original: NPC: Yes, you're right. I'm sorry, please continue.
Dialogue: Yes, you're right. I'm sorry, please continue.

Original: NPC: Yes, you're right. I'm sorry, please continue.
Dialogue: Yes, you're right. I'm sorry, please continue.

Original: NPC: Well, what do you think? Isn't it a fabulous villa? The feeling you get with owning a villa is simply...how should I say? ...indescribable. Well, let's wait for the captain.
Dialogue: Well, what do you think? Isn't it a fabulous villa? The feeling you get with owning a villa is simply...how should I say? ...indescribable. Well, let's wait for the captain.

Original: NPC: Welcome!! What's it going to be? 200 gil a night.
Dialogue: Welcome!! What's it going to be? 200 gil a night.

Original: NPC: You must be tired. Tomorrow in the Costa del Sol area the weather is going to be......sunny, again.
Dialogue: You must be tired. Tomorrow in the Costa del Sol area the weather is going to be......sunny, again.

Original: On-screen: Cradled by the sound of the ocean waves...... Sweet dreams...
Dialogue: Cradled by the sound of the ocean waves...... Sweet dreams...

Original: NPC: Good morning. Be careful traveling.
Dialogue: Good morning. Be careful traveling.

Original: NPC: Good morning!!
Dialogue: Good morning!!

Original: NPC: Wait a minute! There's not enough money here.
Dialogue: Wait a minute! There's not enough money here.

Original: NPC: You sure? I'll just be playing around here so drop by whenever you feel like it.
Dialogue: You sure? I'll just be playing around here so drop by whenever you feel like it.

Original: NPC: If you're headed for Mt. Corel, then you'd better buy some "Soft". At least that's what they always say, don't they? Be prepared, and you'll never fear.
Dialogue: If you're headed for Mt. Corel, then you'd better buy some "Soft". At least that's what they always say, don't they? Be prepared, and you'll never fear.

Original: NPC: Hey, I'm no idiot. I NEVER count my chickens before they hatch! Pretty good, huh?
Dialogue: Hey, I'm no idiot. I NEVER count my chickens before they hatch! Pretty good, huh?

Original: NPC: Hey...... heh heh......don't forget to talk to me, too.
Dialogue: Hey...... heh heh......don't forget to talk to me, too.

Original: NPC: Always the same story... Women never pay any attention to me...
Dialogue: Always the same story... Women never pay any attention to me...

Original: NPC: Yipes!! Help!!
Dialogue: Yipes!! Help!!

Original: NPC: ...breath...breath...! Kind of takes your breath away, don't it!?
Dialogue: ...breath...breath...! Kind of takes your breath away, don't it!?

Original: NPC: Eeeew!! Leave me alone!
Dialogue: Eeeew!! Leave me alone!

Original: NPC: Ublk! Glug...glug...... You're gonna drown... I'm
Dialogue: Ublk! Glug...glug...... You're gonna drown... I'm

Original: NPC: I'd be happy to be a guinea pig, if it's for Professor Hojo!
Dialogue: I'd be happy to be a guinea pig, if it's for Professor Hojo!

Original: NPC: Professor Hojo is so sweet. He's going to experiment on me.
Dialogue: Professor Hojo is so sweet. He's going to experiment on me.

Original: NPC: That's right!! It totally skipped my mind! There was something I was supposed to tell you.
Dialogue: That's right!! It totally skipped my mind! There was something I was supposed to tell you.

Original: NPC: That's right! It's about that! It was yesterday. A man wearing a black cloak came up from the ocean. I think he had tickets for the Gold Saucer... no, that wasn't it... I wonder if it was all just an illusion?
Dialogue: That's right! It's about that! It was yesterday. A man wearing a black cloak came up from the ocean. I think he had tickets for the Gold Saucer... no, that wasn't it... I wonder if it was all just an illusion?

Original: NPC: If this is your idea of flirting...forget it. I do fine as it is.
Dialogue: If this is your idea of flirting...forget it. I do fine as it is.

Original: NPC: He never takes off his lab coat even in this heat. I guess that's the mark of an intellectual.
Dialogue: He never takes off his lab coat even in this heat. I guess that's the mark of an intellectual.

Original: NPC: Hey! President Rufus came here yesterday. He used to be the President's little boy. We nicknamed him the little Prez! He didn't look much different than the surfers on the beach.
Dialogue: Hey! President Rufus came here yesterday. He used to be the President's little boy. We nicknamed him the little Prez! He didn't look much different than the surfers on the beach.

Original: NPC: The sea, the wind and the sun. Don't you just love the outdoors? It always puts me back on track.
Dialogue: The sea, the wind and the sun. Don't you just love the outdoors? It always puts me back on track.

Original: NPC: I'll interpret Professor Hojo's whispers. Head west, past Mt. Corel and keep going......
Dialogue: I'll interpret Professor Hojo's whispers. Head west, past Mt. Corel and keep going......

Original: NPC: Did you get that? I didn't understand it well, myself.
Dialogue: Did you get that? I didn't understand it well, myself.

Original: NPC: Yes, Professor Hojo. Where...?
Dialogue: Yes, Professor Hojo. Where...?

Original: NPC: It looks like the Professor discovered or found a solution to something. You know, I wonder...... if they headed west for Mt. Corel?
Dialogue: It looks like the Professor discovered or found a solution to something. You know, I wonder...... if they headed west for Mt. Corel?

Original: NPC: I'm getting a little sad. Professor Hojo looks happy like a child when he discovers something. He gets this big smile and then laughs......
Dialogue: I'm getting a little sad. Professor Hojo looks happy like a child when he discovers something. He gets this big smile and then laughs......

Original: NPC: I guess we should chase after him. A vacation for two from Mt. Corel to Gold Saucer.
Dialogue: I guess we should chase after him. A vacation for two from Mt. Corel to Gold Saucer.

Original: NPC: Hey, good timing. Would you mind putting lotion on me?
Dialogue: Hey, good timing. Would you mind putting lotion on me?

Original: NPC: Uhhhnn...
Dialogue: Uhhhnn...

Original: NPC: Than--kyu!
Dialogue: Than--kyu!

Original: NPC: Hey, loosen up a bit.
Dialogue: Hey, loosen up a bit.

Original: NPC: There's no ship to Junon. Recently, there's been a hoard on materials. Everything's topsy-turvy.
Dialogue: There's no ship to Junon. Recently, there's been a hoard on materials. Everything's topsy-turvy.

Original: NPC: Everyone's in a rush to get one last vacation in before the Meteor strikes, That's why it's so busy here.
Dialogue: Everyone's in a rush to get one last vacation in before the Meteor strikes, That's why it's so busy here.

Original: NPC: Not gonna be able to nap like this for much longer. When you put it that way, I feel kind of sad.
Dialogue: Not gonna be able to nap like this for much longer. When you put it that way, I feel kind of sad.

Original: NPC: Well, I'm not worried. When it all comes down, I'm heading for the skies. The only problem is...... will there be anywhere left to land?
Dialogue: Well, I'm not worried. When it all comes down, I'm heading for the skies. The only problem is...... will there be anywhere left to land?

Original: NPC: I don't feel like sightseeing around town. What I really want to do is... Looks like Gold Saucer is temporarily closed.
Dialogue: I don't feel like sightseeing around town. What I really want to do is... Looks like Gold Saucer is temporarily closed.

Original: NPC: Oh wow!! Man, that's huge!!
Dialogue: Oh wow!! Man, that's huge!!

Original: NPC: The stars!! They're in flames!!
Dialogue: The stars!! They're in flames!!

Original: NPC: They're burning. Someday they'll burn out. The stars are just like our youth.
Dialogue: They're burning. Someday they'll burn out. The stars are just like our youth.

Original: NPC: Ho! Ho! Ho!...... It's the end of the world.
Dialogue: Ho! Ho! Ho!...... It's the end of the world.

Original: NPC: Wanna buy a souvenir to remember participating in the Meteor tour?
Dialogue: Wanna buy a souvenir to remember participating in the Meteor tour?

Original: Butch: Good or bad everything's gotta go! It's the end of the world sale!!
Dialogue: Good or bad everything's gotta go! It's the end of the world sale!!

Original: NPC: I don't care if it's the Meteor or not, I'm not giving up yet! I still haven't surfed the best waves of Costa del Sol! I hope the Meteor doesn't strike before I do.
Dialogue: I don't care if it's the Meteor or not, I'm not giving up yet! I still haven't surfed the best waves of Costa del Sol! I hope the Meteor doesn't strike before I do.

Original: NPC: It's weird seeing the reflection of the Meteor on the sea in the evening! It gives you the creeps.
Dialogue: It's weird seeing the reflection of the Meteor on the sea in the evening! It gives you the creeps.

Original: NPC: Come on...please. If you don't buy from me... I can't make ends meet. No one else will either.
Dialogue: Come on...please. If you don't buy from me... I can't make ends meet. No one else will either.

Original: Mukki: I'm just sitting here havin' a quiet drink.
Dialogue: I'm just sitting here havin' a quiet drink.

Original: NPC: I don't understand what my boss is thinking! I'm gonna yell at him! I'm gonna scream my head off till it gets ugly! Isn't that what life's all about? What do you think?
Dialogue: I don't understand what my boss is thinking! I'm gonna yell at him! I'm gonna scream my head off till it gets ugly! Isn't that what life's all about? What do you think?

Original: NPC: ...huff...wheeze... Heat and cold are just memories of the Planet......
Dialogue: ...huff...wheeze... Heat and cold are just memories of the Planet......

Original: NPC: I wan' learn how speak beddah. But don' wan' have stars fall down. You think...same?
Dialogue: I wan' learn how speak beddah. But don' wan' have stars fall down. You think...same?

Original: NPC: When you're in here, forget about all those awful things going on outside, and... just enjoy yourself.
Dialogue: When you're in here, forget about all those awful things going on outside, and... just enjoy yourself.

Original: Johnny: I proposed to her in the middle of all that Meteor stuff! I don't care even if the world were to end right now! I can't think of anything else!
Dialogue: I proposed to her in the middle of all that Meteor stuff! I don't care even if the world were to end right now! I can't think of anything else!

Original: Johnny: No, no, NO!! Meteor's getting bigger by the minute!! I wanna live on the edge right now!! I want to build a home with my woman and grow old together! If you can't do it, I will! And that's that! I'm gonna do my best, so you hang in there, too!
Dialogue: No, no, NO!! Meteor's getting bigger by the minute!! I wanna live on the edge right now!! I want to build a home with my woman and grow old together! If you can't do it, I will! And that's that! I'm gonna do my best, so you hang in there, too!

Original: NPC: I don't feel like doing anything. I just want to spend the rest of my life sleeping. Will you be staying together?
Dialogue: I don't feel like doing anything. I just want to spend the rest of my life sleeping. Will you be staying together?

Original: NPC: Good night.
Dialogue: Good night.

Original: NPC: Stop looking like a hunted animal! Whatever happens...happens. Just go with it.
Dialogue: Stop looking like a hunted animal! Whatever happens...happens. Just go with it.

Original: NPC: Sitting around waiting for Meteor to come...... Why's it gotta fall on us?
Dialogue: Sitting around waiting for Meteor to come...... Why's it gotta fall on us?

Original: NPC: Eaaggh!! Leave me alone! I'm trying to learn how to swim before the end of the world.
Dialogue: Eaaggh!! Leave me alone! I'm trying to learn how to swim before the end of the world.

Original: NPC: It's getting closer and closer. Someone will do something, don't you think?
Dialogue: It's getting closer and closer. Someone will do something, don't you think?

Original: NPC: The sea breeze, sun and Meteor. Isn't nature strange?
Dialogue: The sea breeze, sun and Meteor. Isn't nature strange?

Original: NPC: I don't care even if it is the end of the world, I just want to sit here and drink cocktails!
Dialogue: I don't care even if it is the end of the world, I just want to sit here and drink cocktails!

Original: NPC: Ooooh......I think I drank too much.
Dialogue: Ooooh......I think I drank too much.

Original: NPC: Please buy something! Anything will do!
Dialogue: Please buy something! Anything will do!

Original: NPC: What do you want?
Dialogue: What do you want?

Original: NPC: Take that road on the left to the Ropeway station! The Ropeway'll take you to the Gold Saucer. It don't mean much to us poor folks though...
Dialogue: Take that road on the left to the Ropeway station! The Ropeway'll take you to the Gold Saucer. It don't mean much to us poor folks though...

Original: NPC: If you want to survive, then you're gonna need some of my weapons. (Upon talking to the man in the tent on the left.)
Dialogue: If you want to survive, then you're gonna need some of my weapons. (Upon talking to the man in the tent on the left.)

Original: NPC: I want to leave this garbage dump of a town behind me, and start a new life. If I had a buggy, I'd cross the southern desert, and go to that town across the river...
Dialogue: I want to leave this garbage dump of a town behind me, and start a new life. If I had a buggy, I'd cross the southern desert, and go to that town across the river...

Original: NPC: Welcome. It's 50 gil a night. Would you like a room?
Dialogue: Welcome. It's 50 gil a night. Would you like a room?

Original: NPC: Enjoy your stay.
Dialogue: Enjoy your stay.

Original: NPC: Hmm, you don't quite have enough.
Dialogue: Hmm, you don't quite have enough.

Original: NPC: Please come again.
Dialogue: Please come again.

Original: NPC: Isn't anyone brave enough to stick it to Shinra?
Dialogue: Isn't anyone brave enough to stick it to Shinra?

Original: NPC: YOU know who's responsible for North Corel winding up like this!
Dialogue: YOU know who's responsible for North Corel winding up like this!

Original: NPC: I'll never understand the rich. I heard some guy named Dio at the Gold Saucer is collectin' rocks!
Dialogue: I'll never understand the rich. I heard some guy named Dio at the Gold Saucer is collectin' rocks!

Original: NPC: Get out of the way!! The only way we can make ends meet around here now is by collecting junk!
Dialogue: Get out of the way!! The only way we can make ends meet around here now is by collecting junk!

Original: NPC: A buncha guys called Turks came here sayin' they'd pay 10000 gil for some rock called a 'Keystone'. When I asked how much they'd pay for a regular rock just layin' around here, they slapped me upside my damn head!!
Dialogue: A buncha guys called Turks came here sayin' they'd pay 10000 gil for some rock called a 'Keystone'. When I asked how much they'd pay for a regular rock just layin' around here, they slapped me upside my damn head!!

Original: NPC: I hear it's a big fad now in the city to get tattoos. Is that right?
Dialogue: I hear it's a big fad now in the city to get tattoos. Is that right?

Original: NPC: Really...? I saw a big '1' on the arm of a young guy heading towards the Ropeway. That Black Cape he had on was really cool.
Dialogue: Really...? I saw a big '1' on the arm of a young guy heading towards the Ropeway. That Black Cape he had on was really cool.

Original: NPC: I guess I should get a '0' tattoo! For a poor man like me, '0' oughtta be perfect.
Dialogue: I guess I should get a '0' tattoo! For a poor man like me, '0' oughtta be perfect.

Original: NPC: Grandpa used to be a Coal Train engineer. He still can't kick his old habits from then.
Dialogue: Grandpa used to be a Coal Train engineer. He still can't kick his old habits from then.

Original: NPC: The next train's coming in soon.
Dialogue: The next train's coming in soon.

Original: NPC: Everyone knows that accident couldn't have been avoided. But no one will be satisfied until someone takes the blame.
Dialogue: Everyone knows that accident couldn't have been avoided. But no one will be satisfied until someone takes the blame.

Original: NPC: There was something glowing in that well over there. If I can get my hands on it, I'm gonna sell it and go to the Gold Saucer!
Dialogue: There was something glowing in that well over there. If I can get my hands on it, I'm gonna sell it and go to the Gold Saucer!

Original: NPC: How am I supposed to continue living in a town that's lost everything...? To hell with the Mako reactor!
Dialogue: How am I supposed to continue living in a town that's lost everything...? To hell with the Mako reactor!

Original: NPC: Because of them......ugh my husband got into that accident... He used to be such a strong man...
Dialogue: Because of them......ugh my husband got into that accident... He used to be such a strong man...

Original: NPC: Yaaay!! What do you wanna play?
Dialogue: Yaaay!! What do you wanna play?

Original: NPC: The Ropeway takes you to the 'Gold Saucer'. It's free, so don't worry about it.
Dialogue: The Ropeway takes you to the 'Gold Saucer'. It's free, so don't worry about it.

Original: NPC: Look down... nuthin' but junk. Look up...Meteor. Am I gonna be stuck between these two for the rest of my life?
Dialogue: Look down... nuthin' but junk. Look up...Meteor. Am I gonna be stuck between these two for the rest of my life?

Original: NPC: Some Shinra soldiers went up to Mt. Corel. They said they're collecting Huge Materia to blow up Meteor! Ya think they can really do it...? I'll bet the reactor destroys everything even before Meteor hits!
Dialogue: Some Shinra soldiers went up to Mt. Corel. They said they're collecting Huge Materia to blow up Meteor! Ya think they can really do it...? I'll bet the reactor destroys everything even before Meteor hits!

Original: NPC: I figure if I stay alive long enough, something good's bound to happen.
Dialogue: I figure if I stay alive long enough, something good's bound to happen.

Original: NPC: Staring up at Meteor won't put food in my stomach. But if I look down, sometimes I find somethin' to eat.
Dialogue: Staring up at Meteor won't put food in my stomach. But if I look down, sometimes I find somethin' to eat.

Original: NPC: Shinra soldiers came around sayin' they were gathering up all the Huge Materia. I think they're gonna bring it here by coal train, from the Corel Reactor.
Dialogue: Shinra soldiers came around sayin' they were gathering up all the Huge Materia. I think they're gonna bring it here by coal train, from the Corel Reactor.

Original: NPC: Whenever I look up in the sky, I see Meteor staring me right in the face...... If you're comin' down, then hurry up do it!! 'Cause I'm gonna kick the $#@& outta ya!
Dialogue: Whenever I look up in the sky, I see Meteor staring me right in the face...... If you're comin' down, then hurry up do it!! 'Cause I'm gonna kick the $#@& outta ya!

Original: NPC: Hey, what's gonna happen to the world...? I guess no one wants to have fun anymore now that the Gold Saucer is closing...
Dialogue: Hey, what's gonna happen to the world...? I guess no one wants to have fun anymore now that the Gold Saucer is closing...

Original: NPC: Hey, the Gold Saucer reopened! We've got to play hard to get our minds off Meteor.
Dialogue: Hey, the Gold Saucer reopened! We've got to play hard to get our minds off Meteor.

Original: NPC: As long as we're here, Grandpa's not going to be able to forget about trains. Maybe we'll start anew, moving to Southern Isle of Mideel.
Dialogue: As long as we're here, Grandpa's not going to be able to forget about trains. Maybe we'll start anew, moving to Southern Isle of Mideel.

Original: NPC: With Meteor coming, I guess it won't make any difference...
Dialogue: With Meteor coming, I guess it won't make any difference...

Original: NPC: Seeing that train got Grandpa more excited than I've seen him for some time.
Dialogue: Seeing that train got Grandpa more excited than I've seen him for some time.

Original: NPC: The next train's coming in soon.
Dialogue: The next train's coming in soon.

Original: NPC: What the? Don't get hit by the train!
Dialogue: What the? Don't get hit by the train!

Original: NPC: Everyone knows that accident couldn't have been avoided. But no one will be satisfied until someone takes the blame.
Dialogue: Everyone knows that accident couldn't have been avoided. But no one will be satisfied until someone takes the blame.

Original: NPC: You saved my life. Not that I have much longer to live anyway...
Dialogue: You saved my life. Not that I have much longer to live anyway...

Original: NPC: There was something glowing in that well over there. If I can get my hands on it, I'm gonna sell it and go to the Gold Saucer!
Dialogue: There was something glowing in that well over there. If I can get my hands on it, I'm gonna sell it and go to the Gold Saucer!

Original: NPC: I got it out of the well. It must be a special rock!!
Dialogue: I got it out of the well. It must be a special rock!!

Original: On-screen: Received "Ultima" Materia!
Dialogue: Received "Ultima" Materia!

Original: NPC: Hey? You can't hold anymore. I'll keep it in my pocket for you. You can come by and pick it up later!
Dialogue: Hey? You can't hold anymore. I'll keep it in my pocket for you. You can come by and pick it up later!

Original: NPC: When I grow up, I'm gonna travel the world collecting glowing stones!
Dialogue: When I grow up, I'm gonna travel the world collecting glowing stones!

Original: NPC: How am I supposed to continue living in a town that's lost everything...? To hell with the Mako reactor!
Dialogue: How am I supposed to continue living in a town that's lost everything...? To hell with the Mako reactor!

Original: NPC: The town is in shambles...... and Meteor is falling our way... All we have left is our love for each other.
Dialogue: The town is in shambles...... and Meteor is falling our way... All we have left is our love for each other.

Original: NPC: I don't want to die, but who can stop Meteor?
Dialogue: I don't want to die, but who can stop Meteor?

Original: NPC: Because of them......ugh my husband got into that accident... He used to be such a strong man...
Dialogue: Because of them......ugh my husband got into that accident... He used to be such a strong man...

Original: NPC: Is Meteor really going to crash down on us......? I'm still young...... I'll never marry again.
Dialogue: Is Meteor really going to crash down on us......? I'm still young...... I'll never marry again.

Original: NPC: This memento is all I have left of my husband... I'll give it to you if you'll please stop Meteor...
Dialogue: This memento is all I have left of my husband... I'll give it to you if you'll please stop Meteor...

Dialogue: Received "Catastrophe"!

Dialogue: Yaaay!! What do you wanna play?

Dialogue: Hey, what's a Meteor?

Dialogue: The Gold Saucer is currently closed. The Ropeway's up and runnin', but there's no point in goin' there.

Original: NPC: The Gold Saucer reopened. Why don't you go play hard and clear your heads as well as your pockets?
Dialogue: The Gold Saucer reopened. Why don't you go play hard and clear your heads as well as your pockets?

Original: NPC 1: I'm gonna use all my life savings before Meteor hits!
Dialogue: I'm gonna use all my life savings before Meteor hits!

Dialogue: I know how you feel, but what if Meteor doesn't hit us? What are you gonna do then?

Dialogue: I got a glowing rock from the well. I'll sell it to you for 50000 gil!

Dialogue: Received "Ultima" Materia!

Dialogue: You don't have enough money! Don't try to take advantage of me just because I'm a kid!!

Dialogue: Huh? You have lots of 'em! You can't carry all of 'em. So I'm gonna keep it in my pocket...

Original: NPC: I wish someone would buy this rock off of me...
Dialogue: I wish someone would buy this rock off of me...

Dialogue: Yay! My house is finished!!

Dialogue: My store was all right!

Original: NPC: Um... where was the next train station?
Dialogue: Um... where was the next train station?

Dialogue: We've lost everything... Now we have to start again from ' 1' ...no, from ' 0'.

Dialogue: Hey, what's this world coming to ...? Even the Gold Saucer is closing. So does that mean there's no time to be playing around?

Original: NPC: Hey, the Golden Saucer reopened! I guess that means we should play hard to forget about Meteor.
Dialogue: Hey, the Golden Saucer reopened! I guess that means we should play hard to forget about Meteor.

Dialogue: Welcome to the Gold Saucer.

Original: NPC: Mmm? You're new here, aren't you? Then, you want an explanation of the Battle Arena?
Dialogue: Mmm? You're new here, aren't you? Then, you want an explanation of the Battle Arena?

Original: NPC: You fight here and collect battle points. You can then exchange those points for prizes. The Battle Game...even though it's a game you still use all your physical abilities. To participate, go to the front and pay yer GP's. You can fight in up to eight battles. The more you win, the more battle points you get. But, if you lose, you lose all your points So it's up to you whether or not to fight after each win. They also make it harder by givin' out handicaps. They decide what handicaps there'll be, and you won't know what you're up against until the battle.
Dialogue: You fight here and collect battle points. You can then exchange those points for prizes. The Battle Game...even though it's a game you still use all your physical abilities. To participate, go to the front and pay yer GP's. You can fight in up to eight battles. The more you win, the more battle points you get. But, if you lose, you lose all your points So it's up to you whether or not to fight after each win. They also make it harder by givin' out handicaps. They decide what handicaps there'll be, and you won't know what you're up against until the battle.

Original: NPC: Oh yeah, once you leave the Battle area, all your battle points will become useless. So watch it.
Dialogue: Oh yeah, once you leave the Battle area, all your battle points will become useless. So watch it.

Original: NPC: Oh, and one more thing. The maximum points you could get is 65000, no more. So if you get that many you should exchange them for something.

You can exchange your tickets for items or GP at the Exchange counter to the right of the entrance.

Dialogue: Sir, that entrance is for the challengers that have already registered. Please register here.

Original: NPC: We usually buy tickets for the B rank and C rank races, right?
Dialogue: We usually buy tickets for the B rank and C rank races, right?

Original: NPC: In other words, 'rank' means the Chocobo's 'strength'. A is highest and C's the lowest. When you become a Free Chocobo jockey, you'll be able to buy A rank tickets. Of course, the higher the rank, the better your item ticket. Hey, maybe I'll become a Chocobo jockey!?
Dialogue: In other words, 'rank' means the Chocobo's 'strength'. A is highest and C's the lowest. When you become a Free Chocobo jockey, you'll be able to buy A rank tickets. Of course, the higher the rank, the better your item ticket. Hey, maybe I'll become a Chocobo jockey!?

Original: NPC: You can become one if you own a Chocobo ...and have some connections. But Chocobo's are pretty hard to catch and I don't have any connections.
Dialogue: You can become one if you own a Chocobo ...and have some connections. But Chocobo's are pretty hard to catch and I don't have any connections.

Original: NPC: You can only buy up to 3 tickets Think before you buy. For example, you could select half of the Chocobos and buy 3 boxes.
Dialogue: You can only buy up to 3 tickets Think before you buy. For example, you could select half of the Chocobos and buy 3 boxes.

Original: NPC: A box is buying 3 combinations of 2 Chocobos. For example, if you select Chocobo 1, 3, and 5, you can purchase combinations, such as 1 - 3, 1 - 5, 3 - 5. You can also play the limited wheel by selecting a Chocobo.
Dialogue: A box is buying 3 combinations of 2 Chocobos. For example, if you select Chocobo 1, 3, and 5, you can purchase combinations, such as 1 - 3, 1 - 5, 3 - 5. You can also play the limited wheel by selecting a Chocobo.

Original: NPC: Playing a 'Limited wheel' means you select a Chocobo and use it in all of your combinations. For example, if you have Chocobo 1, then you buy 1 - 2, 1 - 3, 1 - 4. No matter how you make your bet, you win some and you lose some. It all comes down to insight and luck.
Dialogue: Playing a 'Limited wheel' means you select a Chocobo and use it in all of your combinations. For example, if you have Chocobo 1, then you buy 1 - 2, 1 - 3, 1 - 4. No matter how you make your bet, you win some and you lose some. It all comes down to insight and luck.

Dialogue: Hey, what's that Chocobo on the odds sheet?

Dialogue: That's how you can find out a Chocobo's condition and strengths.

Dialogue: Hmm, If you can tell which ones are the strongest, then it's easy...

Original: NPC 2: Well, not as easy as you think. It's not just a matter of the Chocobo's strength, but it also depends on the jockey and the Chocobo's personality. If these are bad, they may use too much stamina, and affect other things.
Dialogue: Well, not as easy as you think. It's not just a matter of the Chocobo's strength, but it also depends on the jockey and the Chocobo's personality. If these are bad, they may use too much stamina, and affect other things.

Dialogue: One day, there was a huge explosion. Many townspeople died in it...
