Dialogue: It's been a while since the explosion, but you can still find pieces of it left all over town.

Original: NPC: Uh...need somethin'?
Dialogue: Uh...need somethin'?

Original: NPC: It's 80 Gil a night.
Dialogue: It's 80 Gil a night.

Original: NPC: It's 300 Gil a night.
Dialogue: It's 300 Gil a night.

Original: NPC: ...You don't have enough money. Come back when you get some.
Dialogue: ...You don't have enough money. Come back when you get some.

Original: NPC: Shinra built the reactor, without even thinking about the town's safety. And, this is the result.
Dialogue: Shinra built the reactor, without even thinking about the town's safety. And, this is the result.

Original: NPC: One day, there was a huge explosion. Many townspeople died in it...
Dialogue: One day, there was a huge explosion. Many townspeople died in it...

Original: NPC: It's been a while since the explosion, but you can still find pieces of it left all over town.
Dialogue: It's been a while since the explosion, but you can still find pieces of it left all over town.

Original: NPC: This is Gongaga Village. Many people died here in a Mako reactor explosion.
Dialogue: This is Gongaga Village. Many people died here in a Mako reactor explosion.

Original: NPC: The Shinra people told us that everyone would be happy once the Reactor was built. But, all it brought us was sadness......
Dialogue: The Shinra people told us that everyone would be happy once the Reactor was built. But, all it brought us was sadness......

Original: NPC: Tell me, young man. Can't we be happy without having to sacrifice anything? Can't time pass without unhappiness...?
Dialogue: Tell me, young man. Can't we be happy without having to sacrifice anything? Can't time pass without unhappiness...?

Original: NPC: Oh...you here to shop?
Dialogue: Oh...you here to shop?

Original: NPC: Shinra built the reactor, without even thinking about the town's safety. And, this is the result.
Dialogue: Shinra built the reactor, without even thinking about the town's safety. And, this is the result.

Original: NPC: One day, there was a huge explosion. Many townspeople died in it...
Dialogue: One day, there was a huge explosion. Many townspeople died in it...

Original: NPC: It's been a while since the explosion, but you can still find pieces of it left all over town.
Dialogue: It's been a while since the explosion, but you can still find pieces of it left all over town.

Original: NPC: Three years ago when the reactor exploded, my husband...
Dialogue: Three years ago when the reactor exploded, my husband...

Original: NPC: Do people really need reactors to live? Aren't there more important things in life...?
Dialogue: Do people really need reactors to live? Aren't there more important things in life...?

Original: NPC: No matter how much I pray, it won't bring our grandson back...
Dialogue: No matter how much I pray, it won't bring our grandson back...

Original: NPC: Life Stream? Never heard of it. The Planet's structure? ...Who cares about that? Why don't you go ask Bugenhagen of Cosmo Canyon hard questions like that?
Dialogue: Life Stream? Never heard of it. The Planet's structure? ...Who cares about that? Why don't you go ask Bugenhagen of Cosmo Canyon hard questions like that?

Original: NPC': Seems like the Shinra is planning something big to destroy Meteor... I heard they're going to do something with all that big materia they've been gathering... After what happened with the reactor you can't trust Shinra.
Dialogue: Seems like the Shinra is planning something big to destroy Meteor... I heard they're going to do something with all that big materia they've been gathering... After what happened with the reactor you can't trust Shinra.

Original: NPC: ...Everyone's going to die. Everything's coming to an end.
Dialogue: ...Everyone's going to die. Everything's coming to an end.

Original: NPC: You lost? When that happens the only ones you can count on are your friends. The first thing you gotta do is find your best friend.
Dialogue: You lost? When that happens the only ones you can count on are your friends. The first thing you gotta do is find your best friend.

Original: NPC: This reactor's useless, but I hear there's still big materia at the Corel, Fort Condor, and the Junon reactors. Shinra's working to get the materia from all those places...... But for what...?
Dialogue: This reactor's useless, but I hear there's still big materia at the Corel, Fort Condor, and the Junon reactors. Shinra's working to get the materia from all those places...... But for what...?

Original: NPC: Shinra's tried a lot of things, but it's only HUMAN. It's fate that Meteor will kill the people.
Dialogue: Shinra's tried a lot of things, but it's only HUMAN. It's fate that Meteor will kill the people.

Original: On-screen: Tasty Cocktails! Pub "Starlet"
Dialogue: Tasty Cocktails! Pub "Starlet"

Original: On-screen: [Turtle's Paradise] No. 5
Dialogue: [Turtle's Paradise] No. 5

Original: NPC: Were you able to hear the stars whispers? Well then, please come again.
Dialogue: Were you able to hear the stars whispers? Well then, please come again.

Original: NPC: I'm sorry, but you don't seem to have enough for a room...
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but you don't seem to have enough for a room...

Original: NPC: Well then, please come again.
Dialogue: Well then, please come again.

Original: On-screen: [Turtle Paradise Newsletter] Number 4
Dialogue: [Turtle Paradise Newsletter] Number 4

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho Hoooo. That's a machine only I can use.
Dialogue: Ho Ho Hoooo. That's a machine only I can use.

Original: NPC: Welcome to Cosmo Canyon. Make yourselves at home.
Dialogue: Welcome to Cosmo Canyon. Make yourselves at home.

Original: NPC: Since you're here, why don't you listen to Bugenhagen's story?
Dialogue: Since you're here, why don't you listen to Bugenhagen's story?

Original: NPC: Did you get to see Bugenhagen's contraption? If you haven't yet, you must!
Dialogue: Did you get to see Bugenhagen's contraption? If you haven't yet, you must!

Original: NPC: Leaving already? But it appears your friends still want to learn more about the planet...
Dialogue: Leaving already? But it appears your friends still want to learn more about the planet...

Original: NPC: Hm? If you're looking for Bugenhagen, he went to the Sealed Door. Remember, there's a steel door on the way to Bugenhagen's room. What's that door there for anyhow? It's been closed forever...
Dialogue: Hm? If you're looking for Bugenhagen, he went to the Sealed Door. Remember, there's a steel door on the way to Bugenhagen's room. What's that door there for anyhow? It's been closed forever...

Original: NPC: Oh, Nanaki's with you. Make yourselves at home.
Dialogue: Oh, Nanaki's with you. Make yourselves at home.

Original: NPC: Yaaay! Nanaki! Nanaki's back! It's all thanks to this flame! This fire is called 'Cosmo Candle'. It has burned for generations. It is a holy flame that protects this canyon. I heard once, it only went out once, long ago. The elders said something horrifying occurred, but I really don't know much about it.
Dialogue: Yaaay! Nanaki! Nanaki's back! It's all thanks to this flame! This fire is called 'Cosmo Candle'. It has burned for generations. It is a holy flame that protects this canyon. I heard once, it only went out once, long ago. The elders said something horrifying occurred, but I really don't know much about it.

Original: NPC: Nanaki, are you leaving again? We want you to stay here forever...
Dialogue: Nanaki, are you leaving again? We want you to stay here forever...

Original: NPC: So this is Cosmo Canyon... Quite a mysterious place. Have you come to seek the 'Study of Planet Life'?
Dialogue: So this is Cosmo Canyon... Quite a mysterious place. Have you come to seek the 'Study of Planet Life'?

Original: NPC:Yeah? I heard there's an awesome observatory here. I'd like to see it if I have a chance.
Dialogue: Yeah? I heard there's an awesome observatory here. I'd like to see it if I have a chance.

Original: NPC: Oh yeah? What? The car broka down!? Why don't you look around Cosmo Canyon, while I fix the car?
Dialogue: Oh yeah? What? The car broka down!? Why don't you look around Cosmo Canyon, while I fix the car?

Original: NPC: Oh, really? There really isn't much else to see here.
Dialogue: Oh, really? There really isn't much else to see here.

Original: NPC: Why don't you look around Cosmo Canyon, while I fix the car?
Dialogue: Why don't you look around Cosmo Canyon, while I fix the car?

Original: NPC: The repair on your car is completed. Now you should be able to go where ever you want.
Dialogue: The repair on your car is completed. Now you should be able to go where ever you want.

Original: NPC: No charge! You'd do the same for me, right?
Dialogue: No charge! You'd do the same for me, right?

Original: NPC: Are you sure...? Well, all right. Thank you.
Dialogue: Are you sure...? Well, all right. Thank you.

Original: NPC: Oh yeah. Did you stay at the inn already? There was a bottle on the sofa there a couple of days ago...was it yours?
Dialogue: Oh yeah. Did you stay at the inn already? There was a bottle on the sofa there a couple of days ago...was it yours?

Original: NPC: ...You don't even have that much. Don't tease me, okay?
Dialogue: ...You don't even have that much. Don't tease me, okay?

Original: NPC: Mmm...... I think the teachings of the 'Study of Planet Life' are true. But can people used to Mako energy ever go back...?
Dialogue: Mmm...... I think the teachings of the 'Study of Planet Life' are true. But can people used to Mako energy ever go back...?

Original: NPC: Welcome. How 'bout our original cocktail, 'Cosmo Candle?' A drink now and then is good for you. It'll relax you a bit. ...If you know when to stop.
Dialogue: Welcome. How 'bout our original cocktail, 'Cosmo Candle?' A drink now and then is good for you. It'll relax you a bit. ...If you know when to stop.

Original: Elder Bugah: Is that so? You brought Nanaki back here? Yeah, thanks.
Dialogue: Is that so? You brought Nanaki back here? Yeah, thanks.

Original: Elder Bugah: Mmm... What is it?
Dialogue: Mmm... What is it?

Original: Elder Bugah: You can't talk of the Ancients, without mentioning Professor Gast. He used to come here sometimes. He was a Shinra scholar who spent his life studying the Ancients. He was a serious person, never would have figured he'd be with the Shinra. Must've been about 30 years ago, when he found the corpse of an Ancient. He was elated! If I recall...he named it 'Jenova' and was doing a lot of research...
Dialogue: You can't talk of the Ancients, without mentioning Professor Gast. He used to come here sometimes. He was a Shinra scholar who spent his life studying the Ancients. He was a serious person, never would have figured he'd be with the Shinra. Must've been about 30 years ago, when he found the corpse of an Ancient. He was elated! If I recall...he named it 'Jenova' and was doing a lot of research...

Original: Elder Bugah: One day, he showed up here, looking real distressed. He was mumbling something about Jenova not being an Ancient and that he'd done a terrible thing... He's been missing since then. I heard that he never went back to Shinra
Dialogue: One day, he showed up here, looking real distressed. He was mumbling something about Jenova not being an Ancient and that he'd done a terrible thing... He's been missing since then. I heard that he never went back to Shinra

Original: Elder Bugah: So, if you ever see Professor Gast, I want you to tell him... That the old man that likes to drink in Cosmo Canyon, wanted to hear about the Ancients. Well, there's lots to talk about, but most things about the Ancients are all legend and folk tales, and no one knows the truth.
Dialogue: So, if you ever see Professor Gast, I want you to tell him... That the old man that likes to drink in Cosmo Canyon, wanted to hear about the Ancients. Well, there's lots to talk about, but most things about the Ancients are all legend and folk tales, and no one knows the truth.

Original: Elder Bugah: ...hmm. That's no fun... I wanna tell a story.
Dialogue: ...hmm. That's no fun... I wanna tell a story.

Original: Elder Bugah: By the way, your friends are all in front of the 'Cosmo Candle' Are you all leaving now?
Dialogue: By the way, your friends are all in front of the 'Cosmo Candle' Are you all leaving now?

Original: Elder Bugah: Mmm. I'm starting to feel good now. That bartender's cocktails always hit the spot.
Dialogue: Mmm. I'm starting to feel good now. That bartender's cocktails always hit the spot.

Original: NPC: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn'. It'll be 100 gil a night. Would you like to stay?
Dialogue: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn'. It'll be 100 gil a night. Would you like to stay?

Original: NPC: Hello. Looking for anything in particular?
Dialogue: Hello. Looking for anything in particular?

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho Hoooo. I'm glad you're back, Nanaki.
Dialogue: Ho Ho Hoooo. I'm glad you're back, Nanaki.

Original: Bugenhagen: I hate to ask you but, please look after Nanaki from now on.
Dialogue: I hate to ask you but, please look after Nanaki from now on.

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho Hoooo. You people.
Dialogue: Ho Ho Hoooo. You people.

Original: Bugenhagen: Where is Nanaki? I hope he's not bothering you.
Dialogue: Where is Nanaki? I hope he's not bothering you.

Original: NPC: Oh, it's you. This is terrible. The color of that unlucky star... The children are all so scared that they won't even go outside. I'd rather not see it either...
Dialogue: Oh, it's you. This is terrible. The color of that unlucky star... The children are all so scared that they won't even go outside. I'd rather not see it either...

Original: NPC: Bugenhagen is what keeps our hearts strong...
Dialogue: Bugenhagen is what keeps our hearts strong...

Original: NPC: Nanaki, it's really bad. Ever since Bugenhagen returned from that last trip, he doesn't seem well. Why don't you hurry and see Bugenhagen?
Dialogue: Nanaki, it's really bad. Ever since Bugenhagen returned from that last trip, he doesn't seem well. Why don't you hurry and see Bugenhagen?

Original: NPC: Bugenhagen seems rather down ever since he returned from that trip. I'm worried something might happen to Bugenhagen now of all times...
Dialogue: Bugenhagen seems rather down ever since he returned from that trip. I'm worried something might happen to Bugenhagen now of all times...

Original: NPC: Mmm...... I can't be standing here talking about the 'Study of Planet Life'. I think I'll be heading back to my homeland now...
Dialogue: Mmm...... I can't be standing here talking about the 'Study of Planet Life'. I think I'll be heading back to my homeland now...

Original: NPC: How about our original cocktail, 'Lifestream'? You should forget your troubles with a drink. We humans sure are weak creatures...
Dialogue: How about our original cocktail, 'Lifestream'? You should forget your troubles with a drink. We humans sure are weak creatures...

Original: NPC: That reminds me. I heard that someone here in Cosmo Canyon is selling some Healing Materia.
Dialogue: That reminds me. I heard that someone here in Cosmo Canyon is selling some Healing Materia.

Original: Elder Bugah: Live with the planet, die with the planet. Maybe this is the way it should be. Who knows? I'm full of booze... It's when I think about the children. I wonder if we could just save our own children.
Dialogue: Live with the planet, die with the planet. Maybe this is the way it should be. Who knows? I'm full of booze... It's when I think about the children. I wonder if we could just save our own children.

Original: Elder Bugah: Where is the Promised Land...? Maybe Bugenhagen knows. Isn't Nanaki starting to notice? The reason why Bugenhagen sent him away from the canyon...
Dialogue: Where is the Promised Land...? Maybe Bugenhagen knows. Isn't Nanaki starting to notice? The reason why Bugenhagen sent him away from the canyon...

Original: NPC: Welcome to 'Shindra Inn'. It's times like this a nice, soft bed will do you good. It's 100 Gil a night. Would you like to stay?
Dialogue: Welcome to 'Shindra Inn'. It's times like this a nice, soft bed will do you good. It's 100 Gil a night. Would you like to stay?

Original: NPC: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn' As long as there are guests, our lights will always be on. It will be 100 Gil a night, Like a room?
Dialogue: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn' As long as there are guests, our lights will always be on. It will be 100 Gil a night, Like a room?

Original: NPC: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn' At times like this, when a nice, soft bed will do you good. It will be 100 Gil a night. Would you like a room?
Dialogue: Welcome to 'Shildra Inn' At times like this, when a nice, soft bed will do you good. It will be 100 Gil a night. Would you like a room?

Original: NPC: It's not that I'm afraid of that big star. It's just that, uh, I have a stomach ache... That's why I'm not moving. That's the truth!
Dialogue: It's not that I'm afraid of that big star. It's just that, uh, I have a stomach ache... That's why I'm not moving. That's the truth!

Original: NPC: That Nanaki's slick! He said, 'I'll protect this canyon'! But he didn't. I don't care about Nanaki anymore...
Dialogue: That Nanaki's slick! He said, 'I'll protect this canyon'! But he didn't. I don't care about Nanaki anymore...

Original: Red XIII: Sorry...I'm really sorry. But now, I have......
Dialogue: Sorry...I'm really sorry. But now, I have......

Original: NPC: Both Nanaki and Mr.Bugenhagen are gone... I feel so lonely...
Dialogue: Both Nanaki and Mr.Bugenhagen are gone... I feel so lonely...

Original: NPC: He's finally come home, but Mr.Bugenhagen doesn't seem well... I want to hear Mr.Bugenhagen's talk with Nanaki like we used to do...
Dialogue: He's finally come home, but Mr.Bugenhagen doesn't seem well... I want to hear Mr.Bugenhagen's talk with Nanaki like we used to do...

Original: NPC: Nanaki, is it true that Mr.Bugenhagen left on a journey? Then that means he's better, right? He IS going to come back soon, right?
Dialogue: Nanaki, is it true that Mr.Bugenhagen left on a journey? Then that means he's better, right? He IS going to come back soon, right?

Original: Red XIII: ...... ...Don't worry. Grandpa will come back floating, saying 'Ho Ho Hoooo' again...
Dialogue: ...... ...Don't worry. Grandpa will come back floating, saying 'Ho Ho Hoooo' again...

Original: NPC: Yea, that's right! 'Ho Ho Hoooo'!
Dialogue: Yea, that's right! 'Ho Ho Hoooo'!

Original: NPC: It's Ho Ho Hoooo! Ho Ho Hoooo!
Dialogue: It's Ho Ho Hoooo! Ho Ho Hoooo!

Original: NPC: Hi. Of course, our store's open. No need to fear. I have the 'Study of Planet Life' right here. No, maybe I AM a bit afraid. But, whenever I'm reading 'Study of Planet Life,' I can forget all my fears.
Dialogue: Hi. Of course, our store's open. No need to fear. I have the 'Study of Planet Life' right here. No, maybe I AM a bit afraid. But, whenever I'm reading 'Study of Planet Life,' I can forget all my fears.

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho Hoooo.
Dialogue: Ho Ho Hoooo.

Original: Bugenhagen: ...no time to be humming now. The planet is nearing imminent death. Where is Cloud? Wasn't he with you?
Dialogue: ...no time to be humming now. The planet is nearing imminent death. Where is Cloud? Wasn't he with you?

Original: Tifa: That's why we're here... Cloud... Cloud has...
Dialogue: That's why we're here... Cloud... Cloud has...

Original: Bugenhagen: I see... Cloud has......
Dialogue: I see... Cloud has......

Original: Bugenhagen: It's true that there are several places on the planet where Lifestream is gathered. But most of those places are below the surface where humans cannot reach them. There's only one place An island floating in the Southern Sea...
Dialogue: It's true that there are several places on the planet where Lifestream is gathered. But most of those places are below the surface where humans cannot reach them. There's only one place An island floating in the Southern Sea...

Original: Bugenhagen: What did you say? I haven't left here in years... No good. I can't remember.
Dialogue: What did you say? I haven't left here in years... No good. I can't remember.

Original: Bugenhagen: In the Southern Seas I think there was an island where Lifestream is. But even if you find Cloud there... Life's dream is a mass of spiritual energy, and one person alone probably couldn't stand against such an incredible spiritual current...
Dialogue: In the Southern Seas I think there was an island where Lifestream is. But even if you find Cloud there... Life's dream is a mass of spiritual energy, and one person alone probably couldn't stand against such an incredible spiritual current...

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho Hoooo.
Dialogue: Ho Ho Hoooo.

Original: Bugenhagen:...no time to be humming now. The planet is nearing imminent death. But is this perhaps, what the planet wanted? The planet actually wanted to end like this? I don't believe so. Were it not so, you people would still have much to do. And myself too. Come back whenever you are in need of my knowledge.
Dialogue: ...no time to be humming now. The planet is nearing imminent death. But is this perhaps, what the planet wanted? The planet actually wanted to end like this? I don't believe so. Were it not so, you people would still have much to do. And myself too. Come back whenever you are in need of my knowledge.

Original: Bugenhagen: Listening to you and Nanaki speak has made me feel young again. Ho Ho Hoooo. Might sound a little sarcastic.
Dialogue: Listening to you and Nanaki speak has made me feel young again. Ho Ho Hoooo. Might sound a little sarcastic.

Original: Bugenhagen: You are using Shinra materia, as a weapon? Materia is highly dense spiritual energy. A shred of the planet's life. It should not be used as a weapon. We must stop using it... or the planet will become weakened.
Dialogue: You are using Shinra materia, as a weapon? Materia is highly dense spiritual energy. A shred of the planet's life. It should not be used as a weapon. We must stop using it... or the planet will become weakened.

Original: Bugenhagen: Ho Ho.......Hoooo. You......? It's been a while...since I've been out. I think I must have...tired myself out a bit.
Dialogue: Ho Ho.......Hoooo. You......? It's been a while...since I've been out. I think I must have...tired myself out a bit.

Original: Bugenhagen: Ahh......don't tell Nanaki. He'll only worry...
Dialogue: Ahh......don't tell Nanaki. He'll only worry...

Original: Cloud: Huge Materia... It is glowing strangely...
Dialogue: Huge Materia... It is glowing strangely...

Original: On-screen: The Huge Materia emitted a quiet glow.
Dialogue: The Huge Materia emitted a quiet glow.

Original: Cloud: This color...it's the same color as command Materia.
Dialogue: This color...it's the same color as command Materia.

Original: On-screen: Command Materia Blend
Dialogue: Command Materia Blend

Original: On-screen: Received "Master Command" Materia!
Dialogue: Received "Master Command" Materia!

Original: On-screen: The Huge Materia emitted a gentle glow.
Dialogue: The Huge Materia emitted a gentle glow.

Original: Cloud: This color...it's the same color as magic Materia.
Dialogue: This color...it's the same color as magic Materia.

Original: On-screen: Magic Materia Blend
Dialogue: Magic Materia Blend

Original: On-screen: Received "Master Magic" Materia!
Dialogue: Received "Master Magic" Materia!

Original: On-screen: The Huge Materia emitted a fiery glow.
Dialogue: The Huge Materia emitted a fiery glow.

Original: Cloud: This color...it's the same color as summoned Materia.
Dialogue: This color...it's the same color as summoned Materia.

Original: On-screen: Summoned Materia Blend
Dialogue: Summoned Materia Blend

Original: On-screen: Received "Master Summon" Materia!
Dialogue: Received "Master Summon" Materia!

Original: On-screen: The Huge Materia emitted a cold glow.
Dialogue: The Huge Materia emitted a cold glow.

Original: Cloud: Is that... Bahamut...?
Dialogue: Is that... Bahamut...?

Original: On-screen: "Bahamut", "Neo Bahamut" Materia glows brightly.
Dialogue: "Bahamut", "Neo Bahamut" Materia glows brightly.

Original: Elder Hargo: I hope great Bugenhagen will take care and not overexert himself. 'Ho Ho Hoooo.' I may be light, But I'm not as young as Nanaki.
Dialogue: I hope great Bugenhagen will take care and not overexert himself. 'Ho Ho Hoooo.' I may be light, But I'm not as young as Nanaki.

Original: Elder Hargo: Oops. That will only get you angry. You're just like me. Ho ho ho.
Dialogue: Oops. That will only get you angry. You're just like me. Ho ho ho.

Original: (Upon entering Bugenhagen's house with Red XIII in the party, after defeating Hojo.)Red XIII: Grandfather!!
Dialogue: Grandfather!!

Original: Bugenhagen: ...Nanaki...? ...you're still......here?
Dialogue: ...Nanaki...? ...you're still......here?

Original: Red XIII: I can't leave you like this, grandfather...! It's the duty of my... Seto's son, to guard this canyon and her people...
Dialogue: I can't leave you like this, grandfather...! It's the duty of my... Seto's son, to guard this canyon and her people...

Original: Bugenhagen: ...listen, Nanaki. I think you may already know. If you have any mission in life, it is not to defend this valley. Look at the withering mountain grass. Listen to the warble of the new born chocobo's. Look always to the eternal flow of time which is far greater than the span of a human life. It will teach you more, than staying here in the valley...
Dialogue: ...listen, Nanaki. I think you may already know. If you have any mission in life, it is not to defend this valley. Look at the withering mountain grass. Listen to the warble of the new born chocobo's. Look always to the eternal flow of time which is far greater than the span of a human life. It will teach you more, than staying here in the valley...

Original: Bugenhagen: What you will see will eventually become a part of life's dream. For my children...... And for your children...... So please, Nanaki... Go with Cloud... And with your eyes...your ears...
Dialogue: What you will see will eventually become a part of life's dream. For my children...... And for your children...... So please, Nanaki... Go with Cloud... And with your eyes...your ears...

Original: Red XIII: .........
Bugenhagen: Ho Ho.......Hoooo. Now, now. Don't look like that. I'm all right. It's a wide world and you must go out and see it... You may even find your life's mate. You never know.
Dialogue: Ho Ho.......Hoooo. Now, now. Don't look like that. I'm all right. It's a wide world and you must go out and see it... You may even find your life's mate. You never know.

Original: Red XIII: Grandfather......
Dialogue: Grandfather......

Original: Bugenhagen: Oh yes...take this along. I think it will look good on you now. Ho Ho......
Dialogue: Oh yes...take this along. I think it will look good on you now. Ho Ho......

Original: Cloud: Red XIII... Is Bugenhagen...?
Dialogue: Red XIII... Is Bugenhagen...?

Original: Red XIII: ......
Red XIII: Grandpa told me that he's going away again!
Dialogue: Grandpa told me that he's going away again!

Original: Cloud: Away...?
Dialogue: Away...?

Original: Red XIII: It seems like he really liked that Airship. He told me he couldn't stay still and just zipped out of here! He even gave me a gift, look!
Dialogue: It seems like he really liked that Airship. He told me he couldn't stay still and just zipped out of here! He even gave me a gift, look!

Original: On-screen: Received "Limited Moon"!
Dialogue: Received "Limited Moon"!

Original: Red XIII: Wait a minute. Aren't you supposed to give gifts AFTER you come back? Ha ha......Grandpa sure is strange! Haa...ha ha......ha......
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Aren't you supposed to give gifts AFTER you come back? Ha ha......Grandpa sure is strange! Haa...ha ha......ha......

Original: Cloud: Hmm... So maybe we'll run into him again somewhere.
Dialogue: Hmm... So maybe we'll run into him again somewhere.

Original: Red XIII: Yeah... maybe... Thanks, Cloud......
Dialogue: Yeah... maybe... Thanks, Cloud......

Original: Cloud: Play the piano......?
Dialogue: Play the piano......?

Original: Cloud: ...Now, how did this go?
Dialogue: ...Now, how did this go?

Original: Cloud: I've heard this melody somewhere before. Managed to play well...
Dialogue: I've heard this melody somewhere before. Managed to play well...

Original: Cloud: I wonder what...this is...
Dialogue: I wonder what...this is...

Original: On-screen: Tifa's secret savings, 1 gil came out of the keyboard.
Dialogue: Tifa's secret savings, 1 gil came out of the keyboard.

Original: NPC: Wooooo-----ooow...... He's ...calling......Sephiroth...... is......calling......
Dialogue: Wooooo-----ooow...... He's ...calling......Sephiroth...... is......calling......

Original: NPC: Got "Mind Plus!"
Dialogue: Got "Mind Plus!"

Original: NPC: The...Great...Se...phi......roth...... is...near...... In...side......inside...the Mansion...... Urrrrrrrgh......the great......Sephi......roth
Dialogue: The...Great...Se...phi......roth...... is...near...... In...side......inside...the Mansion...... Urrrrrrrgh......the great......Sephi......roth

Dialogue: "Periodic Report to Professor Hojo" 1 Clone Activity Report Unfortunately, no 'CLONES'have left this town this quarter. As previously reported, the 'CLONES 'seem to be sensing something. But all they say is, 'reunion' or 'Sephiroth' and show no other signs of activity.

Original: On-screen: Tifa, what's happened to our town? Was it all an illusion, or just a dream? No, it was neither. I remember trying to get people out of the flames, but not having the strength... Burning with anger, I went to the reactor to kill Sephiroth.
Dialogue: Tifa, what's happened to our town? Was it all an illusion, or just a dream? No, it was neither. I remember trying to get people out of the flames, but not having the strength... Burning with anger, I went to the reactor to kill Sephiroth.

Dialogue: Received "Final Heaven"

Dialogue: How can you shop at a time like this?

Dialogue: What? 'Me, in business'? Don't worry, it's all right. I get paid by the company. My real job is to protect the secret of Nibelheim.

Dialogue: What? Secret? We don't have a clue. But it's all right. It's all over anyway! The end, the end, the end!! Yeah, even as we speak, Meteor...! The End...!

Dialogue: What's going to happen to this planet!? What the hell's Shinra doing!?

Dialogue: Something is written on the floor. (2) Left 10

Dialogue: I must get rid of all those that stand in the way of my research. Even that one from the Turks.

Dialogue: I woke ya up. Ya outta be thankin' me.

Original: Red XIII: ...You don't look good.

Dialogue: Hmph...a nightmare...? My long sleep has given me time to atone.

Dialogue: ...That's for sure.

Dialogue: ...What? More?

Dialogue: Like you said, this mansion is the beginning of a nightmare. No, it's not a dream, it's for real. Sephiroth has lost his mind. He found the secrets hidden in this mansion...

Dialogue: Just like you said, this mansion is the start of a nightmare... No, not a dream...it's reality. Sephiroth has lost his mind. He found the secrets hidden in this mansion...

Dialogue: It's like you said, this mansion's the beginning of a nightmare. No, it's not a dream, it's the truth. Sephiroth's gone nuts. He found a ton of secrets hidden in this mansion...

Dialogue: So Sephiroth knows he was created five years ago? And about the Jenova Project?

Dialogue: ...He was missing, but has just recently reappeared. He has taken many lives and is seeking the Promised Land.

Dialogue: Now it's your turn.

Dialogue: .......Lucrecia.

Dialogue: ...gave birth...? Wasn't Jenova Sephiroth's mother?

Dialogue: That isn't completely wrong, but just a theory. He was born from a beautiful lady. That lady was Lucrecia. She was an assistant to Professor Gast of the Jenova Project. Beautiful...Lucrecia.

Dialogue: ...A human experiment?

Original: Vincent: There was no way to cancel the experiment. I couldn't stop her. That was my sin. I let the one I loved, the one I respected most, face the worst.
Dialogue: There was no way to cancel the experiment. I couldn't stop her. That was my sin. I let the one I loved, the one I respected most, face the worst.

Dialogue: That why you started sleepin' in a box? Gimme a break!

Dialogue: So the punishment was sleep? That's weird.

Dialogue: So you slept as punishment? Isn't that strange? That thinking...

Dialogue: You think that's punishing yourself? You're just sleeping.

Dialogue: Wait! If I go with you will I meet Hojo?

Dialogue: Dunno. But we're after him and Sephiroth. So, I guess sooner or later...

Dialogue: Hmm, I don't know. But we're going after Hojo and Sephiroth. So, we might......

Dialogue: I dunno. But we're going after him and Sephiroth. So there's a good chance...

Dialogue: Lucrecia...

Dialogue: What? You're coming with us?

Dialogue: Hey, hold on sleepy. You're pretty damn pushy!

Dialogue: All right, I understand.

Dialogue: Alright then.

Dialogue: Sorry to get you into this. For me, it's a kinda hobby. But, out of appreciation, let me give you this.

Original: On-screen: Received "Yoshiyuki"!
Dialogue: Received "Yoshiyuki"!

Original: NPC: I wish you'd take care of it and use it...
Dialogue: I wish you'd take care of it and use it...

Dialogue: Yes sir. Thank you!

Dialogue: Excuse me... You don't have enough money.

Original: NPC: Well then, come by again sometime.
Dialogue: Well then, come by again sometime.

Original: NPC: ...I'm in here.
Dialogue: ...I'm in here.

Dialogue: There're tons of what look like antique guns. ...I bet the owner of this store was a real gun fanatic.

Original: NPC: Mmm, I'm so bored. Isn't there anything that can get me excited?
Dialogue: Mmm, I'm so bored. Isn't there anything that can get me excited?

Original: NPC: Geeeeez, it's boring! Isn't anything exciting going to happen here?
Dialogue: Geeeeez, it's boring! Isn't anything exciting going to happen here?

Dialogue: Welcome! This is the Item Shop.

Original: NPC: All gramps does is gaze at that rocket all day long.
Dialogue: All gramps does is gaze at that rocket all day long.

Original: NPC: Well he's a man that really loves machinery...
Dialogue: Well he's a man that really loves machinery...

Original: NPC: This used to be a Shinra base where they used to launch rockets. You saw the leaning rocket, right? That's Shinra No. 26. It never got off the ground though.
Dialogue: This used to be a Shinra base where they used to launch rockets. You saw the leaning rocket, right? That's Shinra No. 26. It never got off the ground though.

Original: NPC: Because those Shinra creeps locked us up in our houses, we couldn't even watch the rocket lift off. I never thought that my only hobby would be destroyed by that arrogant young Rufus...!
Dialogue: Because those Shinra creeps locked us up in our houses, we couldn't even watch the rocket lift off. I never thought that my only hobby would be destroyed by that arrogant young Rufus...!

Original: NPC: It just looms there. That's how the town got its name... 'Shinra No. 26'. Want to look at the rocket with me?
Dialogue: It just looms there. That's how the town got its name... 'Shinra No. 26'. Want to look at the rocket with me?

Original: NPC: I get so impressed every time I look at it.
Dialogue: I get so impressed every time I look at it.

Original: NPC: Oh, how boring...
Dialogue: Oh, how boring...

Dialogue: Better ask the Captain about this town. He's the one in charge of it.

Dialogue: Who's the 'Captain'?

Original: NPC: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.
Dialogue: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.

Dialogue: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?

Original: Cloud: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?
Dialogue: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?

Original: NPC: A man in a Black Cape? Nope...don't know a thing about it.

Original: Cloud: Who's the 'Captain'?
Dialogue: Who's the 'Captain'?

Original: NPC: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.
Dialogue: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.

Dialogue: That rusted out rocket is all that remains of the Shinra's Space Program.

Original: NPC: Oh, it's you? I heard you and the Captain really made a BANG! I also heard that Rufus was so pissed off he went on a rampage and that no one's been able to get near him!
Dialogue: Oh, it's you? I heard you and the Captain really made a BANG! I also heard that Rufus was so pissed off he went on a rampage and that no one's been able to get near him!

Dialogue: Everyone in this town was a mechanic back when they were planning to launch the rocket.

Original: NPC: I heard Tiny Bronco broke... That sucks. I was secretly eyeing that thing. Broke, huh? What a drag.
Dialogue: I heard Tiny Bronco broke... That sucks. I was secretly eyeing that thing. Broke, huh? What a drag.

Dialogue: Welcome to the Shanghai Inn! It's 100 gil a night. Would you like to spend the night?

Original: NPC: Excuse me. Please don't come in here. Our books and the room keys are in here, so I'll have to ask you to please stay out.
Dialogue: Excuse me. Please don't come in here. Our books and the room keys are in here, so I'll have to ask you to please stay out.

Original: Cloud: The books... Maybe we could find out who's been here?
Dialogue: The books... Maybe we could find out who's been here?

Original: NPC: A man with a Black Cape? No, no one like that has ever stayed here.
Dialogue: A man with a Black Cape? No, no one like that has ever stayed here.

Original: NPC: Look, we're all adults here, So I'd appreciate it if you used some discretion.
Dialogue: Look, we're all adults here, So I'd appreciate it if you used some discretion.

Original: NPC: Would you like something to drink?
Dialogue: Would you like something to drink?

Original: NPC: Did you meet the Captain already? He's really the town's representative, so you should really talk with him.
Dialogue: Did you meet the Captain already? He's really the town's representative, so you should really talk with him.

Original: NPC: Cid's had some bad breaks. It's really no one's fault he couldn't go into space. Just bad luck, I guess...
Dialogue: Cid's had some bad breaks. It's really no one's fault he couldn't go into space. Just bad luck, I guess...

Original: NPC: Y'know, I heard Rufus rushed back to headquarters in Midgar...
Dialogue: Y'know, I heard Rufus rushed back to headquarters in Midgar...

Original: NPC: Better ask the Captain about this town. He's the one in charge of it.
Dialogue: Better ask the Captain about this town. He's the one in charge of it.

Original: Cloud: Who's the 'Captain'?
Dialogue: Who's the 'Captain'?

Original: NPC: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.
Dialogue: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.

Original: Cloud: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?
Dialogue: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?

Original: NPC: A man in a Black Cape? Nope...don't know a thing about it.
Dialogue: A man in a Black Cape? Nope...don't know a thing about it.

Original: Cloud: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?
Dialogue: Did you see a man in a Black Cape?

Original: NPC: A man in a Black Cape? Nope...don't know a thing about it.
Dialogue: A man in a Black Cape? Nope...don't know a thing about it.

Original: Cloud: Who's the 'Captain'?
Dialogue: Who's the 'Captain'?

Original: NPC: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.
Dialogue: The Captain was a pilot when Shinra was still interested in their Space Program. He was going to be the world's first astronaut, but there was an accident... Ever since then, he's been wasting his life away here dreaming about going into outer space.

Original: NPC: A drink will ease your heart...
Dialogue: A drink will ease your heart...

Original: NPC: How long's that guy gonna be in the bathroom? I need to go too...
Dialogue: How long's that guy gonna be in the bathroom? I need to go too...

Original: NPC: Hmm. Is it real or fake?
Dialogue: Hmm. Is it real or fake?

Original: Shera: I'll take care of everything at home. But please take care of the Captain.
Dialogue: I'll take care of everything at home. But please take care of the Captain.

Original: NPC: Shinra's trying to gather the Huge Materia from Corel and Fort Condor. There are four left, and they're transporting them here. I can't stand the thought of them using my rocket for something like this.
Dialogue: Shinra's trying to gather the Huge Materia from Corel and Fort Condor. There are four left, and they're transporting them here. I can't stand the thought of them using my rocket for something like this.

Original: NPC: Shinra's trying to gather the Huge Materia from the Junon Underwater Reactor. There are four left, and they're transporting them here. I can't stand them using my precious rocket for a thing like this.
Dialogue: Shinra's trying to gather the Huge Materia from the Junon Underwater Reactor. There are four left, and they're transporting them here. I can't stand them using my precious rocket for a thing like this.

Original: NPC: There's a bunch of Shinra people here messin' with the rocket... Is my rocket...all right?
Dialogue: There's a bunch of Shinra people here messin' with the rocket... Is my rocket...all right?

Original: NPC: My, my precious rocket... It's gone.
Dialogue: My, my precious rocket... It's gone.

Original: NPC: Hmph, I know. No matter how much I look, the rocket's still gone. But I just can't stop it. Just call it an old man's folly if you will.
Dialogue: Hmph, I know. No matter how much I look, the rocket's still gone. But I just can't stop it. Just call it an old man's folly if you will.

Original: NPC: Sorry to get you into this. For me, it's a kinda hobby. But, out of appreciation, let me give you this.
Dialogue: Sorry to get you into this. For me, it's a kinda hobby. But, out of appreciation, let me give you this.

Original: On-screen: Received "Venus Gospel"!
Dialogue: Received "Venus Gospel"!

Original: NPC: I wish you'd take care of it and use it...
Dialogue: I wish you'd take care of it and use it...

Original: NPC: Maybe it's time for me to get a new hobby...
Dialogue: Maybe it's time for me to get a new hobby...

Original: NPC: Mmm. You know that Shinra sports car at Cid's house? It might be fun to try and restore that thing...
Dialogue: Mmm. You know that Shinra sports car at Cid's house? It might be fun to try and restore that thing...

Original: NPC: Anyways. How 'bout it? Want to look at the rocket with me?
Dialogue: Anyways. How 'bout it? Want to look at the rocket with me?

Original: NPC: It seems like there's a lot happenin' in the outside world, but as long as I got this rocket... I'm satisfied.
Dialogue: It seems like there's a lot happenin' in the outside world, but as long as I got this rocket... I'm satisfied.

Original: NPC: Oh, how boring...
Dialogue: Oh, how boring...

Original: NPC: If things go on like this, then Meteor's just going to smash right into us and kill us all, right? ......I guess that's life?
Dialogue: If things go on like this, then Meteor's just going to smash right into us and kill us all, right? ......I guess that's life?

Original: NPC: The Shinra serious 'bout launching that piece of crap rocket? But why now...?
Dialogue: The Shinra serious 'bout launching that piece of crap rocket? But why now...?

Original: NPC: I get so restless now that the rocket's gone. And now that we can see Meteor clearly, ...I can't stand it.
Dialogue: I get so restless now that the rocket's gone. And now that we can see Meteor clearly, ...I can't stand it.

Original: NPC: Look up at the sky. The bigger Meteor gets, the less time we have to live.
Dialogue: Look up at the sky. The bigger Meteor gets, the less time we have to live.

Original: NPC: What's young President Rufus doing by getting all those mechanics together?
Dialogue: What's young President Rufus doing by getting all those mechanics together?

Original: NPC: I still can't believe that piece of crap rocket actually made it into space... I guess the mechanic was a genius.
Dialogue: I still can't believe that piece of crap rocket actually made it into space... I guess the mechanic was a genius.

Original: NPC: Welcome to the Shanghai Inn! Only 300 gil a night, stay?
Dialogue: Welcome to the Shanghai Inn! Only 300 gil a night, stay?

Original: NPC: Would you like a drink?
Dialogue: Would you like a drink?

Original: NPC: You don't feel comfortable here? Then, every time you look in the sky you see Meteor.
Dialogue: You don't feel comfortable here? Then, every time you look in the sky you see Meteor.

Original: NPC: Would you like something to drink?
Dialogue: Would you like something to drink?

Original: NPC: You don't feel comfortable here? Then, every time you look in the sky you see Meteor.
Dialogue: You don't feel comfortable here? Then, every time you look in the sky you see Meteor.

Original: NPC: Seems like Palmer of Shinra, Inc. ordered soldiers to restore the rocket...
Dialogue: Seems like Palmer of Shinra, Inc. ordered soldiers to restore the rocket...

Original: NPC: Even though they failed to blow up Meteor with the rocket, the Shinra haven't given up yet... Looks like they're gathering all the weapons from all their bases and are preparing for a final showdown.
Dialogue: Even though they failed to blow up Meteor with the rocket, the Shinra haven't given up yet... Looks like they're gathering all the weapons from all their bases and are preparing for a final showdown.

Original: NPC: I heard a rumor that a Shinra airship carrying a secret weapon was attacked by a monster and sunk to the bottom of the sea...
Dialogue: I heard a rumor that a Shinra airship carrying a secret weapon was attacked by a monster and sunk to the bottom of the sea...

Original: NPC: Meteor's coming toward us!? And I can't even go to the bathroom...!?
Dialogue: Meteor's coming toward us!? And I can't even go to the bathroom...!?

Original: NPC: Even with all this goin' on outside, that guy still won't come out of the bathroom? He must be a damn water tank!?
Dialogue: Even with all this goin' on outside, that guy still won't come out of the bathroom? He must be a damn water tank!?

Original: NPC: OK, which is it gonna be? Meteor hits us first, or that guy comes out of the bathroom? I'm not movin' from this spot till I see it with my own eyes.
Dialogue: OK, which is it gonna be? Meteor hits us first, or that guy comes out of the bathroom? I'm not movin' from this spot till I see it with my own eyes.

Original: NPC: Mmmm... I'm starting to see it now...
Dialogue: Mmmm... I'm starting to see it now...

Original: NPC: Even the rocket launch wasn't all THAT great.
Dialogue: Even the rocket launch wasn't all THAT great.

Original: NPC: Now that one of Shinra's greatest events is over, I guess it's back to the same old boring everyday life again...
Dialogue: Now that one of Shinra's greatest events is over, I guess it's back to the same old boring everyday life again...

Original: NPC: Is Gramps gonna stay like that even though rocket's gone?
Dialogue: Is Gramps gonna stay like that even though rocket's gone?

Original: Shera: ...What's going to happen?
Dialogue: ...What's going to happen?

Original: Shera: Now all we have to take care of is Meteor, right? You should be able...
Dialogue: Now all we have to take care of is Meteor, right? You should be able...

Original: Shera: Excuse me... ...Please take care of the Captain.
Dialogue: Excuse me... ...Please take care of the Captain.

Original: On-screen: Pub[Turtle's Paradise] Publicity Flyers! Notice
Dialogue: Pub[Turtle's Paradise] Publicity Flyers! Notice

Original: NPC 1: Oh, how exciting. You a friend of my grandson's?
Dialogue: Oh, how exciting. You a friend of my grandson's?

Original: NPC 2: No, Gramps! These guy's are creepy! They're runnin' all over the place!
Dialogue: No, Gramps! These guy's are creepy! They're runnin' all over the place!

Original: On-screen: [Turtle's Paradise] No. 6
Dialogue: [Turtle's Paradise] No. 6

Original: NPC: Congrats! You have just found all six flyers for the "Turtles Paradise"! How wonderful! Now here is your prize, just as we promised!!
Dialogue: Congrats! You have just found all six flyers for the "Turtles Paradise"! How wonderful! Now here is your prize, just as we promised!!

Original: On-screen: Received "Power Source"!
Dialogue: Received "Power Source"!

Original: NPC: Please come again to "Turtles Paradise"! We're looking forward to seeing you!
Dialogue: Please come again to "Turtles Paradise"! We're looking forward to seeing you!

Original: Tifa: Phew......
Dialogue: Phew......

Original: Cid: Well......
Dialogue: Well......

Original: Cloud: Whoa!!
Dialogue: Whoa!!

Original: Cloud: Can't go through here... That flame would make crispy critters of us in an instant.
Dialogue: Can't go through here... That flame would make crispy critters of us in an instant.

Original: Tifa: Eyaaaah!
Dialogue: Eyaaaah!

Original: Tifa: There is no way past this!
Dialogue: There is no way past this!

Original: Cid: Damn, that's hot!
Dialogue: Damn, that's hot!

Original: Cid: I like hot baths, but this is TOO hot!
Dialogue: I like hot baths, but this is TOO hot!

Original: On-screen: "The Scale of the Sea God" shines!
Dialogue: "The Scale of the Sea God" shines!

Original: NPC: Life is just like the flowing of a river. It flows from the large ocean of life, and eventually it returns back to it. Wutai is a historical place. There are some very unusual things here you should see.
Dialogue: Life is just like the flowing of a river. It flows from the large ocean of life, and eventually it returns back to it. Wutai is a historical place. There are some very unusual things here you should see.

Original: NPC: Materia is like Life. They both come from the large ocean of life, and both must return to it.
Dialogue: Materia is like Life. They both come from the large ocean of life, and both must return to it.

Original: NPC: Alright, alright, alright! I know! On the side of the mountain, right there in your face is Da-chao! I hear you can climb to the top, but since it's dangerous I'd be mighty careful if I were you!
Dialogue: Alright, alright, alright! I know! On the side of the mountain, right there in your face is Da-chao! I hear you can climb to the top, but since it's dangerous I'd be mighty careful if I were you!

Original: NPC: Why Da-chao? Alright, alright, alright! I don't know!
Dialogue: Why Da-chao? Alright, alright, alright! I don't know!

Original: NPC: Lord Godo is in this house. He used to be quite strong, but now,all he does is sleep......
Dialogue: Lord Godo is in this house. He used to be quite strong, but now,all he does is sleep......

Original: NPC: She's always getting into fights But in that, she takes after Godo to a tee. Like father like daughter...
Dialogue: She's always getting into fights But in that, she takes after Godo to a tee. Like father like daughter...

Original: NPC: That five-storied pagoda over there is called the Pagoda of the Five Mighty Gods... The Five Gods are Power, Speed, Magic, War and Omni, who has the best characteristics of everything. Since ancient times, we in Wutai, have worshipped Da-chao and the Water God. Legend has it that the village has been protected by Da-chao, the Water God, and the Five Mighty Gods. But in the last battle, we didn't fare so well... I guess our beliefs were based on nothing more than legends.
Dialogue: That five-storied pagoda over there is called the Pagoda of the Five Mighty Gods... The Five Gods are Power, Speed, Magic, War and Omni, who has the best characteristics of everything. Since ancient times, we in Wutai, have worshipped Da-chao and the Water God. Legend has it that the village has been protected by Da-chao, the Water God, and the Five Mighty Gods. But in the last battle, we didn't fare so well... I guess our beliefs were based on nothing more than legends.

Original: NPC 1: Well, well. Long time no see. What have you been up to? Let's see...what was your name?
Dialogue: Well, well. Long time no see. What have you been up to? Let's see...what was your name?

Original: NPC 2: No, Gramps! This isn't anyone you know! This is just some stranger who barged into our house!
Dialogue: No, Gramps! This isn't anyone you know! This is just some stranger who barged into our house!

Original: NPC: Hey yo! Welcome! Strike while the iron's hot, I say! We got some of the best blades right out of the furnace!
Dialogue: Hey yo! Welcome! Strike while the iron's hot, I say! We got some of the best blades right out of the furnace!

Original: NPC: Listen, I'm sorry about last time. Yuffie told me not to sell anything to you.
Dialogue: Listen, I'm sorry about last time. Yuffie told me not to sell anything to you.

Original: NPC: Hey, hey, welcome! You on a trip? Well, just relax and make yourself at home. Nowadays, thanks to tourism, Wutai's able to get by.
Dialogue: Hey, hey, welcome! You on a trip? Well, just relax and make yourself at home. Nowadays, thanks to tourism, Wutai's able to get by.

Original: NPC: Seems like the town got really boisterous since you arrived. Did anything happen?
Dialogue: Seems like the town got really boisterous since you arrived. Did anything happen?

Original: NPC: Hey. Did you hear? There used to be a Water God here in Wutai. They say the Water God was a huge snake! Now we live in a world filled with Mako. Not many people would believe in something like that now. But some in the world, and here in Wutai, still believe. Believe in the scales of the Water God and in materia that has its power in it.
Dialogue: Hey. Did you hear? There used to be a Water God here in Wutai. They say the Water God was a huge snake! Now we live in a world filled with Mako. Not many people would believe in something like that now. But some in the world, and here in Wutai, still believe. Believe in the scales of the Water God and in materia that has its power in it.

Original: NPC: We got a lot of different stuff here. Take what you want.
Dialogue: We got a lot of different stuff here. Take what you want.

Original: NPC: I'm sorry. The sign outside says "Materia", but there's almost no materia left anywhere in Wutai. Listen, this is just a backwoods town. We don't have much to do with Shinra, and besides... If we had a lot of materia, Wutai would be a much more exciting town, but we don't...
Dialogue: I'm sorry. The sign outside says "Materia", but there's almost no materia left anywhere in Wutai. Listen, this is just a backwoods town. We don't have much to do with Shinra, and besides... If we had a lot of materia, Wutai would be a much more exciting town, but we don't...

Original: (Upon talking to the woman walking on the right side of the town.)NPC: Life is like the dew on the leaves of the trees. Whether that planet falls or not is no more than a fleeting glimmer.
Dialogue: Life is like the dew on the leaves of the trees. Whether that planet falls or not is no more than a fleeting glimmer.

Original: NPC: When that big star bashes into us, both Wutai and Da-chao are going to be dust! Can't we do something?
Dialogue: When that big star bashes into us, both Wutai and Da-chao are going to be dust! Can't we do something?

Original: NPC: The end is right in front of us... But what can you do about it? Just go on living your life day in and day out...
Dialogue: The end is right in front of us... But what can you do about it? Just go on living your life day in and day out...

Original: NPC: Have you ever heard the story of the scales of the Water God? They're not just regular scales. They have special hidden powers. And are impervious to the strongest flames. But of course I don't think they'd stand up to the fire that huge eerie-lookin' Planet's gonna make when it crashes into us...
Dialogue: Have you ever heard the story of the scales of the Water God? They're not just regular scales. They have special hidden powers. And are impervious to the strongest flames. But of course I don't think they'd stand up to the fire that huge eerie-lookin' Planet's gonna make when it crashes into us...

Original: NPC 1: Oh, you know lately things have been like that. You can even see the moon in afternoon. Everyone's celebrating.
Dialogue: Oh, you know lately things have been like that. You can even see the moon in afternoon. Everyone's celebrating.

Original: NPC 2: No, Gramps! That's a big red planet in the sky! Everyone's scared of it!!
Dialogue: No, Gramps! That's a big red planet in the sky! Everyone's scared of it!!

Original: NPC: Hey yo! Welcome! You aren't tired of my babbling? Great! Then come on in and start buying!
Dialogue: Hey yo! Welcome! You aren't tired of my babbling? Great! Then come on in and start buying!

Original: NPC: This is a weapons store of the hard cores, by the hard cores, and for the hard cores! Come on and take a look, why doncha!?
Dialogue: This is a weapons store of the hard cores, by the hard cores, and for the hard cores! Come on and take a look, why doncha!?

Original: NPC: First the ground started shaking, then that large star...... Yy, you think... It's all over?
Dialogue: First the ground started shaking, then that large star...... Yy, you think... It's all over?

Original: NPC: Hey. Things look pretty sad around here. With things the way they are in the world I guess there's nothing I can do about it. Running around like a fool won't help matters any. So, we all might as well sit back and have a beer...
Dialogue: Hey. Things look pretty sad around here. With things the way they are in the world I guess there's nothing I can do about it. Running around like a fool won't help matters any. So, we all might as well sit back and have a beer...

Original: NPC: You're still gonna sit here and buy stuff at a time like this? You're an odd one...
Dialogue: You're still gonna sit here and buy stuff at a time like this? You're an odd one...

Original: NPC: And now it's too late to be worrying about materia at this stage of the game... If you see anything you need, buy it.
Dialogue: And now it's too late to be worrying about materia at this stage of the game... If you see anything you need, buy it.

Original: NPC: Help me. Help me. Help me...... He's in the pagoda next to Lord Godo. Lord Godo says we're stuck... num, num...... I hope the planet doesn't fall anywhere around here......
Dialogue: Help me. Help me. Help me...... He's in the pagoda next to Lord Godo. Lord Godo says we're stuck... num, num...... I hope the planet doesn't fall anywhere around here......

Original: Zack: Hey! This is your food.
Dialogue: Hey! This is your food.

Original: Zack: Oh,here!! Put on this. It smells a little though don't complain.
Dialogue: Oh,here!! Put on this. It smells a little though don't complain.

Original: Zack: You look pretty good with that.
Dialogue: You look pretty good with that.

Original: Zack: Well......
Dialogue: Well......

Original: Zack: Yo! Old guy! We at Midgar yet?
Dialogue: Yo! Old guy! We at Midgar yet?

Original: NPC: Shaddap! You're lucky I even gave you a ride!
Dialogue: Shaddap! You're lucky I even gave you a ride!

Original: Zack: What're you gonna do once we get to Midgar?
Dialogue: What're you gonna do once we get to Midgar?

Original: Zack: I know what I'm gonna do. I got a place I can crash for a while...
Dialogue: I know what I'm gonna do. I got a place I can crash for a while...

Original: Zack: No wait, the mother lives there, too... Guess that's out...
Dialogue: No wait, the mother lives there, too... Guess that's out...

Original: Zack: Yep...gotta change my plans!
Dialogue: Yep...gotta change my plans!

Original: Zack: Hmm...... No matter what I do, I need some money first...
Dialogue: Hmm...... No matter what I do, I need some money first...

Original: Zack: ...Hey, wanna start a business? But what could we do?
Dialogue: ...Hey, wanna start a business? But what could we do?

Original: Zack: Hey, Cloud. Think there's anything I'd be good at?
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. Think there's anything I'd be good at?

Original: Zack: Hey old guy! What do you think I'd be good at?
Dialogue: Hey old guy! What do you think I'd be good at?

Original: NPC: What're you yappin' about? You're still young ain't ya? Young folks should try everything! You gotta pay your dues while you're young. Go out and look for what you really want.
Dialogue: What're you yappin' about? You're still young ain't ya? Young folks should try everything! You gotta pay your dues while you're young. Go out and look for what you really want.

Original: Zack: Try everything... That's easy for him to say...
Dialogue: Try everything... That's easy for him to say...

Original: Zack: HEY! Of course! I got a lot of brains and skill that other guys don't! That settles it! I'm gonna become a mercenary!
Dialogue: HEY! Of course! I got a lot of brains and skill that other guys don't! That settles it! I'm gonna become a mercenary!

Original: NPC: Hey...didn't you even hear a word I said?
Dialogue: Hey...didn't you even hear a word I said?

Original: Zack: Yeah! Thanks pops!
Dialogue: Yeah! Thanks pops!

Original: Zack: Listen, I'm gonna become a mercenary and that's that. Boring stuff, dangerous stuff, anything for money. I'm gonna be rich!
Dialogue: Listen, I'm gonna become a mercenary and that's that. Boring stuff, dangerous stuff, anything for money. I'm gonna be rich!

Original: NPC: No, wait...you got it all wrong.
Dialogue: No, wait...you got it all wrong.

Original: Zack: So, Cloud? What are YOU gonna do?
Dialogue: So, Cloud? What are YOU gonna do?

Original: Cloud: u...uhhh......
Zack: Just kidding... I won't leave you hanging like that.
Dialogue: Just kidding... I won't leave you hanging like that.

Original: Zack: ...We're friends, right? Mercenaries, Cloud. That's what you an' me are gonna be. Understand, Cloud?
Dialogue: ...We're friends, right? Mercenaries, Cloud. That's what you an' me are gonna be. Understand, Cloud?

Original: Shinra Soldier: What do you want to do with him?
Dialogue: What do you want to do with him?

Original: Cloud: ...Ah...ughhhh......
Dialogue: ...Ah...ughhhh......

Original: Commander: ...Forget it. Just leave him.
Dialogue: ...Forget it. Just leave him.
